original: ba lang gi rdzas ni phal ba yin no //
analyzed: ba lang gi rdzas ni phal ba yin no //
translated: The substance of the cow is the substratum.

original: de de ltar na khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang phyir /
analyzed: de de ltar na khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang phyir /
translated: Thus, since the substratum and the qualifier are desired to be expressed,

original: yan lag nyid du gzung ba gang /
analyzed: yan lag nyid du gzung ba gang /
translated: the qualifier is apprehended as a part.

original: gang kho na'i khyad par nyid du gang /
analyzed: gang kho na'i khyad par nyid du gang /
translated: That which is the qualifier of that which is the substratum

original: de yang de nyid kyis gzung 'gyur /
analyzed: de yang de nyid kyis gzung 'gyur /
translated: is apprehended by that very [cognition].

original: khyad par can gzung bar 'gyur ba de ltar khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi 'dzin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: khyad par can gzung bar 'gyur ba de ltar khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi 'dzin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that way, the qualifier and the substratum are apprehended,

original: gzhan ma yin pas na yan lag lhag ma rtogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pas na yan lag lhag ma rtogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: but not otherwise, because the remaining parts are not understood.

original: ba lang ma rdzogs pa nyid mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba lang ma rdzogs pa nyid mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the cow would be seen as incomplete.

original: gang cig car du ma mi 'dzin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang cig car du ma mi 'dzin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one does not apprehend many simultaneously,

original: gzhan dang gzhan mthong ba'i yang bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po la cig car skyes bu'i blo gcig 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan mthong ba'i yang bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po la cig car skyes bu'i blo gcig 'gyur /
translated: at that time, the cognition of a person would be simultaneous with the perception of other and other things such as a pot.

original: bum pa mthong ba na yang snam bu la sogs par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa mthong ba na yang snam bu la sogs par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: And when seeing a pot, there would be the cognition of a cloth and so on.

original: de ltar na khyed kyis bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi rang bzhin nyid las snam bu la sogs pa tha dad par 'ded par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na khyed kyis bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi rang bzhin nyid las snam bu la sogs pa tha dad par 'ded par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, you would not be able to posit cloth and so on as different from the nature of the substance of a pot and so on,

original: dngos po tsam gyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //üîΩtshad ces bya ba'i yon tan nam /
analyzed: dngos po tsam gyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa khas mi len pa'i phyir ro // tshad ces bya ba'i yon tan nam /
translated: because you do not accept that consciousness has the nature of arising from mere things.üîΩThe reason that the cognition of a pot and so on is different is because the qualities such as being an object of knowledge,

original: spyi la sogs pa tha dad par byed pa ni blo tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi la sogs pa tha dad par byed pa ni blo tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or universals and so on, which are the causes of the difference in cognition, are different.

original: re zhig dngos po rang nyid ni dngos po gzhan las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig dngos po rang nyid ni dngos po gzhan las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: First, a thing itself is not different from another thing,

original: dngos po ni dngos po gzhan rang tha dad med phyir /
analyzed: dngos po ni dngos po gzhan rang tha dad med phyir /
translated: because a thing is not different from another thing.

original: rgyu'i phyir blo tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir blo tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of that, the cognition is not different.

original: yon tan la sogs pa tha dad pa med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: yon tan la sogs pa tha dad pa med par 'gyur na /
translated: If the qualities and so on are not different,

original: yon tan la sogs pa tha dad pa'ang 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yon tan la sogs pa tha dad pa'ang 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: the cognition of the qualities and so on would not be different.

original: cig car don du ma rtogs par thal bas 'dzin pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car don du ma rtogs par thal bas 'dzin pa med phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that many objects would be cognized simultaneously, there would be no cognition.

original: de'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan mthong ba na yang blo gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan mthong ba na yang blo gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even when seeing other things, the cognition would be one.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: gal te yon tan sogs tha dad //
analyzed: gal te yon tan sogs tha dad //
translated: if one apprehends the difference of quality, etc.,

original: 'dzin na sna tshogs nyid rtogs 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dzin na sna tshogs nyid rtogs 'gyur //
translated: then one would realize the diversity.

original: sngar rdzas 'ba' zhig mthong zhing dus phyis yon tan dang spyi la sogs pa rdzas tha dad pa'i 'phrod pa 'du ba can yang yin pa de'i @198b phyir sna tshogs pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: sngar rdzas 'ba' zhig mthong zhing dus phyis yon tan dang spyi la sogs pa rdzas tha dad pa'i 'phrod pa 'du ba can yang yin pa de'i @198b phyir sna tshogs pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: If one first sees only the substance and later sees the quality, universal, etc., which are related to a different substance, then one would realize the diversity.

original: spyi la sogs pa tha dad pa gcig la 'brel ba ma yin pa'i phyir des khyad par can du byas pa'i rdzas tha dad par gyur pa de ltar na /
analyzed: spyi la sogs pa tha dad pa gcig la 'brel ba ma yin pa'i phyir des khyad par can du byas pa'i rdzas tha dad par gyur pa de ltar na /
translated: But the universal, etc., are not related to the one substance, and therefore the substance is not differentiated by them.

original: de dag la rtogs pa tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la rtogs pa tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the cognition would be different.

original: ji skad du bshad pa rnam pa tha dad pas rtogs pa tha dad pa nyid yin par bla ste /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa rnam pa tha dad pas rtogs pa tha dad pa nyid yin par bla ste /
translated: It is possible that the cognition is different because of the difference of the aspects as explained.

original: de lta na yang de ltar rtogs na yang de'i 'brel pa can ni 'chol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na yang de ltar rtogs na yang de'i 'brel pa can ni 'chol bar 'gyur /
translated: But even so, if one cognizes in that way, the related [aspects] would be confused.

original: snam bu la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams kyi 'brel pa can yon tan la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag gi 'brel pa can rnam pa 'chol par 'gyur te /
analyzed: snam bu la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams kyi 'brel pa can yon tan la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag gi 'brel pa can rnam pa 'chol par 'gyur te /
translated: The qualities, etc., which are related to the substances such as cloth, etc., would be related to a confused variety of forms.

original: spyi la sogs pa gzhan gyi sgo nas rdzas kyi khyad par gzhan nyid 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyi la sogs pa gzhan gyi sgo nas rdzas kyi khyad par gzhan nyid 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the particular substances would be apprehended by means of another, such as the universal, etc.

original: de ltar na yon tan la sogs pa 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa yin gyi rten dang bcas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na yon tan la sogs pa 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa yin gyi rten dang bcas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, only the qualities, etc. are apprehended, not along with their substratum,

original: cig car don du ma 'dzin pa thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car don du ma 'dzin pa thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that many objects would be apprehended simultaneously.

original: ji ltar gzung pa'i rdzas la 'du ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi spyi la sogs pa gdon mi za bar 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzung pa'i rdzas la 'du ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi spyi la sogs pa gdon mi za bar 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as the universal, etc. which are related to the substances as they are apprehended are not necessarily apprehended,

original: rdzas mang po mthong ba na rnam par g-yengs pa las gzhan yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas mang po mthong ba na rnam par g-yengs pa las gzhan yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when many substances are seen, one sees other things as well, due to distraction.

original: spyi la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis kyang rdzas khyad par can gzhan shes pa'i phyir rnam par nges pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: spyi la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis kyang rdzas khyad par can gzhan shes pa'i phyir rnam par nges pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: And because the particular substances are known by means of the particulars of the universal, etc., there is no determination.

original: 'brel pa can 'chol ba yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa can 'chol ba yin no //
translated: It is a random collection of related things.

original: grangs can dag gis kyang sgra la sogs pa'i ngo bo gcig tu 'dod pa'i de'i sgra dang / sgra sgrogs pa de dag ni snying stobs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis du ma nyid yin phyir /
analyzed: grangs can dag gis kyang sgra la sogs pa'i ngo bo gcig tu 'dod pa'i de'i sgra dang / sgra sgrogs pa de dag ni snying stobs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis du ma nyid yin phyir /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that the nature of sound and so on is one, but the sound of a drum and the sound of a conch are multiple because they are of the nature of sattva and so on.

original: cig car du ma 'dzin pa grub /
analyzed: cig car du ma 'dzin pa grub /
translated: Therefore it is established that many are apprehended simultaneously.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i bkod pa can rnams mi 'dzin na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i bkod pa can rnams mi 'dzin na /
translated: If the arrangement of pleasure and so on is not apprehended,

original: bde ba la sogs pa bkod pa de sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa bkod pa de sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: it is not possible to apprehend sound and so on because the arrangement of pleasure and so on is not possible.

original: bkod pa 'dzin pa na bkod pa can yang 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: bkod pa 'dzin pa na bkod pa can yang 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: When the arrangement is apprehended, the one with the arrangement is also apprehended.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi bkod pa 'dzin pa de ni de'i bkod pa can yang 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi bkod pa 'dzin pa de ni de'i bkod pa can yang 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever apprehends the arrangement of something also apprehends the one with the arrangement.

original: sor mo bkod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khu tshur 'dzin pa na sor mo 'dzin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sor mo bkod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khu tshur 'dzin pa na sor mo 'dzin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when a fist is apprehended, which is characterized by the arrangement of fingers, the fingers are also apprehended.

original: skyes bu 'di'i yang rna ba la sogs pas kyang bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo can gyi sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //üîΩthams cad las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos can du ma'i ngo bo dbang po las rnam pa thams cad du rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de 'chad par byed do //üîΩchos can cha med pa gcig ni rang bzhin tha dad pa ma @199a * //üîΩyin te / 'on kyang thams cad las kyang ldog chos can khams gsum las khyad par can du gyur pa'i rang bzhin bum pa'i ngo bo nyid gang dang gang las snam bu la sogs pa gzhan gyi ngo bo las ldog de las /
analyzed: skyes bu 'di'i yang rna ba la sogs pas kyang bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo can gyi sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so // thams cad las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos can du ma'i ngo bo dbang po las rnam pa thams cad du rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de 'chad par byed do // chos can cha med pa gcig ni rang bzhin tha dad pa ma @199a * // yin te / 'on kyang thams cad las kyang ldog chos can khams gsum las khyad par can du gyur pa'i rang bzhin bum pa'i ngo bo nyid gang dang gang las snam bu la sogs pa gzhan gyi ngo bo las ldog de las /
translated: The argument from the nature of things is as follows: ‚ÄúThe ears and so on of this person also apprehend sound and so on, which are of the nature of pleasure and so on.‚Äù

original: tha dad rtogs pa'i tha dad can //üîΩde ni snam bu la sogs pa ldog pa'i yul de las tha dad pa ni de las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad rtogs pa'i tha dad can //üîΩde ni snam bu la sogs pa ldog pa'i yul de las tha dad pa ni de las tha dad pa'o //
translated: The argument from the nature

original: du ma'i ngo bo gang la des rtogs shing khong du chud pa'i tha dad pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: du ma'i ngo bo gang la des rtogs shing khong du chud pa'i tha dad pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is the nature of many, and is different from that which is understood and comprehended by that, is called that.

original: gang dang gang las ldog pa de dang de las tha dad pa la ltos nas /
analyzed: gang dang gang las ldog pa de dang de las tha dad pa la ltos nas /
translated: From whatever it is distinguished, it is different from that, in dependence on which

original: snam bu ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos su sgro btags pa de tsam rtogs par 'gyur gyi ;
analyzed: snam bu ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos su sgro btags pa de tsam rtogs par 'gyur gyi ;
translated: the superimposition of the property of non-cloth, etc. is understood.

original: / bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos can de don dam par cha dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos can de don dam par cha dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: But that subject, which has the characteristic of a pot, etc., is not ultimately partless.

original: ngo bo tha dad de chos can gyi chos tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo tha dad de chos can gyi chos tha dad pa'o //
translated: The difference in nature is the difference in properties of the subject.

original: brtag pa yin na rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul yin gyi /
analyzed: brtag pa yin na rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul yin gyi /
translated: If it is imagined, it is the domain of conceptual consciousness,

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: but not the domain of non-conceptual mind.

original: de dag ci dang 'dra ba yin zhing dbang po'i shes pa ci 'dra ba'i spyod yul ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ci dang 'dra ba yin zhing dbang po'i shes pa ci 'dra ba'i spyod yul ma yin zhe na /
translated: What is it like, and what is the domain of sense consciousness like?

original: res 'ga' 'byung ba sna tshogs min //
analyzed: res 'ga' 'byung ba sna tshogs min //
translated: Sometimes it is not a variety of elements.

original: sna tshogs snang ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sna tshogs snang ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe appearance of variety‚Äù is stated.

original: chos can gcig la yang shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos de dag tha snyad rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i yan lag btags pa de rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa tha snyad kyi ngo bo sna tshogs la 'jug par nus pa'i yul yin no zhes 'dod
analyzed: chos can gcig la yang shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos de dag tha snyad rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i yan lag btags pa de rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa tha snyad kyi ngo bo sna tshogs la 'jug par nus pa'i yul yin no zhes 'dod
translated: It is asserted that a single basis of imputation is the object that is able to engage the various natures of conventional entities, such as the knowable and so on, which are the various aspects of conventional designations.

original: kyi / dbang po'i shes pa la snang ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyi / dbang po'i shes pa la snang ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not, however, an object that appears to a sense consciousness.

original: dbang po'i shes pa sna tshogs pa ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa sna tshogs pa ma yin pa de ni /
translated: That sense consciousness is not various.

original: chos can gcig gi ngo bor nges pa'i rang gi ngo bor 'dzin pa can yin no //
analyzed: chos can gcig gi ngo bor nges pa'i rang gi ngo bor 'dzin pa can yin no //
translated: It is a consciousness that apprehends a single basis of imputation as its nature.üîΩTherefore, how could those that are not various become the object of that which is not various?

original: de bas na sna tshogs pa ma yin pa'i sna tshogs pa de dag ji ltar yul du 'gyur zhes bya ba sna tshogs min zhes bya ba 'dis bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na sna tshogs pa ma yin pa'i sna tshogs pa de dag ji ltar yul du 'gyur zhes bya ba sna tshogs min zhes bya ba 'dis bshad do //
translated: This is explained by the phrase ‚Äúnot various.‚Äù

original: res 'ga' 'byung ba zhes bya bas ni 'di skad du gal te shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos tha dad pa brtags pa de dag dbang po'i shes pa yul du 'gyur ba de'i tshe phyi rol gyi don nye ba la ltos pa med par rnam par rtog
analyzed: res 'ga' 'byung ba zhes bya bas ni 'di skad du gal te shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos tha dad pa brtags pa de dag dbang po'i shes pa yul du 'gyur ba de'i tshe phyi rol gyi don nye ba la ltos pa med par rnam par rtog
translated: Sometimes it is called arising, which means that if those phenomena such as knowable objects that are imputed to be different were objects of sense consciousness, then conceptual consciousnesses would arise without depending on the presence of external objects.

original: pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin du rang dbang du 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin du rang dbang du 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes, the phrase ‚Äúwould occur‚Äù indicates that if those phenomena such as the object of knowledge were different, and if they were objects of sense consciousness, then they would operate independently, like conceptual consciousnesses, without relying on external objects.

original: des ni spyi dngos por yod pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni spyi dngos por yod pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: This refutes the existence of real universals.

original: gal te yang dkar po nyid la sogs spyi'i 'dra ba khyed cag gis brjod pa de lta na yang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul @199b min zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te yang dkar po nyid la sogs spyi'i 'dra ba khyed cag gis brjod pa de lta na yang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul @199b min zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Even if you describe the similarity of universals such as whiteness, they are not the objects of nonconceptual consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbang po'i spyod yul yod pa'i don gang yin pa de ni sgra yis brjod bya min /
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul yod pa'i don gang yin pa de ni sgra yis brjod bya min /
translated: The object of the sense consciousnesses is not the referent of words.

original: bdag nyid rang gis rig pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po'i spyod yul rang rig pa gang yin pa de ni bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: bdag nyid rang gis rig pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po'i spyod yul rang rig pa gang yin pa de ni bstan par mi nus so //
translated: That which is known by itself is not an object of the senses. That which is known by the senses cannot be taught.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes pa'i ngo bo tha dad phyir /
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo tha dad phyir /
translated: Because the nature of consciousness is different.

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dang dbang po'i shes pa gang yin pa 'di gnyis snang ba tha dad pa yin zhing /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dang dbang po'i shes pa gang yin pa 'di gnyis snang ba tha dad pa yin zhing /
translated: The consciousness that arises from sound and the consciousness that arises from the senses have different appearances.

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la mi snang ba gang yin pa de ni sgra'i don ma yin no //üîΩde'i phyir dkar po nyid la sogs pa ni shes pa ngo bo tha dad pa can gyis gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la mi snang ba gang yin pa de ni sgra'i don ma yin no // de'i phyir dkar po nyid la sogs pa ni shes pa ngo bo tha dad pa can gyis gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: What does not appear to the consciousness that arises from sound is not the meaning of the sound.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul ma yin par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that whiteness and so on are not objects of the sense consciousnesses because they are apprehended by consciousnesses that have a different nature.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las shes pa'i ngo bo tha dad pa can gyis gzung bar bya ba de ni de nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las shes pa'i ngo bo tha dad pa can gyis gzung bar bya ba de ni de nyid ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is apprehended by a consciousness that has a different nature from that of its object is not that object.üîΩFor example, a consciousness that arises from sound is not the meaning of the sound.

original: dper na gangs can ni rta las shes pa'i ngo bo tha dad pa can gyi gzung ba yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gangs can ni rta las shes pa'i ngo bo tha dad pa can gyi gzung ba yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the snowy mountain is the object of the cognition of horse, but it is not the object of the cognition of elephant.üîΩAnd the object of the word ‚Äúwhite‚Äù is the object of the sense faculty, but it is not the object of the cognition of ‚Äúnon-white.‚Äù

original: sgra'i yul dkar po nyid la sogs pa yang dbang po'i yul las shes pa'i ngo bo tha dad pa can gyis gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra'i yul dkar po nyid la sogs pa yang dbang po'i yul las shes pa'i ngo bo tha dad pa can gyis gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradictory property that is the reason for the difference.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: gal te don gcig nyid yin na'ang /
analyzed: gal te don gcig nyid yin na'ang /
translated: if the object is the same,

original: blo rnams sna tshogs rten can nyid /
analyzed: blo rnams sna tshogs rten can nyid /
translated: the cognitions are based on different things.

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de dang dbang po'i blo gang yin pa 'di gnyis kyi dkar po nyid la sogs pa'i yul nyid gcig yin la /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de dang dbang po'i blo gang yin pa 'di gnyis kyi dkar po nyid la sogs pa'i yul nyid gcig yin la /
translated: The cognition that arises from the word and the sense cognition both have the same object, such as ‚Äúwhite.‚Äù

original: gcig nyid yin na yang dbang po'i blo'i rten mig la sogs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gcig nyid yin na yang dbang po'i blo'i rten mig la sogs pa yin zhing /
translated: Even if they are the same, the basis of the sense cognition is the eye, etc.,

original: gzhan gyi yid nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yid nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: and the basis of the other is the mind.

original: rten tha dad pa'i phyir snang ba de tha dad pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rten tha dad pa'i phyir snang ba de tha dad pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus, because their bases are different, their appearances are not the same.

original: gal te yul gcig na yang /
analyzed: gal te yul gcig na yang /
translated: If the object is the same,

original: rten tha dad pa'i phyir snang ba tha dad pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: rten tha dad pa'i phyir snang ba tha dad pa de'i tshe /
translated: Because the supports are different, the appearances are different.

original: rna ba la sogs sems /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs sems /
translated: The ear consciousness and so onüîΩarise from different supports, the ear faculty and so on.

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i rten tha dad pa'i sgo nas skye ba de ni tha dad don can de gang las ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i rten tha dad pa'i sgo nas skye ba de ni tha dad don can de gang las ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not that they are different objects.

original: 'dir yang rna ba'i shes pa la sogs pa'i yul gcig nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: 'dir yang rna ba'i shes pa la sogs pa'i yul gcig nyid yin zhing /
translated: Here too, it is possible to say that the object of the ear consciousness and so on is the same,

original: snang ba tha dad pa ni rten tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par nus so //üîΩrnam pa 'ga' zhig gis rjes su byed pa'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i yul nyid ni gcig yin gyi /
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa ni rten tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par nus so // rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis rjes su byed pa'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i yul nyid ni gcig yin gyi /
translated: but the different appearances are due to the different supports.

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni log pa yin te /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni log pa yin te /
translated: It is wrong to say that the object of the ear consciousness and so on is the same sound, but it is not the object of the eye consciousness and so on because the latter do not take on the aspect of the former.üîΩIf you imagine that the object of the ear consciousness and so on is the same as the object of the eye consciousness and so on because they take on the aspect of the object in some way, then why not imagine that the object of the eye consciousness and so on is the same as the object of the ear consciousness and so on because they take on the aspect of the object in some way?

original: de ltar 'di la yang shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa de 'dra ba rtog par byed na gang gis bzlog / gzhan yang sems kyi ste shes @200a * //
analyzed: de ltar 'di la yang shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa de 'dra ba rtog par byed na gang gis bzlog / gzhan yang sems kyi ste shes @200a * //
translated: Moreover, the object of the ear consciousness and so on is the same as the object of the eye consciousness and so on because they take on the aspect of consciousness and so on.

original: ba'i rten ni gzhan dang gzhan skye ba yin na gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa de ltar na yang shes bya'i dngos po gcig de nyid du 'gyur na /üîΩci gzugs de tha dad rnam par snang ba can gang las /
analyzed: ba'i rten ni gzhan dang gzhan skye ba yin na gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa de ltar na yang shes bya'i dngos po gcig de nyid du 'gyur na / ci gzugs de tha dad rnam par snang ba can gang las /
translated: If the basis of the appearance of a single object of knowledge were different from the basis of the appearance of another object of knowledge, then the object of knowledge would be one in reality but different in appearance.üîΩIf form is different, then from what does the single entity of the sense consciousness appear?

original: gang gis na dbang po'i shes pa la ngo bo gcig gsal bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang gis na dbang po'i shes pa la ngo bo gcig gsal bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: If it is different from the object of the sense consciousness, then from what does the single entity of the sense consciousness appear?

original: gzhan ni sgra las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni sgra las byung ba yin te /
translated: The other is a mental consciousness arising from sound.

original: de ltar na blo snang ba tha dad pa dang / don ni rnam pa gcig can nyid yin pa'i phyir rang nyid 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa la snang ba'i ngo bo gcig nyid du 'gyur ba de'i phyir spyi ni dbang po'i shes pa dang sgra las byung bas gzung ba ma yin te /üîΩde dag ni rnam pa tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na blo snang ba tha dad pa dang / don ni rnam pa gcig can nyid yin pa'i phyir rang nyid 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa la snang ba'i ngo bo gcig nyid du 'gyur ba de'i phyir spyi ni dbang po'i shes pa dang sgra las byung bas gzung ba ma yin te / de dag ni rnam pa tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, because the appearance of the mind is different and the object is one, the single entity that appears to the consciousness that has the mode of apprehending itself would be a universal. Therefore a universal is not apprehended by a sense consciousness or by a mental consciousness arising from sound because they have different aspects.

original: gal te sgra las byung ba dang dbang po'i shes pa dag gi yul gcig ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te sgra las byung ba dang dbang po'i shes pa dag gi yul gcig ma yin na /
translated: If the objects of a mental consciousness arising from sound and a sense consciousness are not the same, then how could they be said to be the same?

original: rva la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don gang yin pa de ba lang zhes ji ltar sgra las byung bas rtogs pa gang yin pa'i gsal ba'i bye brag skyes bus mthong bar gyur pa gad yin pa 'di ngas thos ba de ni ba lang 'di yin no zhes
analyzed: rva la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don gang yin pa de ba lang zhes ji ltar sgra las byung bas rtogs pa gang yin pa'i gsal ba'i bye brag skyes bus mthong bar gyur pa gad yin pa 'di ngas thos ba de ni ba lang 'di yin no zhes
translated: How could it be that ‚Äúthis cow‚Äù is the particular instance of the manifest that is understood from the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù as having the meaning of possessing horns and so on, which is seen by a person?

original: bya bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: bya bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could it be that ‚ÄúI heard that cow‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir sgra dang dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gcig yin no zhes bya ba'i rtog pa gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra dang dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gcig yin no zhes bya ba'i rtog pa gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is also illogical to think that the object of the auditory and visual consciousnesses is the same.

original: 'di ltar yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: ba lang la sogs ngo shes pa //
analyzed: ba lang la sogs ngo shes pa //
translated: The recognition of a cow and so on

original: gang yin pa de ni sngar mthong ba las ni bzlog pa yin /
analyzed: gang yin pa de ni sngar mthong ba las ni bzlog pa yin /
translated: is the opposite of seeing it before.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩmthong ba rtogs pa med par ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / mthong ba rtogs pa med par ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbang po'i spyod yul gyi don la reg pa med par brjod pa'i rnam rtog 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul gyi don la reg pa med par brjod pa'i rnam rtog 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conceptual thought that expresses the object of the sense faculty without the realization of seeing does not engage.

original: gang gi tshe sgra rang gi mtshan nyid la mi reg pa de'i tshe gang las sgra de nyid kyis dngos po bstan pa phyis mthong bas de ltar shes par 'gyur re zhig ngo shes pa'i shes pa mthong ba'i don ches ring ba'i rjes su zhugs pa don duüîΩzhen pa gang yin pa de yang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgra rang gi mtshan nyid la mi reg pa de'i tshe gang las sgra de nyid kyis dngos po bstan pa phyis mthong bas de ltar shes par 'gyur re zhig ngo shes pa'i shes pa mthong ba'i don ches ring ba'i rjes su zhugs pa don du zhen pa gang yin pa de yang /
translated: The object of the cognition that recognizes the object is far removed from the object that was seen.

original: mthong ba'i don nyid kyi yul la dmigs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i don nyid kyi yul la dmigs pa ma yin na /
translated: If the object of the cognition that apprehends the object is not the object that was seen,

original: ci sgras don de ston par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci sgras don de ston par 'gyur ram /
translated: then how could the object be indicated by the word?üîΩThe object that is indicated by the word would be the object of the cognition that recognizes the object.

original: sgras bstan par 'gyur ba'i don ngo shes pa'i rjes su byed par 'gyur 'on kyang sngon thos pa'i don 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni log pa'i shes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sgras bstan par 'gyur ba'i don ngo shes pa'i rjes su byed par 'gyur 'on kyang sngon thos pa'i don 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni log pa'i shes pa nyid yin no //
translated: However, the statement ‚ÄúThe object that was previously heard is apprehended‚Äù is simply a mistaken cognition.

original: gang gi phyir ba lang ba lang zhes bya ba'i sgra dang shes pa'i 'di rjes su 'gro ba can yin pa de'i phyir dngos por gyur pa rjes su 'gro ba can gcig nyid du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ba lang ba lang zhes bya ba'i sgra dang shes pa'i 'di rjes su 'gro ba can yin pa de'i phyir dngos por gyur pa rjes su 'gro ba can gcig nyid du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: You say, ‚ÄúThe word and the cognition that think ‚Äòcow, cow‚Äô are subsequent to the object cow. Therefore, the object cow is the single entity that is subsequent to the word and the cognition.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar ba lang la sogs don la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ba lang la sogs don la /
translated: In this way, in reality,üîΩthe conceptual thought that expresses the universal and so on

original: yul la rigs sogs brjod @200b ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i /
analyzed: yul la rigs sogs brjod @200b ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i /
translated: of the object, such as a cow,

original: rjes su 'gro las rjes dpag gang //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro las rjes dpag gang //
translated: is inference.

original: yod pa nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove existence,

original: brjod pa'i rjes su dpag pa /
analyzed: brjod pa'i rjes su dpag pa /
translated: the inference that expresses that

original: de yang des ni sgra dang dbang po'i shes pa'i snang ba tha dad pas sun 'byin to //
analyzed: de yang des ni sgra dang dbang po'i shes pa'i snang ba tha dad pas sun 'byin to //
translated: is refuted by the difference in the appearance of the object of the sense faculty and the sound.

original: de ltar na sgra gang gi rjes su byed pa de ni dbang po'i shes pa'i yul ma yin na /
analyzed: de ltar na sgra gang gi rjes su byed pa de ni dbang po'i shes pa'i yul ma yin na /
translated: Thus, if that which is the effect of a sound is not the object of a sense consciousness,

original: gang gis na de'i rjes su 'gro ba las sgra'i yul dbang po'i don nyid du 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na de'i rjes su 'gro ba las sgra'i yul dbang po'i don nyid du 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: how could it be established as the object of a sense faculty due to its conformity with that?

original: gal te rjes su 'gro ba can gyi sgra 'ga' zhig gam shes pa rjes su 'jug pa yod pa zhes bya ba de tsam du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'gro ba can gyi sgra 'ga' zhig gam shes pa rjes su 'jug pa yod pa zhes bya ba de tsam du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If there were some conformity of a sound or the engagement of a consciousness, that would be the mere existence,

original: dbang po'i yul spyir grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i yul spyir grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but the object of a sense faculty is not established in general.

original: rjes su 'gro ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa 'di la yang dbang po'i spyod yul las 'das pa rjes su 'gro ba can gyi yul don dam pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa 'di la yang dbang po'i spyod yul las 'das pa rjes su 'gro ba can gyi yul don dam pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And this conceptual thought that follows after it does not have an object that is the ultimate, which is beyond the range of the senses.

original: de ltar na ji ltar dngos po tha dad na yang dngos po'i chos nyid kyis don gyi bya ba gcig byed pa de bzhin du de'i yul can gyi mthong ba nyid ni tha dad kyang /
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar dngos po tha dad na yang dngos po'i chos nyid kyis don gyi bya ba gcig byed pa de bzhin du de'i yul can gyi mthong ba nyid ni tha dad kyang /
translated: Thus, just as different things can perform the same function in the world because of the nature of things, so too the different perceptions of the object can have the same conceptual thought, ‚ÄúI saw it,‚Äù because of the nature of consciousness.üîΩAnd the nature of consciousness is such that it is the cause of the conceptual thought, ‚ÄúI saw it,‚Äù even when the object is not present.

original: rjes su 'gro ba can gyi don med par ngo shes pa zhes bya ba'i rnam rtog gcig ni rang bzhin gyi byed pa yin zhes sngar rgyas par brjod zin to //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba can gyi don med par ngo shes pa zhes bya ba'i rnam rtog gcig ni rang bzhin gyi byed pa yin zhes sngar rgyas par brjod zin to //
translated: This is what we have explained at length above.üîΩTherefore, the following is the correct position:

original: de'i phyir / dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul gzugs //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul gzugs //
translated: The object of the senses is form.

original: rang rigs bstan par mi nus so //üîΩzhes bya ba de ltar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rang rigs bstan par mi nus so // zhes bya ba de ltar gnas pa yin no //
translated: It cannot be shown to belong to its own class.

original: yid kyi yul gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can rtog pa med pa nyams su myong pa'i rnam par 'jug pa yin zhes bya ba de ni //
analyzed: yid kyi yul gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can rtog pa med pa nyams su myong pa'i rnam par 'jug pa yin zhes bya ba de ni //
translated: The object of the mind is the experience of the object, such as form, and it is nonconceptual.

original: sngar myong ba ni 'dzin pa na //
analyzed: sngar myong ba ni 'dzin pa na //
translated: The past experience is apprehended.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: This is explained by the above verse.

original: de la yid kyi shes pa dang dbang po'i shes pas bzung ba'i don nyid 'dzin tam /
analyzed: de la yid kyi shes pa dang dbang po'i shes pas bzung ba'i don nyid 'dzin tam /
translated: In this regard, is the object that is grasped by the mental consciousness and the sense consciousnesses also apprehended?

original: 'on te de las gzhan pa yin zhes gnyis su brtag grang na /
analyzed: 'on te de las gzhan pa yin zhes gnyis su brtag grang na /
translated: Or is it something other than that?

original: re zhig gal te dbang po'i shes pa yongs su bcad pa rtogs pa yin pa de'i tshe don sngar myong ba ni 'dzin pa na khas len na /
analyzed: re zhig gal te dbang po'i shes pa yongs su bcad pa rtogs pa yin pa de'i tshe don sngar myong ba ni 'dzin pa na khas len na /
translated: If the object is determined by the sense consciousness, then the past experience is apprehended.

original: yid ni tshad ma nyid ma yin /
analyzed: yid ni tshad ma nyid ma yin /
translated: The mental consciousness is not a valid cognition.

original: dran pa dang 'dod pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dran pa dang 'dod pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like memory, desire, and so on.

original: tshad ma ni mi shes pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩci ste yang dbang po'i shes pas ma mthong ba nyid 'dzin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: tshad ma ni mi shes pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // ci ste yang dbang po'i shes pas ma mthong ba nyid 'dzin pa de'i tshe /
translated: This is because a valid cognition is defined as that which illuminates an object that was not previously known.üîΩBut if the mental consciousness apprehends what was not seen by the sense consciousness,

original: ma mthong 'dzin na long sogs kyang //
analyzed: ma mthong 'dzin na long sogs kyang //
translated: then even the blind would apprehend it.

original: don mthong bar yan 'gyur ba dang // zhes bya ba la dbang po'i shes ba la ltos pa med pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa phyi rol gyi don la 'jug pa ma yin na long bas kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don mthong bar yan 'gyur ba dang // zhes bya ba la dbang po'i shes ba la ltos pa med pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa phyi rol gyi don la 'jug pa ma yin na long bas kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mental consciousness, without depending on a sense consciousness, does not engage external objects, then even the blind would see and the deaf would hear.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni @201a * //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni @201a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù

original: 'on pa la sogs pas kyang yul de la shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on pa la sogs pas kyang yul de la shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that even the deaf would hear and so forth.

original: dbang po'i shes pas nyams su myong ba'i yul can nyid kyis yid la rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pas nyams su myong ba'i yul can nyid kyis yid la rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
translated: The mental consciousness has two modes of conception: it conceives the object of a sense consciousness and it conceives its own object.

original: don de skad cig ma'am ma yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: don de skad cig ma'am ma yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Is the object of the mental consciousness a momentary object or not?

original: gal te skad cig ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If it is momentary,

original: skad cig nyid phyir 'das pa'i don //
analyzed: skad cig nyid phyir 'das pa'i don //
translated: then the object of the past

original: mthong ba yod ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mthong ba yod ba ma yin zhing /
translated: is not seen, because it is past.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gyi don dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba can nam /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gyi don dang dus mtshungs par 'byung ba can nam /
translated: If the object of the mental consciousness is simultaneous with the object of a sense consciousness,

original: dus sngar 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: dus sngar 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: or if it occurs earlier,üîΩthen the mental consciousness would not conceive the object of a sense consciousness.

original: rnam pa gnyis ka yang bskal pa yin pa'i phyir phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi yid kyi rnam bar shes pas de 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ka yang bskal pa yin pa'i phyir phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi yid kyi rnam bar shes pas de 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Because both of these are kalpas, the mental consciousness that occurs later does not apprehend it.

original: ci ste skad cig ma ma yin na yang dbang po'i yul gyi don yang skad cig min de'i yul can gyi yid don rtogs pa'i yul can tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste skad cig ma ma yin na yang dbang po'i yul gyi don yang skad cig min de'i yul can gyi yid don rtogs pa'i yul can tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not momentary, then the object of the sense faculty is not momentary, and the mental consciousness that is the subject that understands the object is not valid knowledge.

original: ci ste don rtogs pa'i yul can de tsam nyid kyang tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: ci ste don rtogs pa'i yul can de tsam nyid kyang tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe mtshan nyid ni //
translated: If you assert that the mere subject that understands the object is valid knowledge, then the definition

original: byad par bcas pa brjod byar 'gyur /üîΩdper na don rtogs pa'i yul can nyid la yang /
analyzed: byad par bcas pa brjod byar 'gyur / dper na don rtogs pa'i yul can nyid la yang /
translated: would be stated with the inclusion of an example.

original: yid ni mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba can yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: yid ni mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba can yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the mental consciousness is direct perception and is free from conceptuality.

original: gzhan yang las gang la bya ba sgrub pa yod pa de ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang las gang la bya ba sgrub pa yod pa de ni /
translated: Moreover, that action in which activity is accomplished

original: bya ba bsgrub can las la ni //
analyzed: bya ba bsgrub can las la ni //
translated: is the action that accomplishes activity.

original: khyad par cung zad mi byed pa'i //
analyzed: khyad par cung zad mi byed pa'i //
translated: It does not make the slightest difference

original: sngar rtogs pa nyid shes 'gyur ba ;
analyzed: sngar rtogs pa nyid shes 'gyur ba ;
translated: that it is known to be previously understood.

original: / dbang po can nam gzhan dag gi //
analyzed: / dbang po can nam gzhan dag gi //
translated: Or the mind of another person?

original: yid do // sgrub par byed par ci phyir 'dod /
analyzed: yid do // sgrub par byed par ci phyir 'dod /
translated: Why do you accept that it is the establishing cause?

original: sgrub pa de nyid 'dod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa de nyid 'dod par mi bya ste /
translated: You should not accept that it is the establishing cause,

original: gcal ba nyid sgrub ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcal ba nyid sgrub ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the mere manifestation of what already exists.

original: de la sgrub par byed pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sgrub par byed pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the establishing cause,

original: shing bcad zin pa'i sta re bzhin no //
analyzed: shing bcad zin pa'i sta re bzhin no //
translated: just like the axe that has already done its work.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig bya ba sgrub pa can gyi las la khyad par cung zad byed pa ma yin pa de ni de'i phyed pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig bya ba sgrub pa can gyi las la khyad par cung zad byed pa ma yin pa de ni de'i phyed pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is not the establishing cause of the object to be accomplished, because it does not produce the slightest difference in it.

original: dper na shing dum bu gnyis su bas pa de lta bu nyid du bya ba'i phyir sta re bya ba mi byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing dum bu gnyis su bas pa de lta bu nyid du bya ba'i phyir sta re bya ba mi byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the axe does not produce the axe-cut in the log, because the log is already cut in two.

original: de ma thag pa'i yid kyi rnam bar shes pas kyang bya ba sgrub pa can sngar gyi dbang po'i rnam par shes pas rtogs pa'i yul la phul du byung ba cung zad kyang mi byed do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed ba 'gal pa dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i yid kyi rnam bar shes pas kyang bya ba sgrub pa can sngar gyi dbang po'i rnam par shes pas rtogs pa'i yul la phul du byung ba cung zad kyang mi byed do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed ba 'gal pa dmigs pa'o //
translated: The mental consciousness that arises immediately after that does not cause the slightest increase in the object that was previously perceived by the sense consciousness. This is an observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: gzhan yang blo yang thams cad cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo yang thams cad cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: Moreover, all cognitions would arise simultaneously.

original: brtan pa dngos po de las skye ba can gang yin pa de dag ni dngos po de las skye ba @201b can zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i don skad cig mam yin pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'dzin pa'i skyon gzhan yin no //
analyzed: brtan pa dngos po de las skye ba can gang yin pa de dag ni dngos po de las skye ba @201b can zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i don skad cig mam yin pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'dzin pa'i skyon gzhan yin no //
translated: The error of the mental consciousness apprehending a stable thing that is not momentary is that the mental consciousness would arise from that thing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de nus pa yin na ji ltar blo de gcig skyed par byed pa de ltar de'i rgyu can gzhan yang cig car skyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de nus pa yin na ji ltar blo de gcig skyed par byed pa de ltar de'i rgyu can gzhan yang cig car skyed par 'gyur te /
translated: If it has the ability to produce a cognition, then just as it produces that one cognition, it would also simultaneously produce another cognition that has the same cause.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no difference between them.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: don yan gar ba la nus pa med pa de bas na lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: don yan gar ba la nus pa med pa de bas na lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen la ltos pa yin no //
translated: since a mere object by itself has no power, it must depend on a cooperative condition.

original: de yang res 'ga' pa yin pa de ltar na gnyis ka yang rim bzhin du 'byung ba'i ngang tshul yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yang res 'ga' pa yin pa de ltar na gnyis ka yang rim bzhin du 'byung ba'i ngang tshul yin no zhe na /
translated: And since that is sometimes absent, both are sometimes absent. Thus both are by nature intermittent.

original: de dang de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: lhan cig byed pa gzhan gyi 'bras min khyad par ni //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa gzhan gyi 'bras min khyad par ni //
translated: Because the difference is not the effect of another cooperative condition.

original: phul du byung bar byar med pa'o //
analyzed: phul du byung bar byar med pa'o //
translated: It is not possible to make it special.

original: de la ltos pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i ltos pa ste /
analyzed: de la ltos pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i ltos pa ste /
translated: The dependence on that is the dependence on a cooperative condition.

original: 'gal phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal phyir ro //
translated: Because they are contradictory.

original: de ltar de yang mang du bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar de yang mang du bstan zin to //
translated: And that has been taught many times.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i skyon yod pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i skyon yod pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because of the existence of such errors,

original: yid ni yul gzhan nyid 'dzin byed //
analyzed: yid ni yul gzhan nyid 'dzin byed //
translated: the mind apprehends other objects.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes /
translated: It is the sense consciousness.

original: de ma thag rkyen las byung can //
analyzed: de ma thag rkyen las byung can //
translated: It arises from the immediately preceding condition.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las byung ba gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //üîΩdes ni de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid yin par bsal to //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las byung ba gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro // des ni de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid yin par bsal to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which has‚Äù is to be supplied.üîΩThis shows that the mental consciousness is the objective condition of the mental consciousness.

original: de'i rkyen gyis kyang phyi rol gyi don la yid 'jug pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis kyang phyi rol gyi don la yid 'jug pa yin gyi /
translated: The mental consciousness is the objective condition of the mental consciousness that perceives external objects.

original: rang dbang can ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rang dbang can ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The mental consciousness is not independent.

original: de 'dra ba'i yid de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i yid de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The mental consciousness that is like this is the mental consciousness.

original: gal te yang dbang po shes pa'i yul las yul gzhan nyid 'dzin pa yin pa de ltar na yang /
analyzed: gal te yang dbang po shes pa'i yul las yul gzhan nyid 'dzin pa yin pa de ltar na yang /
translated: Even if the mental consciousness were to grasp an object that is different from the object of the sense consciousness,

original: gang gi phyir de dbang po'i shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa yin pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dbang po'i shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa yin pa /
translated: the mental consciousness would still be produced by the sense consciousness as its similar and immediately antecedent condition.

original: de phyir long bas mthong ba min //
analyzed: de phyir long bas mthong ba min //
translated: Therefore, the blind do not see.

original: dbang po'i shes pa de nyid dbang po med par long pa la yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na long bas mthong ba ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa de nyid dbang po med par long pa la yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na long bas mthong ba ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: The sense consciousness is not present in the blind, and the mental consciousness is not present in the blind.

original: dbang po'i shes pa de nyid ci'i phyir don rtogs pa zhes brjod pa na 'di lta ste mig la sogs pa'i rten gyi bye brag las rang bzhin gyi khyad par de 'dra ba gang yin pa nges don la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di gdon mi
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa de nyid ci'i phyir don rtogs pa zhes brjod pa na 'di lta ste mig la sogs pa'i rten gyi bye brag las rang bzhin gyi khyad par de 'dra ba gang yin pa nges don la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di gdon mi
translated: If it is asked why that sense consciousness is called the realization of the object, it is said that it is the specific nature that arises from the specific support of the eye and so on.

original: za bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: za bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: That must be stated.

original: de ltar 'dir yang de'i don rtogs pa'i don gyi dbang po'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dir yang de'i don rtogs pa'i don gyi dbang po'i shes pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, here, the object of the eye consciousness is the object of the realization of the object of the eye consciousness.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi gal te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi gal te /
translated: That is the case, but if

original: dbang po'i shes pas ma bzung ba yid kyis rtogs pa yin na /üîΩdon chod ba'am bskal @202a * //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pas ma bzung ba yid kyis rtogs pa yin na / don chod ba'am bskal @202a * //
translated: the mental consciousness realizes the object that is not apprehended by the sense consciousness,

original: pa ci'i phyir mi ldog ce na /
analyzed: pa ci'i phyir mi ldog ce na /
translated: why does it not apprehend the object that is separated by a wall?

original: de ni de ltam yin te //
analyzed: de ni de ltam yin te //
translated: That is not the case.

original: de bas gzhan 'dis 'dzin na yang //
analyzed: de bas gzhan 'dis 'dzin na yang //
translated: Even though it apprehends that,

original: dbang po'i yul las gzhan pa'i yul yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di yis rtogs pa yin na yang /
analyzed: dbang po'i yul las gzhan pa'i yul yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di yis rtogs pa yin na yang /
translated: if the object of the mental consciousness is an object that is different from the object of the sense faculty,

original: des pa 'dzin par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: des pa 'dzin par 'dod pa yin //
translated: it is asserted that it apprehends that.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gyi de ma thag pa'i don 'dzin pa nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gyi de ma thag pa'i don 'dzin pa nyid du 'dod do //
translated: The object of the sense consciousness is held to be the immediately preceding object.üîΩThus:üîΩThe sense consciousnesses are self-referential and dependent on the object.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the immediately preceding condition of the sense consciousnesses.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the immediately preceding condition of the sense consciousnesses.

original: 'di ltar / rang don rjes 'gro don ltos can //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rang don rjes 'gro don ltos can //
translated: The sense consciousnesses are self-referential in that they are the effect of their own object.üîΩThe sense consciousnesses are dependent on the object in that they are the cause of the mental consciousness that arises immediately after them.

original: dbang skyes blo ni /
analyzed: dbang skyes blo ni /
translated: The mental consciousness is the immediately preceding condition of the sense consciousnesses.üîΩThe sense consciousnesses are the immediately preceding condition of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe sense consciousnesses are self-referential in that they are the effect of their own object.üîΩThe sense consciousnesses are dependent on the object in that they are the cause of the mental consciousness that arises immediately after them.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the immediately preceding condition of the sense consciousnesses.

original: de yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa rkyen nyid kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa rkyen nyid kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: The sense consciousnesses are the immediately preceding condition of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe sense consciousnesses are self-referential in that they are the effect of their own object.üîΩThe sense consciousnesses are dependent on the object in that they are the cause of the mental consciousness that arises immediately after them.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the immediately preceding condition of the sense consciousnesses.üîΩThe sense consciousnesses are the immediately preceding condition of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe sense consciousnesses are self-referential in that they are the effect of their own object.

original: dbang po'i blo de de ma thag pa'i rkyen du 'dod pa'i skad cig ma rang gi don de rang gi yul gang yin pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba de'i rgyu can gang yin pa de ni de ma thag tu byung ba'i dang tshul can gyi yul lhan cig
analyzed: dbang po'i blo de de ma thag pa'i rkyen du 'dod pa'i skad cig ma rang gi don de rang gi yul gang yin pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba de'i rgyu can gang yin pa de ni de ma thag tu byung ba'i dang tshul can gyi yul lhan cig
translated: The sense consciousnesses are dependent on the object in that they are the cause of the mental consciousness that arises immediately after them.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the immediately preceding condition of the sense consciousnesses.üîΩThe sense consciousnesses are the immediately preceding condition of the mental consciousness.

original: byed pa'i rgyu des zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde bas na gzhan 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu des zhes bya ba'i don to // de bas na gzhan 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: The sense consciousnesses are self-referential in that they are the effect of their own object.üîΩThe sense consciousnesses are dependent on the object in that they are the cause of the mental consciousness that arises immediately after them.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the immediately preceding condition of the sense consciousnesses.

original: gal te dbang po nyid sems kyi dbang po'i shes pa'i ngo bo gang la dbang po'i shes pa de dang byed pa'i dus mtshungs pa med pa de ni /üîΩde dang byed dus mtshungs med can //
analyzed: gal te dbang po nyid sems kyi dbang po'i shes pa'i ngo bo gang la dbang po'i shes pa de dang byed pa'i dus mtshungs pa med pa de ni /üîΩde dang byed dus mtshungs med can //
translated: The sense consciousnesses are the immediately preceding condition of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe sense consciousnesses are self-referential in that they are the effect of their own object.üîΩThe sense consciousnesses are dependent on the object in that they are the cause of the mental consciousness that arises immediately after them.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the immediately preceding condition of the sense consciousnesses.

original: rang shes dus can rang gi dmigs pa'i shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa can du 'gyur ba'i don dag ni lhan cig byed par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rang shes dus can rang gi dmigs pa'i shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa can du 'gyur ba'i don dag ni lhan cig byed par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could the object that is concomitant with the consciousness that is its object, which is self-knowing and momentary, be a cooperative condition?

original: de skad du dngos po rnams kyi byed pa'i dus ni rang nyid yod pa'i dus yin la /
analyzed: de skad du dngos po rnams kyi byed pa'i dus ni rang nyid yod pa'i dus yin la /
translated: The time when things function is the time when they exist.

original: de yang skad cig mar yod pa yin pa de ltar na /üîΩde'i yul gyi don yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / dus mtshungs pa can 'di ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang skad cig mar yod pa yin pa de ltar na / de'i yul gyi don yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / dus mtshungs pa can 'di ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since they exist in a momentary way,

original: 'gags pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩrim bzhin du 'byung ba can dag ni gcig byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gags pa nyid kyi phyir ro // rim bzhin du 'byung ba can dag ni gcig byed pa ma yin te /
translated: the object of the mental consciousness that is concomitant with it does not exist at the time of the sense consciousness because it has already ceased.

original: lhan cig 'byung pa'i dang tshul can ma yin pa 'di lhan cig byed pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung pa'i dang tshul can ma yin pa 'di lhan cig byed pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those that arise sequentially are not co-emergent, and those that are not co-emergent are not cooperative conditions.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi don dbang po'i shes pa'i lhan cig byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir gang las yid don nges par 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi don dbang po'i shes pa'i lhan cig byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir gang las yid don nges par 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
translated: But since the object of the mental consciousness is not the object of the sense consciousness, how can the mental consciousness apprehend the object of the sense consciousness?

original: skyon der ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyon der ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: There is no such fault,

original: 'di ltar dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang / don ni rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir sngar yod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang / don ni rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir sngar yod pa yin la /
translated: because the sense consciousness and the object are the cause of the mental consciousness, and thus they exist prior to it.

original: de dag las dus phyis 'byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de dag las dus phyis 'byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The mental consciousness that arises later is the effect of those two.

original: de lta ma yin na /üîΩrgyur mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na / rgyur mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: If that were not so,

original: de'i phyir de'i yul yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i yul yang ma yin no //
translated: the sense consciousness and the object would not be its cause.üîΩTherefore, the object of the mental consciousness is not the object of the sense consciousness.

original: de ltar na 'di la don med pa'am yod pa rgyur 'gyur ro zhes rnam par rtog pa nyid 'byung bar 'gyur grang /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di la don med pa'am yod pa rgyur 'gyur ro zhes rnam par rtog pa nyid 'byung bar 'gyur grang /
translated: In that case, would it not be the case that the mental consciousness has an object that does not exist or that it has an object that exists as its cause?

original: de @202b la re zhig med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de @202b la re zhig med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The mental consciousness does not have an object that does not exist,

original: med pa sngar nus med phyir dang / 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i dus las sngar med pas ji ltar 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: med pa sngar nus med phyir dang / 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i dus las sngar med pas ji ltar 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur /
translated: because if it did not exist, it would be powerless, and how could something that does not exist prior to the time of producing the effect produce an effect?

original: med par ni 'bras bu thams cad ma don par sgrub pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med par ni 'bras bu thams cad ma don par sgrub pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is devoid of the capacity to establish all effects without a cause.

original: yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it existent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyis kyang nye bar mi sbyor phyir //
analyzed: phyis kyang nye bar mi sbyor phyir //
translated: Because it does not subsequently connect.

original: 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i dus na rgyu grub pa de'i tshe 'bras bu yang de dang mtshungs par lhan cig grub pas nye bar mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i dus na rgyu grub pa de'i tshe 'bras bu yang de dang mtshungs par lhan cig grub pas nye bar mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When the cause is established at the time of producing the effect, the effect is also established at the same time as that, so it does not connect.

original: 'bras bu las rgyu rnams thams cad sngar yod min par gdon mi za bar 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu las rgyu rnams thams cad sngar yod min par gdon mi za bar 'dod par bya'o //
translated: One should undoubtedly accept that all causes are not existent prior to the effect.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: de phyir rang blo bcas don min //
analyzed: de phyir rang blo bcas don min //
translated: Therefore, the object is not the content of one‚Äôs own mind.

original: don ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dus na 'byung ba can ma yin na /
analyzed: don ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dus na 'byung ba can ma yin na /
translated: If the object does not occur at the time of mental consciousness,

original: gang gis na /
analyzed: gang gis na /
translated: then how

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i lhan cig byed par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i lhan cig byed par mi 'gyur /
translated: could it be the co-operating condition of sense consciousness?

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is indeed so,

original: gal te tha dad dus can dag / ji ltar 'dzin zhes gang zhig gis 'dzin pa de ni de dang dus tha dad pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te tha dad dus can dag / ji ltar 'dzin zhes gang zhig gis 'dzin pa de ni de dang dus tha dad pa can ma yin te /
translated: The one who apprehends is not different in time from that which is apprehended,

original: dper na lag pas gzung ba'i skyu ru ra lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: dper na lag pas gzung ba'i skyu ru ra lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: just as a myrobalan fruit is apprehended by the hand.

original: rgyu'i khyad par las gzhan gzung bar bya ba de 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par las gzhan gzung bar bya ba de 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the object of apprehension is not something different from the cause.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /üîΩrigs shes pas /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na / rigs shes pas /
translated: What is it then?

original: rgyu nyid la ni gzung bar shes //
analyzed: rgyu nyid la ni gzung bar shes //
translated: The wise know that the cause itself is apprehended.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of cause?

original: shes pa'i rnam par 'jog nus pa //üîΩyul can gyi shes pa la rang gi rnam pa 'jog par nus pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam par 'jog nus pa // yul can gyi shes pa la rang gi rnam pa 'jog par nus pa ste /
translated: The cause that is able to project its image into consciousness.

original: rang dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa kho na yul du gzung bar bya ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rang dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa kho na yul du gzung bar bya ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: The object of apprehension is only that cause which is able to project its image into the consciousness that is its effect, which is similar to itself.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not anything else.

original: gzhan yang 'bras bu rnams kyi rgyu du ma nyid yod na yang 'jig rten na rgyu'i 'bras bu rjes byed skye ba gang /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'bras bu rnams kyi rgyu du ma nyid yod na yang 'jig rten na rgyu'i 'bras bu rjes byed skye ba gang /
translated: Moreover, even though effects have many causes, in the world, the effect of a cause is said to be that which arises in resemblance to the cause.

original: rgyu gang gi rnam pa'i rjes su byed cing 'byung ba de rgyu des bzhag de'i ngo bo can yin zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gang gi rnam pa'i rjes su byed cing 'byung ba de rgyu des bzhag de'i ngo bo can yin zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: That which arises in resemblance to the form of a cause and occurs is said to be established by that cause and to have its nature.

original: 'bras bu gang la rgyu'i ngo bo de bzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang la rgyu'i ngo bo de bzhag pa yin te /
translated: That effect is said to apprehend that cause

original: rang dang 'dra ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang 'dra ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it produces something similar to itself.üîΩThat effect also is said to apprehend that cause

original: 'bras bu des kyang rgyu de gzung ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu des kyang rgyu de gzung ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: because it is established by that cause.

original: rang gi rnam par 'jog par byed pa de ni des 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par 'jog par byed pa de ni des 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: That which is established by its form is apprehended by it,

original: dper na pha dang gzugs mtshungs pa can du skyes pa'i bu des pha'i gzugs 'dzin pa zhes 'jig rten na grags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na pha dang gzugs mtshungs pa can du skyes pa'i bu des pha'i gzugs 'dzin pa zhes 'jig rten na grags pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as it is well known in the world that a son born with a form similar to his father‚Äôs form apprehends the form of his father.

original: des de ltar bskyed pa'i bu de yang de'i gzugs 'dzin par byed ces bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: des de ltar bskyed pa'i bu de yang de'i gzugs 'dzin par byed ces bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The son born in that way by the father is also said to apprehend the form of the father.

original: bu'i lag pas @203a * //
analyzed: bu'i lag pas @203a * //
translated: The hand of the son

original: pha 'dzin pas 'dzin par byed ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pha 'dzin pas 'dzin par byed ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the father is apprehended by the apprehension of the son.

original: de bzhin du shes pa dang shes bya 'di la yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa dang shes bya 'di la yang yin no //
translated: And so it is in the case of cognition and the cognized.üîΩAnd because desire, hatred, ignorance, pleasure, pain, etc. are not dependent on self-awareness and the sense faculties,

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa ni rang rig pa dang / dbang po la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba de ni /üîΩbde sogs bdag nyid gzhan mi rten //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa ni rang rig pa dang / dbang po la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba de ni / bde sogs bdag nyid gzhan mi rten //
translated: it is explained by such passages as:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúPleasure, etc. do not depend on another as their nature.‚Äù

original: shes bya gang la shes pa gang gis sgra bkod pa 'dzin par 'gyur de ni de dang bsres nas 'dzin par 'gyur ba de ltar na brjod pa dang 'dres par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: shes bya gang la shes pa gang gis sgra bkod pa 'dzin par 'gyur de ni de dang bsres nas 'dzin par 'gyur ba de ltar na brjod pa dang 'dres par 'gyur gyi /
translated: When a cognition is posited by a certain cognition, it is apprehended by being mixed with that cognition. In that case, it is mixed with the expression.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang rig pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang rig pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But the self-awareness of desire, etc. is not like that.

original: ltar na bde sogs bdag nyid gzhan mi rten /
analyzed: ltar na bde sogs bdag nyid gzhan mi rten /
translated: In that case, pleasure, etc. do not depend on another as their nature.

original: thun mong ma yin te /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin te /
translated: They are not shared in common.

original: tha snyad kyi dus na nye bar mi gnas pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dus na nye bar mi gnas pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot present‚Äù is that it is not a conventional expression.

original: des na 'di la sgra tha snyad du byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di la sgra tha snyad du byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not a conventional expression in this case.

original: tha snyad 'di la yang yul du byas par 'gyur ro //üîΩbde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma skyes par rang rig pas yul du byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad 'di la yang yul du byas par 'gyur ro // bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma skyes par rang rig pas yul du byed pa ma yin te /
translated: It would be the object of this convention.üîΩThe self-awareness that has the nature of pleasure, etc. is not the object because it is not arisen.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du de yang rang bzhin tha dad pa can med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du de yang rang bzhin tha dad pa can med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not different from the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: de bas na gang las brjod pa dang sbyor ba yin /
analyzed: de bas na gang las brjod pa dang sbyor ba yin /
translated: Therefore, from what is there expression and application?

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid skyed pa la yang rang rig pa brjod pa dang 'dres pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid skyed pa la yang rang rig pa brjod pa dang 'dres pa ma yin no //
translated: The self-awareness that produces the nature of pleasure, etc. is not mixed with expression.

original: de ltar na des brjod pa bzung nas de la sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na des brjod pa bzung nas de la sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, having grasped the expression, it would be applied to that.

original: brjod pa 'dzin pa yin na yang skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brjod pa 'dzin pa yin na yang skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if it grasps the expression, because it is momentary,

original: de med pa'am bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pas na gang gis gang la ci zhig sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: de med pa'am bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pas na gang gis gang la ci zhig sbyor bar byed /
translated: Since it does not exist or is not of the nature of pleasure, etc., what is connected to what by whom?

original: de ltar na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ni brda byed par ni nus med can yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ni brda byed par ni nus med can yin no //
translated: Thus the nature of attachment, etc. is not capable of being a signifier.

original: rgyu de phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag rang rigs ni gang yin pa de ni /üîΩbrjod dang rjes 'brel can ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu de phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag rang rigs ni gang yin pa de ni / brjod dang rjes 'brel can ma yin /
translated: For that reason, those attachments, etc. are not of the same classüîΩas the expression.

original: brjod pa dang 'dres pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa dang 'dres pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not mixed with the expression.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la brda mi 'dzin pa de ni de la rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la brda mi 'dzin pa de ni de la rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: When one does not apprehend a sign in regard to something, one does not conceive of it.

original: dri la mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dri la mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the eye consciousness does not conceive of smell.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang rig pa yang brda 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang rig pa yang brda 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The self-awareness of attachment, etc. also does not apprehend the sign, is the apprehension of a contradictory pervasion.

original: khyed cag gis bde ba la sogs pa tshad ma yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: khyed cag gis bde ba la sogs pa tshad ma yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa /
translated: You have explained that pleasure, etc. are valid cognitions.

original: de dag rig byed min na shes pa'i ngo bo ma yin na'o //
analyzed: de dag rig byed min na shes pa'i ngo bo ma yin na'o //
translated: If they are not nonindicative form, they are not by nature consciousness.
