original: 'on @203b kyang de dag / don gcig rten can rnam shes kyis //
analyzed: 'on @203b kyang de dag / don gcig rten can rnam shes kyis //
translated: However, they are consciousnesses that have the same object.

original: rig pa yin don gyi bdag nyid gcig gang yin pa de la bde ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi shes pas yang dag par rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rig pa yin don gyi bdag nyid gcig gang yin pa de la bde ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi shes pas yang dag par rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: They are fully cognized by consciousness that is simultaneous and directly antecedent to them, because they are the same entity as the object.

original: bdag nyid gzhal bya'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhal bya'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are by nature objects of comprehension.üîΩTherefore, if they are not indicative form, how can they cognize themselves, since they do not cognize other external objects?

original: de'i phyir de dag gzhan yang phyi rol gyi don yang rig pa byed pa ma yin na rang gi ngo bo ste bdag nyid ji ltar rig / gang gis na de la tshad mar 'gyur zhes gzhi ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs yin no zhes bye brag pa 'ba'üîΩzhig zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gzhan yang phyi rol gyi don yang rig pa byed pa ma yin na rang gi ngo bo ste bdag nyid ji ltar rig / gang gis na de la tshad mar 'gyur zhes gzhi ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs yin no zhes bye brag pa 'ba' zhig zer ro //
translated: This is a reason that is not established in the opponents' system.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi nges pa ni rgyu'i rang bzhin nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi nges pa ni rgyu'i rang bzhin nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of things is ascertained because the nature of their cause is ascertained.

original: de lta ma yin te glo bur ba yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te glo bur ba yin na /
translated: If that were not so and they were adventitious,

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyi nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyi nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to determine the object, time, and nature of the cause.

original: de bas na ci 'dra ba las ci 'dra ba skyed pa yul ci 'dra ba mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na ci 'dra ba las ci 'dra ba skyed pa yul ci 'dra ba mthong ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, what is produced from what? What is the object of the cause?

original: de 'dra ba gzhan yang de 'dra nyid las yin zhing gzhan dang 'dra ba yang gzhan dang 'dra ba las yin no zhes gdon mi za bar 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba gzhan yang de 'dra nyid las yin zhing gzhan dang 'dra ba yang gzhan dang 'dra ba las yin no zhes gdon mi za bar 'dod par bya'o //
translated: It must be accepted that what is similar is produced from what is similar, and what is dissimilar is produced from what is dissimilar.üîΩWhen you accept that,

original: gang gi tshe de ltar 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: then this is the case:

original: dngos po de dang de dngos can //
analyzed: dngos po de dang de dngos can //
translated: Things that have that nature

original: de dang de min dngos rgyu skyes /
analyzed: de dang de min dngos rgyu skyes /
translated: arise from causes that have that nature.

original: de dang de ma yin pa ni de dang de ma yin pa dag ste /
analyzed: de dang de ma yin pa ni de dang de ma yin pa dag ste /
translated: Things that are not that are not thatüîΩarise from causes that are not that.

original: de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo de gang la yod pa de ni dngos po de dang de dngos can no //
analyzed: de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo de gang la yod pa de ni dngos po de dang de dngos can no //
translated: Things that have that nature and this nature are things that have that nature.üîΩThey are things that are not that, and they are causes.üîΩTherefore, they are things that have that nature and this nature that arise from causes that have that nature and this nature.

original: de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo yang de dag yin la /
analyzed: de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo yang de dag yin la /
translated: Things that are not that are things that are not that.

original: rgyu yang de dag yin pas na /üîΩde dang de min dngos rgyu'o //üîΩde dag las skyes pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu yang de dag yin pas na / de dang de min dngos rgyu'o // de dag las skyes pa ni /
translated: They are causes.

original: de dang de min dngos rgyu skyes //
analyzed: de dang de min dngos rgyu skyes //
translated: Therefore, they are things that are not that that arise from causes that are not that.

original: gang gi phyir des te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir des te /
translated: Because of that,

original: shes dad tha dad med rgyu skyes //
analyzed: shes dad tha dad med rgyu skyes //
translated: the cause of the non-difference of cognition and feeling is produced.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs ci'i phyir mi shes yin /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs ci'i phyir mi shes yin /
translated: Why is it not known that pleasure, pain, etc.

original: mi shes pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: mi shes pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: are not of the nature of non-knowledge,

original: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: but are only of the nature of consciousness?

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig las tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu las skyes pa de ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig las tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu las skyes pa de ni /
translated: The application is this: that which is produced from a cause that is not different from an action

original: de las tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: has a nature that is not different from that.

original: dper na me gcig dang tha dad ba med pa'i rgyu las skyes pa mi gnyis pa yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na me gcig dang tha dad ba med pa'i rgyu las skyes pa mi gnyis pa yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the two fires that are produced from a cause that is not different from one fire are not different from that one fire.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'dod pa la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'dod pa la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And pleasure, pain, desire, etc. are produced from a cause that is not different from consciousness. This is a natural inference.

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs grub pa nye bar sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs grub pa nye bar sbyor bar byed do //
translated: He applies the established inference with ‚Äújust as it is, etc.‚Äù

original: bde ba la sogs pa bdag nyid ji bzhin dbang po dang rung ba dang bcas pa dang / don bcas @204a * //üîΩdang ni yul rung ba dang bcas pa yod pa dang / sems rung yang sems rung ba yod na ste /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa bdag nyid ji bzhin dbang po dang rung ba dang bcas pa dang / don bcas @204a * // dang ni yul rung ba dang bcas pa yod pa dang / sems rung yang sems rung ba yod na ste /
translated: The self is the same as pleasure, etc., when the sense faculty is fit, the object is present, and the self is present.

original: sngar gyi yid la byed pa'i nus pa yod pa'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid can yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngar gyi yid la byed pa'i nus pa yod pa'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid can yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The self is present when the mind is fit, i.e., when the consciousness characterized by the capacity of the prior mental attention is present.

original: bde la sogs pa'i skye ba mthong //
analyzed: bde la sogs pa'i skye ba mthong //
translated: The arising of pleasure, etc., is seen to be similar to that of the mind.

original: yid kyang de dang mtshungs pa yin//
analyzed: yid kyang de dang mtshungs pa yin//
translated: The mind is also similar to that.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshungs pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshungs pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: When the causes of the sense faculty, etc., are similar as they have been explained,

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshungs pa las skye ba yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshungs pa las skye ba yin no //
translated: the arising of pleasure, etc., is similar to that.

original: mthong ba smos pas ni khyed cag 'dod pa'i bdag dang yid ldan pa tsam las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi bde ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan to//
analyzed: mthong ba smos pas ni khyed cag 'dod pa'i bdag dang yid ldan pa tsam las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi bde ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan to//
translated: The word ‚Äúseen‚Äù indicates that pleasure, etc., which are supposed by you to arise from the mere presence of the self and the mind, do not exist.

original: rgyu mtshungs pa can nyid yin na yang 'dus byas la sogs pa nges par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /üîΩbde ba la sogs pa mi shes pa'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rgyu mtshungs pa can nyid yin na yang 'dus byas la sogs pa nges par byed pa yin pa'i phyir / bde ba la sogs pa mi shes pa'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were the same as the cause, then the self would be of the nature of not knowing pleasure, etc., because it is the determiner of the conditioned, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rtog pa yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rtog pa yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable to imagine that the self is of the nature of not knowing pleasure, etc., but that consciousness is not.

original: de ltar na /üîΩde dag med dang re re 'jig ba na //
analyzed: de ltar na / de dag med dang re re 'jig ba na //
translated: Thus,

original: de las gzhan yod na yang /
analyzed: de las gzhan yod na yang /
translated: when they do not exist, or when each is destroyed,

original: la lar bde ba la sogs blo //
analyzed: la lar bde ba la sogs blo //
translated: the cognition of pleasure, etc.

original: mi skye mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi skye mthong ngo //
translated: is not seen to arise in relation to that.

original: de dag yod pa na /
analyzed: de dag yod pa na /
translated: When they exist,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa yod pa na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa yod pa na /
translated: when the faculties, etc., as previously described, exist,

original: la lar bde ba la sogs blo //
analyzed: la lar bde ba la sogs blo //
translated: the cognition of pleasure, etc.

original: skye ba mthong /
analyzed: skye ba mthong /
translated: is seen to arise.

original: de ltar na bde ba la sogs pa dang blo ni de tsam gyi rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bde ba la sogs pa dang blo ni de tsam gyi rgyu can yin no //
translated: Thus, pleasure, etc., and cognition have only those as their causes.

original: des te de phyir /
analyzed: des te de phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i nus pa can gyi dbang po la sogs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i nus pa can gyi dbang po la sogs pa /
translated: the faculties, etc., which have the capacity to be seen in that way,

original: de las gzhan las te /
analyzed: de las gzhan las te /
translated: from something other than that,

original: 'dus byas la sogs pa gzhan las blo'am bde ba la sogs pa de skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas la sogs pa gzhan las blo'am bde ba la sogs pa de skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Pleasure, etc., do not arise from other things, such as the conditioned, etc.

original: de lta ma yin na ni de ltar yongs su mthong ba'i nus pa can las gzhan nus pa ma mthong ba can rgyu nyid du khas len na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni de ltar yongs su mthong ba'i nus pa can las gzhan nus pa ma mthong ba can rgyu nyid du khas len na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, then, when one sees that something is capable of being perceived in a certain way, one would have to accept that something else, which is not seen to have that capacity, is the cause.

original: gal te rgyu mtshungs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te rgyu mtshungs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If you claim that pleasure, etc., are not of a different nature from consciousness because they are similar to it in being causes,

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin du 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin du 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: then, at the time that you assert that pleasure, etc., are not of a different nature from consciousness,

original: phan tshun bde ba la sogs pa de dag rang bzhin tha dad pa gang yin pa de tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: phan tshun bde ba la sogs pa de dag rang bzhin tha dad pa gang yin pa de tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: those mutually different pleasures, etc., would not be different.üîΩThat is not so!

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: For,

original: 'di ltar / bde sdug sogs ni tha dad yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bde sdug sogs ni tha dad yin //
translated: Pleasure, pain, etc., are different.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩdbang po la sogs pa yi rgyu //üîΩde dag nyid kyis khyab pa las //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / dbang po la sogs pa yi rgyu // de dag nyid kyis khyab pa las //
translated: Why?

original: nang gi rgyu yi khyad par gyis //
analyzed: nang gi rgyu yi khyad par gyis //
translated: Because of the difference in the internal causes,üîΩwhich are the sense faculties, etc.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are pervaded by those very causes.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is the example?

original: dper na blo de nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: dper na blo de nyid kyis ni //
translated: For example, by that very cognition,

original: yul dang dbang po la sogs pa mtshungs pa las skyes pa ni nang nas /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po la sogs pa mtshungs pa las skyes pa ni nang nas /
translated: from the similar causes of objects, faculties, and so on, the internal

original: gsal dang mi @204b gsal the tshom bzhin //
analyzed: gsal dang mi @204b gsal the tshom bzhin //
translated: is like the clarity, obscurity, and doubt.

original: rang bzhin tha dad par 'gyur ba de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa dang rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshungs pa yin du zin kyang khyad par du 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad par 'gyur ba de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa dang rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshungs pa yin du zin kyang khyad par du 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: Just as they arise with different natures, so too, even though pleasure and so on are similar causes of consciousness, they become distinct.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the position: ‚ÄúPleasure and so on are the nature of consciousness.‚Äù

original: rab tu bsgrubs nas don gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag nyid myong bar byed pa yin no zhes rab tu sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: rab tu bsgrubs nas don gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag nyid myong bar byed pa yin no zhes rab tu sgrub par byed do //
translated: Having established that, he proves that it is self-experience with ‚Äúthe object called . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe bdag nyid bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag nyid bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When pleasure and so on are not experienced by oneself,

original: de dag blo lhan cig skyes pa'am dus phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyis nyams su myong bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de dag blo lhan cig skyes pa'am dus phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyis nyams su myong bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: then they are experienced by the innate cognition or by the cognition that arises later.

original: de la re zhig lhan cig skyes ba'i blo ni ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar don gang nye bas mngon du phyogs pas /üîΩblo dang ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig lhan cig skyes ba'i blo ni ma yin te / 'di ltar don gang nye bas mngon du phyogs pas / blo dang ni /
translated: First, the innate mind does not experience pleasure, etc.üîΩbecause the mind and pleasure, etc.

original: bde sogs de dag skyed yin na //
analyzed: bde sogs de dag skyed yin na //
translated: are generated by the presence of a proximate object.

original: don de bor nas ni blo //
analyzed: don de bor nas ni blo //
translated: If the mind abandons that object,

original: des bde sogs ji ltar te /
analyzed: des bde sogs ji ltar te /
translated: how could it experience pleasure, etc.?

original: rgyu yul med par rtogs 'gyur ba yin rig pa ni yul gang las skyes pa de nyid 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu yul med par rtogs 'gyur ba yin rig pa ni yul gang las skyes pa de nyid 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The mind is the cognition that arises from an object and apprehends that object.

original: de bas na bde ba la sogs pa nyid du yongs su bcad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bde ba la sogs pa nyid du yongs su bcad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, pleasure, etc. are not ascertained as pleasure, etc.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i blos bde ba myong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i blos bde ba myong ba ma yin no //
translated: the innate mind does not experience pleasure.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na rgyun gyi 'jug pa'i blo dang bde ba la sogs pa la dus phyis 'byung ba'i yid kyi ngang tshul can gyi shes pas rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na rgyun gyi 'jug pa'i blo dang bde ba la sogs pa la dus phyis 'byung ba'i yid kyi ngang tshul can gyi shes pas rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the mind that experiences pleasure is a later consciousness that has the mode of apprehension of the mind that experiences pleasure, etc.,

original: rim gyis 'dzin par khas len na de myong ba gzugs myong ba dang bde ba myong ba na rgyun mi 'chad par snang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rim gyis 'dzin par khas len na de myong ba gzugs myong ba dang bde ba myong ba na rgyun mi 'chad par snang mi 'gyur /
translated: If you claim that they are apprehended gradually, then when form is experienced and pleasure is experienced, they would not appear without interruption.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: dang por mthong zhing phyis bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: dang por mthong zhing phyis bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba yin pa de ltar na /
translated: First, form is seen and later pleasure and so on is experienced.

original: bde ba nyams su myong ba dang yul nyams su myong ba ni bar dang bcas shing bar med par ma gyur na /
analyzed: bde ba nyams su myong ba dang yul nyams su myong ba ni bar dang bcas shing bar med par ma gyur na /
translated: If the experience of pleasure and the experience of the object are not uninterrupted and not without interval,

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar gang gi tshe yul dmigs pa de nyid kyi tshe /
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te / 'di ltar gang gi tshe yul dmigs pa de nyid kyi tshe /
translated: then that is not possible.

original: bde ba yang dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba yang dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when the object is observed, at that time pleasure is also observed.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: That is so, but

original: gal te de myur phyir /üîΩyul dang bde ba la dmigs pa dag par dang bcas shing bar med pa nyid yin na yang de dag rgyun chad ba med par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: gal te de myur phyir / yul dang bde ba la dmigs pa dag par dang bcas shing bar med pa nyid yin na yang de dag rgyun chad ba med par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: if they are without interval because they are swift,

original: 'dir 'jug pa myur bar byas pa'i 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir 'jug pa myur bar byas pa'i 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then even if the observation of the object and the observation of pleasure are uninterrupted and without interval, the conception that they are not interrupted is a mistake made because their engagement is swift.

original: de mtshungs phyir /
analyzed: de mtshungs phyir /
translated: Because they are similar.

original: nyams su myong min cir mi 'dod //
analyzed: nyams su myong min cir mi 'dod //
translated: If it is not experienced, then it is not asserted.

original: gal te mgyogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te mgyogs pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is asserted that the object is experienced because it is quickly cognized,

original: rgyun mi 'chad par shes pa de'i tshe /üîΩji ltar bde ba myong ba de myur du 'jug pa de ltar rnam par shes pa yul 'ba' @205a * //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par shes pa de'i tshe / ji ltar bde ba myong ba de myur du 'jug pa de ltar rnam par shes pa yul 'ba' @205a * //
translated: then at that time,

original: zhig 'dzin pa bde ba myong ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa yang de ltar mgyogs par mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhig 'dzin pa bde ba myong ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa yang de ltar mgyogs par mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: just as the experience of pleasure quickly engages, so too the consciousness apprehending only the object, which is not the nature of the experience of pleasure, would be similar in being quick.

original: de'i dbang gis bde ba myong ba ma yin pa rtogs pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis bde ba myong ba ma yin pa rtogs pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, why would it not be the case that the non-experience of pleasure is understood by its power?

original: dbang po'i shes pa nyid yul dang bde ba la sogs pa la cig car 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa nyid yul dang bde ba la sogs pa la cig car 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also not reasonable to think that the sense consciousness itself simultaneously apprehends the object and pleasure, etc.

original: de ltar na don gang las dbang po'i blo skyes pa'i don de bor nas /
analyzed: de ltar na don gang las dbang po'i blo skyes pa'i don de bor nas /
translated: Thus, having abandoned the object from which the sense cognition arises,

original: dus mtshungs par 'gyur ba can nyid kyis yul ma yin pa'i bde ba la sogs pa ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur zhes lhan cig skyes pa'i dbang po'i blo //
analyzed: dus mtshungs par 'gyur ba can nyid kyis yul ma yin pa'i bde ba la sogs pa ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur zhes lhan cig skyes pa'i dbang po'i blo //
translated: how could it apprehend pleasure, etc., which are not objects by being simultaneous with them?

original: gcig gis gnyis shes ma yin te //
analyzed: gcig gis gnyis shes ma yin te //
translated: One consciousness does not know another.

original: yul dang bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul dang bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that it grasps objects, pleasure, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbang po'i sems ni nges phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i sems ni nges phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind is restricted to the sense faculty.

original: dbang po'i shes pa yul gzhan la 'jug pa med pas yul nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa yul gzhan la 'jug pa med pas yul nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the sense consciousness does not engage other objects, it is restricted to its object.

original: bde ba la sogs pa yang bdag dang yid dang ldan pa dag las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'dzin to zhes bya bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang bdag dang yid dang ldan pa dag las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'dzin to zhes bya bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, pleasure, etc., are accepted as being grasped by mental consciousness, which has the mode of arising from the self and the mind.

original: ldog pa las nus ba rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ldog pa las nus ba rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: One infers the capacity from the exclusion,

original: lhan cig 'byung ba tsam las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba tsam las ni ma yin no //
translated: but not from mere co-occurrence.

original: rnam par shes pa la bde ba la sogs pa nus pa de 'dra ba yod ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la bde ba la sogs pa nus pa de 'dra ba yod ba ma yin te /
translated: Such a capacity for pleasure, etc., does not exist in consciousness.

original: bde sogs med na yang /
analyzed: bde sogs med na yang /
translated: Even without pleasure, etc.,

original: bde ba la sogs pa re re med na yang don dag las dbang po'i blo skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa re re med na yang don dag las dbang po'i blo skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: even when each of pleasure, etc., is absent, the sense consciousness arises from objects.

original: don dag las skye phyir rgyu'i bde ba la sogs pa de dag gis nus pa rnam par shes pa skyed pa las ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: don dag las skye phyir rgyu'i bde ba la sogs pa de dag gis nus pa rnam par shes pa skyed pa las ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Because the object arises from the cause, the cause, pleasure, etc., is not established as the producer of the potency of consciousness.

original: de nus grub med phyir /
analyzed: de nus grub med phyir /
translated: Because that potency is not established.

original: dbang po'i sems kyi bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i sems kyi bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: The mind of the sense faculty does not apprehend pleasure, etc.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so,

original: ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa re re med na yang sngon po la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur ba de tsam gyis sngon po la sogs pa lhan cig pa re re rnam par shes pa skyed pa la nus pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa re re med na yang sngon po la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur ba de tsam gyis sngon po la sogs pa lhan cig pa re re rnam par shes pa skyed pa la nus pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: but even though each of the individual blue, etc., is not the cognition of blue, etc., that much does not negate the individual simultaneous blue, etc., as having the potency to produce cognition.

original: de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa dang yul gnyi ga dag kyang rnam par shes pa la nus pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa dang yul gnyi ga dag kyang rnam par shes pa la nus pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, both the object and pleasure, etc., will have potency in consciousness.

original: de ltar na gnyi ga 'dzin pa la 'gal ba yod ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na gnyi ga 'dzin pa la 'gal ba yod ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus there is no contradiction in apprehending both.

original: de de ltar na sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du yul dang bde ba gnyis kyis so so so sor yang nus pa ma yin na ste khas len par byed na yul 'dzin pa med par /
analyzed: de de ltar na sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du yul dang bde ba gnyis kyis so so so sor yang nus pa ma yin na ste khas len par byed na yul 'dzin pa med par /
translated: If you accept that, then like blue and so on, the object and pleasure are not individually capable of being apprehended.

original: sngon sogs bzhin /
analyzed: sngon sogs bzhin /
translated: If you accept that, then like blue and so on,

original: bde ba 'ba' zhig 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: bde ba 'ba' zhig 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: pleasure alone would be apprehended without the apprehension of the object.üîΩJust as each of blue and so on is seen to have the capacity to be positively and negatively concomitant with consciousness, so too the collection of those is not without the capacity to be positively and negatively concomitant with consciousness.

original: sngon po la sogs pa re re yang rjes su 'gro ba @205b dang ldog bdag gi nus pa mthong ba can yin pa de ltar tshogs pa de dag kyang rang gi shes pa la nus pa ma bcom pa ma yin pa de ltar bde ba la sogs pa
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa re re yang rjes su 'gro ba @205b dang ldog bdag gi nus pa mthong ba can yin pa de ltar tshogs pa de dag kyang rang gi shes pa la nus pa ma bcom pa ma yin pa de ltar bde ba la sogs pa
translated: Thus pleasure and so on

original: re re nus pa med pa'am /
analyzed: re re nus pa med pa'am /
translated: are not individually capable of being apprehended.

original: nus pa yod na bde ba yan gar bar yang myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus pa yod na bde ba yan gar bar yang myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are capable of being apprehended, then pleasure alone would be experienced.

original: de ltar na yang khas blangs ba mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang khas blangs ba mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, your assertion would be untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de rgyu'i don ni mi 'dzin pa la sogs pa de dag gi rgyur gyur pa'i don rnam par shes pas rtogs pa med par /
analyzed: de rgyu'i don ni mi 'dzin pa la sogs pa de dag gi rgyur gyur pa'i don rnam par shes pas rtogs pa med par /
translated: Because the meaning of cause is not apprehended. Consciousness does not cognize the meaning that is the cause of those.

original: bde ba la sogs yan gar ba //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs yan gar ba //
translated: Pleasure and so on are not alone.

original: de yis myong ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: de yis myong ba mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that it experience.

original: yul dmigs par 'gyur bas bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yul dmigs par 'gyur bas bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Since the object is perceived, pleasure, etc. are experienced.

original: mi dmigs pas ni ma yin pa de ltar na don 'dzin pa la ltos pa med par de ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pas ni ma yin pa de ltar na don 'dzin pa la ltos pa med par de ma yin no //
translated: But not when it is not perceived. Thus, it is not without depending on the apprehension of the object.

original: ci ste yang don dang lhan cig bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /üîΩdon dang lhan cig 'dzin na ni //
analyzed: ci ste yang don dang lhan cig bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin par 'dod pa de'i tshe / don dang lhan cig 'dzin na ni //
translated: But if you maintain that pleasure, etc. are apprehended together with the object,üîΩthen,

original: khas lan par byed na /
analyzed: khas lan par byed na /
translated: if you admit that,

original: bde sogs kyi ni nus pa ci //
analyzed: bde sogs kyi ni nus pa ci //
translated: what is the capacity of pleasure, etc.

original: dbang po'i shes pa de 'dzin pa nyid du 'dod pa lta ste ci yang cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa de 'dzin pa nyid du 'dod pa lta ste ci yang cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no ;
translated: There is not the slightest capacity of pleasure, etc. to be apprehended by the sense consciousness, as you maintain.üîΩWhy is that?

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because,

original: 'di ltar / gang de las 'byung ci mi 'dod //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang de las 'byung ci mi 'dod //
translated: why not accept that which arises from it?

original: bde ba la sogs pa de las bde ba la sogs pa'i blo skye par mi 'dod pa de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa las ma skyes pas dbang po'i blo'i yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa de las bde ba la sogs pa'i blo skye par mi 'dod pa de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa las ma skyes pas dbang po'i blo'i yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since you do not accept that the cognition of pleasure, etc. arises from pleasure, etc., it is not the object of the sense consciousnesses, because it does not arise from pleasure, etc.

original: de de ltar na don dang lhan cig bde ba la sogs pa rtogs pas mi rung ngo /
analyzed: de de ltar na don dang lhan cig bde ba la sogs pa rtogs pas mi rung ngo /
translated: Thus, it is not tenable that pleasure and so on are realized in dependence on objects.

original: // / tshad ma rnams 'grel gyi 'grel ba /üîΩbam po sum cu pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnams 'grel gyi 'grel ba / bam po sum cu pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: That may be so,

original: don la ltos pa med pa kho nar bde ba la sogs pa rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don la ltos pa med pa kho nar bde ba la sogs pa rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: but pleasure and so on are realized without any dependence on objects.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is also not possible.

original: de ltar na don med par ni don 'dzin pas dben par /
analyzed: de ltar na don med par ni don 'dzin pas dben par /
translated: Thus, without an object, the apprehension of an object is absent.

original: bde ba la sogs yan gar rnams //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs yan gar rnams //
translated: The separate aspects of pleasure and so on

original: mig sogs rnams kyis te /
analyzed: mig sogs rnams kyis te /
translated: are not experienced by the eye and so on.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas myong na ni khas len par byed na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas myong na ni khas len par byed na /
translated: If you accept that they are experienced by the eye consciousness and so on,

original: gzugs sogs tha dad bde ba sgrub par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs sogs tha dad bde ba sgrub par byed pa'am /
translated: then it would be impossible to establish that pleasure and so on are different from form and so on.

original: sdug bsngal grub par byed pa'i bud med sogs tha dad bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa mthun pa dang mi mthun pa /üîΩ'ga' tshe mig gis 'dzin mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal grub par byed pa'i bud med sogs tha dad bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa mthun pa dang mi mthun pa / 'ga' tshe mig gis 'dzin mi 'gyur //
translated: Or it would be impossible to establish that women and so on, who are the basis for the production of suffering, are different from men and so on.üîΩSometimes the eye does not apprehend.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang mig gi rnam par shes pas 'dzin par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang mig gi rnam par shes pas 'dzin par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Sometimes the eye consciousness does not apprehend.

original: bde ba 'ba' zhig myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba 'ba' zhig myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will experience only happiness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar don nang de nus pa //üîΩyan lag yin na ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar don nang de nus pa // yan lag yin na ni /
translated: Because the object is capable of producing that effect.üîΩIf the object were an external sense-sphere,

original: phyi rol mthong can blo mi rigs //
analyzed: phyi rol mthong can blo mi rigs //
translated: then the cognition would not be possible.

original: nang gi yan lag ni @206a * //
analyzed: nang gi yan lag ni @206a * //
translated: The internal sense-sphere

original: rang gi rgyu la yod pa'i bde ba la sogs ba'i don gyi nus pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu la yod pa'i bde ba la sogs ba'i don gyi nus pa yod pa'o //
translated: is the capacity of the object, such as pleasure, etc., to produce its effect in its own cause.

original: de nye ba yod na dbang po'i blo yis rtag tu de nyid 'dzin par byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de nye ba yod na dbang po'i blo yis rtag tu de nyid 'dzin par byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If that capacity is present, the cognition of the sense faculty will always apprehend that.

original: phyi rol gyi don phyi yan lag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don phyi yan lag ni ma yin no //
translated: The external sense-sphere is not the object.

original: bde ba la sogs pa yan gar ba 'dzin par khas len par byed pa de ltar na yang las bde ba la sogs pa 'di dang 'di las 'di ma yin no zhes shes pa med na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yan gar ba 'dzin par khas len par byed pa de ltar na yang las bde ba la sogs pa 'di dang 'di las 'di ma yin no zhes shes pa med na /
translated: Even if one accepts that it apprehends only pleasure, etc., if one does not know that this pleasure, etc. is from this and not from that,

original: 'ba' zhig kyang de thob pa dang spong ba'i phyir 'bad rtsol mi byed do //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig kyang de thob pa dang spong ba'i phyir 'bad rtsol mi byed do //
translated: then one will not make an effort to obtain only that and abandon the other.

original: de la bdag dang yid ldan pas bde ba la sogs pa myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la bdag dang yid ldan pas bde ba la sogs pa myong ba'i phyir /
translated: In that case, because the self and mind possess pleasure, etc., they experience them.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pas de myong ba sgro 'dogs pa 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pas de myong ba sgro 'dogs pa 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: The experience of that by the sensory consciousness is not the superimposition of a connection.

original: dbang po'i don rtogs pa'i dus na yang bde ba la sogs pa la skyes bu dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i don rtogs pa'i dus na yang bde ba la sogs pa la skyes bu dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at the time of the realization of the object of the sense faculty, the person is observed in the pleasure, etc.

original: ci ste skyon der ma gyur cig snyam pas /
analyzed: ci ste skyon der ma gyur cig snyam pas /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúLet there not be that fault,‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa'i blos don kho na 'dzin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i blos don kho na 'dzin pa yin gyi /
translated: the mind of the eye, etc. grasps only the object.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not pleasure, etc.

original: de yang bdag dang yid dang ldan pa las byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pas ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yang bdag dang yid dang ldan pa las byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pas ma yin no zhe na /
translated: And that is not by a cognition that has the nature of arising from the self, the mind, and the sense faculty.

original: de ltar don 'dzin na ni /
analyzed: de ltar don 'dzin na ni /
translated: If it were to grasp the object in that way,

original: khas len par byed do //
analyzed: khas len par byed do //
translated: we would accept it.

original: de las skyes /
analyzed: de las skyes /
translated: It would arise from that.

original: dbang po'i yul nyid las skyes pa'i bde ba la sogs pa myong mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i yul nyid las skyes pa'i bde ba la sogs pa myong mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The pleasure, etc. that arises from the object of the sense faculty would not be experienced.

original: de ltar na yul la dmigs pa yang bdag dang yid dang dbang po phrad pa las byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yul la dmigs pa yang bdag dang yid dang dbang po phrad pa las byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the observation of the object would not be without a cognition that has the nature of arising from the contact of the self, the mind, and the sense faculty.

original: shes pa de yang don la dmigs shing don nyid la nye bar sbyor ba yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa de yang don la dmigs shing don nyid la nye bar sbyor ba yin gyi /
translated: That consciousness also focuses on an object and is applied to the object itself.

original: yid nyid pa ni yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: yid nyid pa ni yod pa ma yin na /
translated: But if the mind does not exist,

original: gang las bde ba la sogs pa rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang las bde ba la sogs pa rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: from what is pleasure and so on cognized?

original: dus 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa yod pa'i dus na yang /
analyzed: dus 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa yod pa'i dus na yang /
translated: Even when consciousness exists, which has the mode of arising in time,

original: bde ba la sogs pa yul gyi stobs las byung ba'i ngang tshul can yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yul gyi stobs las byung ba'i ngang tshul can yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: pleasure and so on do not exist that arise from the power of objects.

original: de dag nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩgang gi tshe dbang po'i blo de'i dus nyid na yid kyi blo skye bar 'gyur ba'i de'i tshe de dag las gcig ni don 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro // gang gi tshe dbang po'i blo de'i dus nyid na yid kyi blo skye bar 'gyur ba'i de'i tshe de dag las gcig ni don 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: Thus they are not experienced.

original: gzhan ni bde ba la sogs pa myong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan ni bde ba la sogs pa myong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: When the mind that is the sense faculty arises at the same time as the mind that is the mental faculty, at that time one of them apprehends the object and the other experiences pleasure and so on.üîΩIf you assert that,

original: de ltar na yang dbang po la brten pa dang / cig shos kyi blo ni cig car skye ba na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang dbang po la brten pa dang / cig shos kyi blo ni cig car skye ba na /
translated: then even though the mind that is the sense faculty and the other mind arise simultaneously,

original: khas len par byed na /
analyzed: khas len par byed na /
translated: you accept that

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: that is so.

original: 'on kyang / yul de dang ni de yod phyir //
analyzed: 'on kyang / yul de dang ni de yod phyir //
translated: But,

original: yul de dang de las so sor nye ba nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: yul de dang de las so sor nye ba nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: because of the presence of the object and the proximity of the object,

original: cig car rnam par shes pa rnams 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: cig car rnam par shes pa rnams 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: because the consciousnesses arise simultaneously,

original: cig car don ni yod pa na //
analyzed: cig car don ni yod pa na //
translated: if the object exists simultaneously,

original: cig @206b car bde sdug dag ni rig bar 'gyur /
analyzed: cig @206b car bde sdug dag ni rig bar 'gyur /
translated: then pleasure and pain would be cognized simultaneously.

original: cig car yul 'dod pa dad mi 'dod pa nye ba na yod pa na /
analyzed: cig car yul 'dod pa dad mi 'dod pa nye ba na yod pa na /
translated: If the object that is desired and the object that is not desired are present simultaneously,

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin gyi yul dmigs pa las bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba 'gal ba dag cig car 'gyur na de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin gyi yul dmigs pa las bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba 'gal ba dag cig car 'gyur na de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: then the experience of pleasure and pain, which are mutually exclusive, would occur simultaneously, but that is unacceptable.

original: yul can 'ba' zhig nye ba tsam las bde ba la sogs pa 'byung ba nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: yul can 'ba' zhig nye ba tsam las bde ba la sogs pa 'byung ba nyid ma yin na /
translated: If pleasure and so on do not arise merely from the proximity of the object,

original: gang gis na bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba grub pa cig car 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba grub pa cig car 'gyur /
translated: then by what means would the simultaneous establishment of pleasure and pain occur?

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: gal te nang yod nyer len pa'i //
analyzed: gal te nang yod nyer len pa'i //
translated: If it is the internal, then the arising of pleasure and so on

original: nye bar len par gyur ba sa bon du gyur pa'i /
analyzed: nye bar len par gyur ba sa bon du gyur pa'i /
translated: would occur from the internal, from the appropriator, from the seed.

original: shes pa'ang sdug bsngal la sogs 'byung //
analyzed: shes pa'ang sdug bsngal la sogs 'byung //
translated: Consciousness would also arise from pleasure and so on.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba ni de gcig kyang /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba ni de gcig kyang /
translated: Pleasure and pain, etc., that are mutually exclusive cannot be one.

original: shes pa nye bar len pa ma yin pa'i phyir cig car bde ba dang sdug bsngal rigs pa ma yin no zhes 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa nye bar len pa ma yin pa'i phyir cig car bde ba dang sdug bsngal rigs pa ma yin no zhes 'dod do zhe na /
translated: And since consciousness is not the appropriator, it is illogical that pleasure and pain occur simultaneously.

original: de dang de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: 'di ltar rnam shes de ni mi shes pa'i bde ba la sogs pa ma dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam shes de ni mi shes pa'i bde ba la sogs pa ma dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can du 'dod pa'o //
translated: Because consciousness is asserted to be the nature of the nonapprehension of pleasure, etc.,

original: rnam pa gang gis na nyer len rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis na nyer len rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: By what aspect would it be the cause of appropriation?

original: 'ga' zhig gis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis kyang ma yin no //
translated: It would not be by any aspect.

original: de ltar na gang zhig gang rigs mthun pa de ni de'i nye bar len pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar na gang zhig gang rigs mthun pa de ni de'i nye bar len pa yin na /
translated: Thus, if that which is of a similar type to something is its appropriator,

original: bde ba la sogs pa mi shes pa'i ngo bo yang /üîΩshes pa ni de'i rigs can ma yin pas nye bar len par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa mi shes pa'i ngo bo yang / shes pa ni de'i rigs can ma yin pas nye bar len par mi rung ngo //
translated: then the nature of consciousness that does not know pleasure, etc.,

original: bdag po nyid kyang byed yin na //
analyzed: bdag po nyid kyang byed yin na //
translated: is not of a similar type to pleasure, etc., and therefore it is illogical that it is their appropriator.üîΩIf it is the dominant condition,

original: gal te rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu nyid yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu nyid yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be taught to be the causal condition.

original: de'i rigs can ma yin pa yang bdag po nyid de ni 'gal ba la yang 'bras bu byed pa na snang ngo //
analyzed: de'i rigs can ma yin pa yang bdag po nyid de ni 'gal ba la yang 'bras bu byed pa na snang ngo //
translated: And it is the master of those that are not of its class, for it is seen to produce an effect even in the case of incompatible things.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?üîΩFor example, like the cause of the single appearance of the eye,üîΩand the other sense faculties,üîΩlike the eyes of the night-wanderers,üîΩand the eyes of a person,

original: dper na snang gcig mtshan rgyu dang // de las gzhan pa'i dbang po dag / mtshan mo rgyu ba dang skyes bu'i mig dag / gzugs mthong ba dang mi mthun dang / mthun pa cig car byed pa bzhin /
analyzed: dper na snang gcig mtshan rgyu dang // de las gzhan pa'i dbang po dag / mtshan mo rgyu ba dang skyes bu'i mig dag / gzugs mthong ba dang mi mthun dang / mthun pa cig car byed pa bzhin /
translated: which are incompatible with seeing forms,üîΩand which function simultaneously.

original: skyes bu'i mig gzugs mthong ba dang rjes su mthun par byed cing /
analyzed: skyes bu'i mig gzugs mthong ba dang rjes su mthun par byed cing /
translated: The eyes of a person function in accordance with seeing forms.

original: mtshan mor rgyu ba'i mig gzugs mthong ba dang mi mthun pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshan mor rgyu ba'i mig gzugs mthong ba dang mi mthun pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The eyes of the night-wanderers are incompatible with seeing forms, this is the meaning.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can nam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can nam /
translated: Because in this way, the cognition that is of the nature of arising together,

original: phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa bde ba la sogs pa yang dag par mi 'grub pa /
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa bde ba la sogs pa yang dag par mi 'grub pa /
translated: or of the nature of arising later, is not established as the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: de'i phyir na bde sogs don yang dag par myong bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na bde sogs don yang dag par myong bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is the experience of the real object of pleasure, etc.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of experience is it?

original: rang la 'pho ba'i snang can te /
analyzed: rang la 'pho ba'i snang can te /
translated: The subject is the appearance of the transference.

original: rang gi sgras bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid bstan @207a * //
analyzed: rang gi sgras bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid bstan @207a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúits‚Äù indicates the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: to ; / de la 'pho ba ni gzugs brnyan nyid du snang ba can yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: to ; / de la 'pho ba ni gzugs brnyan nyid du snang ba can yin pa de ltar na /
translated: The transference is the appearance of a mere reflection.

original: gang la de lta bu'i ngang tshul yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //üîΩdes ni don dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang la de lta bu'i ngang tshul yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o // des ni don dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, that which has such a nature is so described.

original: bde ba la sogs pas yang dag par myong ba yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pas yang dag par myong ba yin no //
translated: Since it is similar to the object, it is the experience of pleasure, etc.üîΩSince it is experienced, it is the experience of the object.

original: de myong phyir na don yang dag par myong ba yin no zhes 'jig rten na tha snyad 'dogs pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: de myong phyir na don yang dag par myong ba yin no zhes 'jig rten na tha snyad 'dogs pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: This is merely a conventional expression in the world.

original: phyi rol gyi don ni myong bar byed pa /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don ni myong bar byed pa /
translated: It is not that the external object is the experiencer.üîΩIt is not the direct experiencer.

original: dngos su min zhes ston par byed do //üîΩde de ltar na /
analyzed: dngos su min zhes ston par byed do // de de ltar na /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: nang gi bdag nyid rig byed yin //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid rig byed yin //
translated: Thus, it is the internal self that is the experiencer.

original: don ni bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis don dam par ma yin no //
analyzed: don ni bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis don dam par ma yin no //
translated: The object is not, as was just explained.

original: don dam par bde ba la sogs pa de dag don las skye ba tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam par bde ba la sogs pa de dag don las skye ba tsam yin gyi /
translated: Ultimately, pleasure, etc. are merely born from the object.

original: phyi rol de dag de rnams kyis yang dag par rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol de dag de rnams kyis yang dag par rig pa ma yin no //
translated: Those external things are not cognized by them.

original: de ltar na gal te nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa de don yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa de don yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: Thus, if the object is of the nature of experience,

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis skyes pa'i phyir de rig par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis skyes pa'i phyir de rig par 'gyur na /
translated: then it is cognized because it arises in the form of that.

original: de ni phyi rol tu gyur pa'i don dag la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyi rol tu gyur pa'i don dag la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that does not exist in external objects.

original: de myong ba la yang myong ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de myong ba la yang myong ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it tenable that experience is of the nature of experience,

original: nyams su myong ba ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because experience is of the nature of self-awareness.

original: bdag nyid rig par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag nyid rig par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor is it of the nature of self,

original: rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid rig pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid rig pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for something to be both self and other.

original: rang rig pa la yang gdon mi za bar khas len par bya ste /
analyzed: rang rig pa la yang gdon mi za bar khas len par bya ste /
translated: But self-awareness must be accepted without doubt,

original: de khas mi len na gzhan nyams su myong pa nyid ni ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de khas mi len na gzhan nyams su myong pa nyid ni ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it is not accepted, the experience of something other is not established.

original: de bas na nye bar btags nas don nyams su myong ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na nye bar btags nas don nyams su myong ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that the object is experienced through designation.

original: gang zhig don gyi bdag nyid yul gyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa rang bdag gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig don gyi bdag nyid yul gyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa rang bdag gyur /
translated: That which is the nature of the object, which is the nature of the consciousness of the object, becomes the self of that.

original: bde ba la sogs pa de rnams la de dag gis myong 'gyur /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa de rnams la de dag gis myong 'gyur /
translated: Those feelings of pleasure, etc. are experienced by that.

original: nyams su myong ba ni de'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni de'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because experience has the nature of that.

original: bde ba la sogs pa la rgyu //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa la rgyu //
translated: The cause of pleasure, etc.

original: de nas don myong bar bshad de /
analyzed: de nas don myong bar bshad de /
translated: Then, the experience of the object is explained.

original: don dam par don yang nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par don yang nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ultimately, the object is not experienced.

original: 'on kyang dmigs pa dag ni phyi rol tu gyur pa'i don la dmigs pa'i don yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dmigs pa dag ni phyi rol tu gyur pa'i don la dmigs pa'i don yod pa yin no //
translated: However, the objects are external objects that are the objects of perception.

original: dmigs pa'i don de yang der snang ba yin par brjod do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i don de yang der snang ba yin par brjod do //
translated: And that object of perception is said to appear as that.

original: yul gyi rnam pa can du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba de ltar na /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa can du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba de ltar na /
translated: The consciousness that appears with the aspect of the object is produced in that way.

original: des de la dmigs pa yin no zhes tha snyad du byed do //üîΩ'ba' zhig bde sogs phyi rol na //
analyzed: des de la dmigs pa yin no zhes tha snyad du byed do // 'ba' zhig bde sogs phyi rol na //
translated: and it is on the basis of this that we speak conventionally of the mind observing such and such an object.üîΩThe SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that pleasure and so on are external to the mind.

original: gnas nyid dang ni sems med dang // gzung bar smra ste bde @207b pa la sogs pa nang ma yin zhing sems kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas nyid dang ni sems med dang // gzung bar smra ste bde @207b pa la sogs pa nang ma yin zhing sems kyang ma yin te /
translated: They say that pleasure and so on are not internal to the mind, nor are they the mind itself,

original: gzhal bya'i rang bzhin yin no zhes grangs can smra'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya'i rang bzhin yin no zhes grangs can smra'o //
translated: but rather they are the nature of the object of cognition.

original: grangs can de'i yang /
analyzed: grangs can de'i yang /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas also say:

original: cig car gnyis 'dzin mi rigs so //
analyzed: cig car gnyis 'dzin mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical to apprehend two things simultaneously.

original: sgra la sogs pa dang / bde ba cig car gnyis 'dzin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa dang / bde ba cig car gnyis 'dzin par mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical to apprehend sound and so on and pleasure simultaneously.

original: sngon po 'dzin pa myong ba gang yin pa de sngon po'i ngo bo yin gyi /
analyzed: sngon po 'dzin pa myong ba gang yin pa de sngon po'i ngo bo yin gyi /
translated: The experience of apprehending blue is the nature of blue,

original: bde ba'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: it is not the nature of pleasure.

original: gang zhig myong ba'i ngo bo'i mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni de'i myong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig myong ba'i ngo bo'i mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni de'i myong ba ma yin no //
translated: That which is not the nature of experience is not an experience.

original: bde ba la sogs pa nyid kyi sngon po la sogs pa bkod pa'i bye brag yin pa de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa la bde ba la sogs pa tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa nyid kyi sngon po la sogs pa bkod pa'i bye brag yin pa de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa la bde ba la sogs pa tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: Because pleasure, etc. are the particular arrangements of blue, etc., therefore pleasure, etc. are not different from blue, etc.

original: gal te sngo sogs las bde sogs tha dad med phyir rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te sngo sogs las bde sogs tha dad med phyir rgyu'i phyir /
translated: If pleasure, etc. are not different from blue, etc., because of being the cause,

original: sngon po la sogs pa 'dzin pa na bde ba la sogs pa yang 'dzin pa de'i phyir cig car 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa 'dzin pa na bde ba la sogs pa yang 'dzin pa de'i phyir cig car 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then when blue, etc. are apprehended, pleasure, etc. are also apprehended. Therefore, they would be apprehended simultaneously.

original: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ngo bo yin pa de ni de 'dzin pa na /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ngo bo yin pa de ni de 'dzin pa na /
translated: And the syllogism is: Whatever is not different from something, because of being its nature,

original: 'dzin pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: when that is apprehended,

original: dper na sngon po de nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sngon po de nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo lta bu'o //
translated: it is also apprehended, like the intrinsic nature of blue itself.

original: bde ba la sogs pa yang sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And pleasure, etc. are not different from blue, etc. This is a natural inference.

original: tha dad pa snang can zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma grub par ston to //
analyzed: tha dad pa snang can zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma grub par ston to //
translated: He shows that it is not established by ‚ÄúIf they are not different, etc.‚Äù

original: sngon por snang ba can gyi sems kyang gzhan yin la /üîΩrab tu dga' ba'i rnam pa can yang gzhan yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: sngon por snang ba can gyi sems kyang gzhan yin la / rab tu dga' ba'i rnam pa can yang gzhan yin pa de ltar na /
translated: The mind that appears as blue is one thing,üîΩand the mind that has the aspect of joy is another.

original: tha dad snang can sems kyi ni //
analyzed: tha dad snang can sems kyi ni //
translated: Thus, the mind that has the appearance of difference

original: gzung ba gang yin pa de las tha dad med ci yin /
analyzed: gzung ba gang yin pa de las tha dad med ci yin /
translated: does not apprehend what is not different from that.

original: sngon po dang bde ba la sogs pa gzung ba yin na yang /
analyzed: sngon po dang bde ba la sogs pa gzung ba yin na yang /
translated: Even though blue and pleasure, etc., are apprehended,

original: tha dad pa kho na yin pa de ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa kho na yin pa de ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: they are different. Thus, the reason is not established.

original: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang las tha dad par snang ba can gyi blos gzung ba ni de las tha dad pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang las tha dad par snang ba can gyi blos gzung ba ni de las tha dad pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: And the application is this: Whatever is apprehended by a mind that has the appearance of difference from something is not non-different from that,

original: dper na bde ba dang sdug bsngal lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bde ba dang sdug bsngal lta bu'o //
translated: like pleasure and pain.

original: sngon po dang bde ba yang tha dad par snang ba can gyi blo'i gzung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang bde ba yang tha dad par snang ba can gyi blo'i gzung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And blue and pleasure, etc., are apprehended by a mind that has the appearance of difference. This is the observation of a contradiction with the pervasion.

analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang yul dang rab tu dga' ba'i rnam pas ngo bo gnyis pa can yin na yang /

analyzed: gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin par bsam par mi bya'o //

original: de ltar na kho bo cag gis rnam pa de dag ni don dam pa yin no zhes khas blangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na kho bo cag gis rnam pa de dag ni don dam pa yin no zhes khas blangs pa ma yin no //

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What are they, then?

original: rnam par bslad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par bslad pa yin no //

original: gzhan dag yang dag @208a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag yang dag @208a * //

original: pa'i rnam par zhen pa de ltar na de'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: pa'i rnam par zhen pa de ltar na de'i skyon yin no //

original: de ltar na bde ba la sogs pa phyi rol tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na bde ba la sogs pa phyi rol tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, pleasure, etc. are not external.

original: gal te phyi rol du 'gyur ba de'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa phyi rol bye brag med mod kyi de'i yul can 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i bye brag dang btang snyoms su gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid can gyi /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol du 'gyur ba de'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa phyi rol bye brag med mod kyi de'i yul can 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i bye brag dang btang snyoms su gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid can gyi /
translated: If they were external, then although there would be no difference in the externality of pleasure, etc. , there would be a difference in the nature of the subjective experience of desire, aversion, and indifference.

original: goms pa shin tu phul 'byung las //üîΩblo la dga' dang yongs su gdung //
analyzed: goms pa shin tu phul 'byung las // blo la dga' dang yongs su gdung //

analyzed: shin tu phul 'byung mi rung ngo //

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs pa bye brag med pa yin na yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs pa bye brag med pa yin na yang /
translated: Thus, external pleasure, etc. are not different in nature.üîΩBut, due to the difference of habit of many viewers, there is a difference of pleasure, etc.

original: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin dad ldan pa'i lta ba po mang po dag la goms pa'i khyad par las bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par yod ba de ltar na bde ba la sogs pa'i don gyi ngo bo ma yin no //üîΩsbyor ba ni gang zhig bye brag med pa yin na yang /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin dad ldan pa'i lta ba po mang po dag la goms pa'i khyad par las bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par yod ba de ltar na bde ba la sogs pa'i don gyi ngo bo ma yin no // sbyor ba ni gang zhig bye brag med pa yin na yang /
translated: The syllogism is: Although there is no difference in external objects, the difference of pleasure, etc. is due to the difference of habit.

original: goms pa'i khyad par las gang gi khyad par 'gyur ba de ni phyi'am der snang ba can ma yin te /
analyzed: goms pa'i khyad par las gang gi khyad par 'gyur ba de ni phyi'am der snang ba can ma yin te /
translated: That which is not different in nature, but has a difference due to the difference of habit, is not external, or is not an appearance of that.

analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi yin par bye brag med pa yin na yang shes rab la sogs pa khyad par can yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, although there is no difference in external objects, there is a difference in wisdom, etc.

analyzed: nang gi dga' ba dang gdung ba dag kyang bde ba la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yin par bye brag med na yang /

analyzed: goms pa'i khyad par las khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi / gal te blo yang bde la sogs //

analyzed: bdag nyid du ni 'gal med na //

original: phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs pa phul du byung ba med na yang phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i bde ba la sogs pa dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni blo yang sgra la sogs pa bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can khoüîΩna yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs pa phul du byung ba med na yang phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i bde ba la sogs pa dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni blo yang sgra la sogs pa bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can kho na yin no //

original: rgyu des na phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs pa phul du byung ba med pa can yin na yang dga' ba dang gdung ba dag phul du byung bar 'gyur ba 'gal ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu des na phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs pa phul du byung ba med pa can yin na yang dga' ba dang gdung ba dag phul du byung bar 'gyur ba 'gal ba med do zhe na /

original: gal te de ltar /üîΩphyi rol de dang bde ba la sogs /
analyzed: gal te de ltar / phyi rol de dang bde ba la sogs /

analyzed: bdag nyid ces ni ji ltar rtogs //

original: gang gi blo nyid kyi bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba dag gi phul du byung ba grub pa de'i tshe sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa gzhan la yang /
analyzed: gang gi blo nyid kyi bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba dag gi phul du byung ba grub pa de'i tshe sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa gzhan la yang /
translated: When the mind itself is established as the best of joys and complete burnings, then it is also established as the best of the apprehensions of sound and so on.üîΩ

original: blo las byung ba nyid bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo las byung ba nyid bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind itself is established as the best of joys and torments, such as pleasure, then the apprehension of sound and so on will also arise from the mind.

original: de'i tshe nang du snang ba nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo can gcig srog chags thams cad la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe nang du snang ba nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo can gcig srog chags thams cad la yod pa yin te /
translated: At that time, the essence of the experience of inner appearances exists for all living beings.üîΩThe opposite of that, external pleasure and so on, does not exist.

original: de las bzlog pa phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs pa gzhan ni @208b yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs pa gzhan ni @208b yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gal te rigs tha dad pa yang //
analyzed: gal te rigs tha dad pa yang //
translated: If the different types of consciousness

analyzed: gzung 'dzin nyid ni phyir min na //

analyzed: gal te rigs mi mthun pa gzung ba'am 'dzin pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu bsal //

analyzed: 'di ltar blo la yul rang gi rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyur 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: de ni skyes bu la yang yod pa yin pa de ltar na ma nges pa yin no //

analyzed: blo dang bde ba'o //

analyzed: de ltar na rigs @209a * //

analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar phyi rol la tha dad pa med pa yang goms pa dang rjes su 'brel pas bde ba la sogs pa phul du byung ba dang ldan pa de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa de dag nang nyid yin no zhes khong du chud par

translated: This also

analyzed: myong nyid phyir na sems yin no //

analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni sems nyid yin te myong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir myong ba yin pas sems nyid yin par 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar / gang gi ngo bo myong ma yin //

analyzed: rigs pa yod pa tsam gyis myong ba ni ma yin te /

analyzed: de bas na gang zhig gang gis ngo bo myong bar mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i myong ba ma yin no //

analyzed: nyams su myong ba yang bde ba'i ngo bo myong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //

analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo myong ba ma yin no //

analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /

analyzed: @209b brten nas bde dang sdug bsngal sogs myong ba //

analyzed: gzhan bar du ste yul la sogs pa dang myong ba'i bar du gzhan ni ma mthong ste /
translated: But no other entity, such as an object, is seen in between.

original: gang zhig nye ba las nyams su myong ba phul du byung ba med pa can yang phul du byung ba dang ldan par mtshon par bya ba yin pa 'dod pa'i blo'i ngo bo phul du byung ba dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig nye ba las nyams su myong ba phul du byung ba med pa can yang phul du byung ba dang ldan par mtshon par bya ba yin pa 'dod pa'i blo'i ngo bo phul du byung ba dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: But the nature of the desire to apprehend something as excellent that does not experience anything excellent is not excellent.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las tha dad par phul du byung ba dang ldan par mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las tha dad par phul du byung ba dang ldan par mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa de ni /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is not apprehended as excellent in contrast to something else

original: de las tha dad par khas blang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de las tha dad par khas blang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: is not to be accepted as different from that.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa gnyis pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa gnyis pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a second existent consciousness.

original: sems la yang shes pa yod pa las tha dad par phul du byung ba dang ldan pa nye bar mtshon par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'o /
analyzed: sems la yang shes pa yod pa las tha dad par phul du byung ba dang ldan pa nye bar mtshon par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'o /
translated: And the mind is not to be apprehended as excellent in contrast to existent consciousness. This is the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is the case, but

original: gal te 'dres phyir dbyer med do //
analyzed: gal te 'dres phyir dbyer med do //
translated: if you say that they are not different because they are mixed,

original: lcags gong dang ni me bzhin na //
analyzed: lcags gong dang ni me bzhin na //
translated: like a lump of iron and fire,üîΩthen the example is not established.

original: ji ltar lcags kyi gong bu shin tu 'bar ba'i gzugs me las tha dad par nye bar mtshon par bya ba med par lcags kyi gong bu la me'i ngo bo 'ba' zhig tu 'dzin par byed pa de ltar blo dang myong ba tha dad pa yang 'dres pa
analyzed: ji ltar lcags kyi gong bu shin tu 'bar ba'i gzugs me las tha dad par nye bar mtshon par bya ba med par lcags kyi gong bu la me'i ngo bo 'ba' zhig tu 'dzin par byed pa de ltar blo dang myong ba tha dad pa yang 'dres pa
translated: Just as the form of a mass of burning iron is not perceived as distinct from fire, and one apprehends the mass of iron as just fire, so also cognition and experience are not known as distinct from the mixture.

original: las tha dad par mi shes pa de ltar na ma nges pa yin par smra'o //
analyzed: las tha dad par mi shes pa de ltar na ma nges pa yin par smra'o //
translated: Thus, it is said that it is not ascertained.

original: gal te de lta bu yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de lta bu yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If that is so,üîΩthen the distinction of the mixture from all thingsüîΩand the distinction of the mixture from itself are untenable.

original: gang dang gang las gcig tu zhen pa de la 'di 'dres par the tshom za bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dang gang las gcig tu zhen pa de la 'di 'dres par the tshom za bar 'gyur te /
translated: The distinction of the mixture from all things and the distinction of the mixture from itself are untenable.

original: dper na lcags gong dmar po lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lcags gong dmar po lta bu'o //
translated: The distinction of the mixture from

original: de ltar na la lar gcig nyid du nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na la lar gcig nyid du nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is not ascertained that it is one.

original: de bas na du ma nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na du ma nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is not even multiple,

original: 'di ni de sngon du song ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni de sngon du song ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is preceded by that.

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ci'i phyir yang mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ci'i phyir yang mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it not also established as different or non-different?

original: 'di ltar tha dad pa med par myong ba'i don gang yin pa de gang gi tshe gcig nyid yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /üîΩtha dad med can myong gcig na //
analyzed: 'di ltar tha dad pa med par myong ba'i don gang yin pa de gang gi tshe gcig nyid yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe / tha dad med can myong gcig na //
translated: Thus, when that which is experienced without difference is asserted to be one,üîΩthen it is not different.

original: de ltar min gang tha dad pa can med pa myong bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar min gang tha dad pa can med pa myong bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: That which is not experienced without difference is not different.

original: rnam pa du ma la dmigs pa can de tha dad bzhin du 'grub 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa du ma la dmigs pa can de tha dad bzhin du 'grub 'gyur /
translated: That which observes many aspects is established as different.

original: @210a * // 'di la tha dad pa yod pa de ltar na tha dad pa bzhin zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyor ro //
analyzed: @210a * // 'di la tha dad pa yod pa de ltar na tha dad pa bzhin zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyor ro //
translated: Here, if there is difference, then it is connected with the words ‚Äúas different.‚Äù

original: rnam pa gcig la dmigs pa can gang yin pa de gcig nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig la dmigs pa can gang yin pa de gcig nyid du 'dod na /
translated: If that which observes one aspect is asserted to be one,

original: gang la du ma nyid du dmigs pa de la du ma nyid du grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la du ma nyid du dmigs pa de la du ma nyid du grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is perceived as manifold, it is established as manifold.

original: du ma nyid ni gcig sngon du song pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ma nyid ni gcig sngon du song pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because manifoldness is based on oneness.

original: 'di sgrub min /
analyzed: 'di sgrub min /
translated: This is not an inference.

original: rnam pa gcig la dmigs pa can ni gcig nyid la /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig la dmigs pa can ni gcig nyid la /
translated: If it is perceived as one aspect, it is one.

original: tha dad sgrub byed grub pa min //
analyzed: tha dad sgrub byed grub pa min //
translated: The proof of difference is not established.

original: grangs can gyis zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
analyzed: grangs can gyis zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that it is not established.

original: de nyid la tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu med pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu med pa ni /
translated: The absence of a reason for positing difference and non-difference in that very [object]

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan nyid la brul pa ston par byed pas rab tu sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan nyid la brul pa ston par byed pas rab tu sgrub par byed do //
translated: is shown by the analysis of the definition in the statement beginning with if [in the root text], thus establishing [the thesis].

original: gal te dkar po bde la sogs //
analyzed: gal te dkar po bde la sogs //
translated: If white, pleasure, etc.

original: tha dad snang can rnam pa tha dad par ro //
analyzed: tha dad snang can rnam pa tha dad par ro //
translated: appear as different, they have different aspects.

original: de yang tha dad med pa dang bde ba dang sngon po'i rnam pa tha dad par dmigs pa dag du ma nyid ma yin par 'dod do //
