analyzed: de yang tha dad med pa dang bde ba dang sngon po'i rnam pa tha dad par dmigs pa dag du ma nyid ma yin par 'dod do //
translated: And that is not accepted as manifold, since it is perceived as non-different, as pleasure, and as the aspect of blue.

original: blo myong tha dad med snang can tha dad //
analyzed: blo myong tha dad med snang can tha dad //
translated: The cognition has a different appearance, but is not different.

original: myong ba rnam pa gcig nyid yin par so sor rang gis rig pa nyams su myong par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: myong ba rnam pa gcig nyid yin par so sor rang gis rig pa nyams su myong par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: and the experience is of a single aspect.

original: de la ji ltar nyams su myong ba dang blo tha dad pa yin no zhes du ma nyid du smra /
analyzed: de la ji ltar nyams su myong ba dang blo tha dad pa yin no zhes du ma nyid du smra /
translated: How can you say that experience and cognition are different, and that there are many of them?

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: tha dad tha dad med rten cing //
analyzed: tha dad tha dad med rten cing //
translated: Different and not different,

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The cause for positing difference and non-difference does not exist.

original: mtshan nyid 'chol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'chol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the characteristics are confused.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: khyed cag gi yang cig car sems las byung ba mang po 'byung zhing /
analyzed: khyed cag gi yang cig car sems las byung ba mang po 'byung zhing /
translated: for you, many mental activities arise simultaneously.

original: de ltar na yang bde ba'am sdug bsngal gyi rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa gcig nye bar mtshon par 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na yang bde ba'am sdug bsngal gyi rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa gcig nye bar mtshon par 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: And even so, one conception of pleasure or pain is illustrated.

original: sems las byung ba du ma nyid mi 'dod ba yin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba du ma nyid mi 'dod ba yin no //
translated: But you do not accept that there are many mental activities.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no zhe na /
translated: The same is so here.

original: de la skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But that fault does not exist for us.

original: 'di ltar cig car sems las byung ba du ma skyes kyang gsal ba gcig 'ga' zhig gis nyi mas skar ma bzhin du zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar cig car sems las byung ba du ma skyes kyang gsal ba gcig 'ga' zhig gis nyi mas skar ma bzhin du zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, although many mental events arise simultaneously, a single clear [awareness] is perceived by some, just as the sun outshines the stars.

original: gal te yang thams cad nye bar mtshon pa ma yin pa de ltar na yang /
analyzed: gal te yang thams cad nye bar mtshon pa ma yin pa de ltar na yang /
translated: Even if not all [mental events] are perceived,

original: bde ba la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis bsgribs pa na yang /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis bsgribs pa na yang /
translated: when some, such as pleasure, obscure others,

original: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du yang gsal ba gzhan dang gzhan skyes pa na /
analyzed: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du yang gsal ba gzhan dang gzhan skyes pa na /
translated: then, as conditions allow, other clear [mental events] arise.

original: ston ka'i mar ngo'i mtshan phyed kyi skar ma bzhin du du ma nyid du snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ston ka'i mar ngo'i mtshan phyed kyi skar ma bzhin du du ma nyid du snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They appear as multiple, like the stars at the end of autumn night.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: gcig tshe gsal bas bsgribs pa @210b yang //
analyzed: gcig tshe gsal bas bsgribs pa @210b yang //
translated: even when obscured by a clear [mental event],

original: zil gyis mnan pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: zil gyis mnan pa'i dus na'o //
translated: it is outshone when the conditions are right.

original: gang gis bsgribs pa yang yin zhe na /üîΩtha dad ma mthong ba med pas so //
analyzed: gang gis bsgribs pa yang yin zhe na / tha dad ma mthong ba med pas so //
translated: By what is it obscured?üîΩBy the non-perception of difference.

original: tha dad pas tha dad pa'i mthong ba med pas yin gyi /
analyzed: tha dad pas tha dad pa'i mthong ba med pas yin gyi /
translated: It is due to the non-perception of difference by difference,

original: du ma nyid med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: du ma nyid med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: not due to the absence of multiplicity.

original: de ltar na yang bde ba la sogs pa'i /
analyzed: de ltar na yang bde ba la sogs pa'i /
translated: Even so, pleasure and so forth

original: sems 'byung tha dad rgyun dag las//üîΩsems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i rgyun la /
analyzed: sems 'byung tha dad rgyun dag las// sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i rgyun la /
translated: From the continuum of different mental processesüîΩThe continuum of different mental processes and mental factors

original: tha dad rnam gzhag grub pa yin //
analyzed: tha dad rnam gzhag grub pa yin //
translated: Is established as the basis for the classification of mind and mental factors.

original: de ltar rgyun la yang blo dang myong ba'i tha dad pa nye bar mtshon pa yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de ltar rgyun la yang blo dang myong ba'i tha dad pa nye bar mtshon pa yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Thus, if there is no representation of a difference between the continuum and the mind and experience,

original: gang gis na myong ba 'di dang blo 'di las mtshan nyid dang bral ba yin zhes bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na myong ba 'di dang blo 'di las mtshan nyid dang bral ba yin zhes bya bar 'gyur /
translated: how could it be said that this experience and this mind are devoid of characteristics?

original: rnal 'byor ba'i mngon sum yang lung gi rnam par rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa don tsam mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i mngon sum yang lung gi rnam par rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa don tsam mthong ba yin no //
translated: The direct perception of the yogi is also the mere seeing of the object, unmixed with the conceptualization of scripture.

original: de ni sngar bshad ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de ni sngar bshad ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains this with ‚ÄúThat has been explained before,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la 'dir rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa thams cad mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dir rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa thams cad mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: Here, all the consciousnesses of the yogi are not direct perception.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /üîΩsngar bshad rnal 'byor shes pa ni //
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na / sngar bshad rnal 'byor shes pa ni //
translated: Well then, what are they?üîΩThe consciousness of the yogi explained before

original: sngar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul can du bshad pa na /
analyzed: sngar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul can du bshad pa na /
translated: When it was explained that the consciousness of the yogi is the object of the four noble truths,

original: bden pa dpyod pa gang yin pa de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bden pa dpyod pa gang yin pa de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthat‚Äù is that which analyzes the truth.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i de yang gang las yin zhe na /üîΩde dag de ni sgom byung yin //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i de yang gang las yin zhe na / de dag de ni sgom byung yin //
translated: From what does that of the yogi arise?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat arises from meditation.‚Äù

original: bden pa sgom pa rdzogs pa las shes pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa sgom pa rdzogs pa las shes pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of knowledge that arises from completing the meditation on the truth.

original: shin tu goms pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: shin tu goms pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of that very great familiarity,

original: rtog pa'i dra ba rnam bsal bas //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra ba rnam bsal bas //
translated: ‚ÄúThe net of conceptuality is removed.‚Äù

original: rtog pa dang bral ba de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of that very freedom from conceptuality,

original: gsal ba shin tu snang ba yin //
analyzed: gsal ba shin tu snang ba yin //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is very clear and bright.‚Äù

original: gang dang gang shin tu bsgoms pa de dang de las gsal ba snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de nyid gang las yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang dang gang shin tu bsgoms pa de dang de las gsal ba snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de nyid gang las yin zhe na /
translated: Whatever is very familiar, that appears clearly. From what does that arise?

original: de phyir 'dod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de phyir 'dod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúTherefore, desire, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa dang mya ngan dang 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mya ngan dang 'jigs pa'o //
translated: Desire, sorrow, and fear.

original: des byas pa'i smyo ba ni /
analyzed: des byas pa'i smyo ba ni /
translated: The madness produced by them is

original: 'dod dang mya ngan 'jigs smyo'o //
analyzed: 'dod dang mya ngan 'jigs smyo'o //
translated: Desire, sorrow, fear, and madness.

original: de dag dang rkun po rmi sogs ni /
analyzed: de dag dang rkun po rmi sogs ni /
translated: Those, thieves, dreams, etc.

original: 'dod dang mya ngan 'jigs smyo dang // rkun po rmi sogs so //
analyzed: 'dod dang mya ngan 'jigs smyo dang // rkun po rmi sogs so //
translated: thieves, dreams, etc.

original: de dag gis gang bslad pa ni skyes bu 'khrul par byas ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gis gang bslad pa ni skyes bu 'khrul par byas ba'o //
translated: The person who is affected by these is one who is deluded.

original: yang dag min pa yang mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: yang dag min pa yang mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: One sees what is not real.

original: goms pa'i khyad par las yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: goms pa'i khyad par las yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of habit, one sees what is not real.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mdun na gnas pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa bzhin du'o //
translated: As if it were present before one.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni /üîΩmyur du bskor ba dang / 'chi ltas la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni / myur du bskor ba dang / 'chi ltas la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù

original: de @211a * //üîΩltar na de ltar mthong bas don mngon du gyur pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de @211a * // ltar na de ltar mthong bas don mngon du gyur pa bzhin du /
translated: refers to the swift turning of the wheel of life, the signs of death, etc.

original: de dang rjes su mthun bar bsgrubs pa la dmigs bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun bar bsgrubs pa la dmigs bar 'gyur na /
translated: Thus, one sees in this way, and one focuses on the practice that is in accordance with that, as if one were seeing the object directly.

original: gang gis na de dag 'dir lkog tu gyur pa'i ming can du yang 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de nges par gzung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na de dag 'dir lkog tu gyur pa'i ming can du yang 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de nges par gzung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: How can one be certain that the object is not something that is hidden and merely named?

original: sgom pa'i khyad bar las gsal bar snang ba ni blo ste /
analyzed: sgom pa'i khyad bar las gsal bar snang ba ni blo ste /
translated: The mind is the clear appearance that arises from the power of meditation.

original: ji ltar na rnam par mi rtog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par mi rtog pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it non-conceptual?

original: rnam par rtog dang rjes 'brel ni //
analyzed: rnam par rtog dang rjes 'brel ni //
translated: It is not associated with conceptualization,

original: don gsal snang ba can ma yin //
analyzed: don gsal snang ba can ma yin //
translated: and it does not have the appearance of a clear object.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: brda'i rten can ni rnam par rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: brda'i rten can ni rnam par rtog pa yin la /
translated: That which is based on a sign is conceptualization.

original: de yang gsal bar snang ba can ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang gsal bar snang ba can ma yin no //
translated: And that does not have the appearance of a clear object.

original: de ltar na yid kyi rnam par shes ba rtog pa med pa la 'di'i ming 'di yin no zhes bya ba de ltar 'dzin pa sngon du song ba can gyi sgra'i tha snyad yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yid kyi rnam par shes ba rtog pa med pa la 'di'i ming 'di yin no zhes bya ba de ltar 'dzin pa sngon du song ba can gyi sgra'i tha snyad yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the mental consciousness is non-conceptual. The expression ‚Äúthis is the name of that‚Äù does not exist in the form of a prior apprehension.

original: brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de la yang gsal bar snang ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de la yang gsal bar snang ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And the consciousness that has the nature of apprehending the connection between the object of expression and the means of expression does not have the appearance of a clear object.

original: de'i phyir gsal bar snang ba can la brda mi byed pa'i phyir sgra dang 'dres pa'i rtog pa ma yin pa de ltar na gsal bar snang ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de rtog pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsal bar snang ba can la brda mi byed pa'i phyir sgra dang 'dres pa'i rtog pa ma yin pa de ltar na gsal bar snang ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de rtog pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, because a sign is not made in regard to that which appears clearly, the cognition is not mixed with sound. Thus, that cognition which appears clearly is non-conceptual.

original: 'khrul pa'i dbang gis rnam par rtog pa gsal bar snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i dbang gis rnam par rtog pa gsal bar snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that conceptual cognition appears clearly due to delusion?

original: de ltar na rmi lam na yang shes pa rnam par rtog pa yin na yang gsal bar snang ba nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na rmi lam na yang shes pa rnam par rtog pa yin na yang gsal bar snang ba nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: In that case, even in a dream, cognition is conceptual and it appears clearly.

original: skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That fault does not exist.

original: rmi lam na yang rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni gsal bar snang ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni gsal bar snang ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because even in a dream, that which is conceptual does not appear clearly.

original: de la yang gsal bar snang ba ni gzhan rtog pa med pa nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: de la yang gsal bar snang ba ni gzhan rtog pa med pa nyid yin zhing /
translated: There, that which appears clearly is different, being non-conceptual.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su 'brel pa mi gsal ba gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su 'brel pa mi gsal ba gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: That which is associated with conceptualization is different, being unclear.

original: de gang las she na /
analyzed: de gang las she na /
translated: From what is that known?üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / rmi lam na yang dran pa dran //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rmi lam na yang dran pa dran //
translated: Even in a dream, memory is remembered.

original: de ni de 'dra'i don ldan min //
analyzed: de ni de 'dra'i don ldan min //
translated: It is not so meaningful.

original: rmi lam na yang dran pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de mi gsal ba nyid dran pa yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang dran pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de mi gsal ba nyid dran pa yin no //
translated: The memory consciousness that occurs in a dream is not clear memory.

original: rmi lam na yang dmigs pa gsal bar snang ba'i shes ba yul dang mtshungs par snang ba can des sang pas dran pa yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang dmigs pa gsal bar snang ba'i shes ba yul dang mtshungs par snang ba can des sang pas dran pa yin no //
translated: The consciousness that occurs in a dream is clear in that it perceives objects, and it is memory because it is clear.

original: des na de la yang rtog pa dang rtog pa med pa dag tha dad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na de la yang rtog pa dang rtog pa med pa dag tha dad pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, in that case, there is a difference between conceptual and nonconceptual consciousnesses.

original: gal te sgom pa la yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don goms pa las skyes pa gang yin pa de thams cad gsal bar snang ba @211b ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te sgom pa la yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don goms pa las skyes pa gang yin pa de thams cad gsal bar snang ba @211b ma yin zhing /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIn meditation, whatever is born from the cultivation of unreal objects is not clear appearance,

original: rtog pa med pa yang ma yin par grub pa'i mtha' smra ba 'dod pa ma yin nam des na khas blangs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa yang ma yin par grub pa'i mtha' smra ba 'dod pa ma yin nam des na khas blangs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and it is not conceptual. Is this not the belief of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika proponents of tenets? Therefore, you accept this,‚Äù

original: de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: we reply, ‚ÄúThat is not so.

original: 'di ltar / mi gtsang zad par sa la sogs //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mi gtsang zad par sa la sogs //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄòThe earth and so on are not the complete nonexistents.

original: yang dag min yang sgom pa yi //
analyzed: yang dag min yang sgom pa yi //
translated: The meditation on the complete nonexistents is the meditation on the impure.‚Äô

original: stobs kyis sbrul pa bsgoms pa'i stobs las skyes pa rtog med dang / gsal bar snang ba can du gsungs pa de ltar na /
analyzed: stobs kyis sbrul pa bsgoms pa'i stobs las skyes pa rtog med dang / gsal bar snang ba can du gsungs pa de ltar na /
translated: The power of meditation is the power of meditation on the snake, which is born from the power of meditation, and is non-conceptual and has the appearance of clarity.

original: khas blangs pa nyams pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khas blangs pa nyams pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction with what is accepted.üîΩBecause that is so, therefore,

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de phyir yang dag / gang dang gang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de phyir yang dag / gang dang gang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the real is that which is impermanent, etc.

original: yang dag min ni zad par sa la sogs pa'i ste /
analyzed: yang dag min ni zad par sa la sogs pa'i ste /
translated: The unreal is the totality of earth, etc.

original: rang gi rnam par rtog pa tsam gyis kun nas bslang ba yin no //üîΩshin tu bsgoms par gyur pa //
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pa tsam gyis kun nas bslang ba yin no // shin tu bsgoms par gyur pa //
translated: It is completely aroused by one's own conceptualization.üîΩWhen it is well cultivated,

original: shin tu goms par byas par gyur cing /
analyzed: shin tu goms par byas par gyur cing /
translated: when it is well practiced,

original: sgom pa yongs su rdzogs ba na //
analyzed: sgom pa yongs su rdzogs ba na //
translated: when meditation is complete,

original: de gsal mi rtog blo 'bras can //
analyzed: de gsal mi rtog blo 'bras can //
translated: it has the result of a clear, non-conceptual mind.

original: gsal ba yang yid la mi rtog pa yang yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gsal ba yang yid la mi rtog pa yang yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is called that because it is both clear and non-conceptual.

original: de 'dra ba'i blo ni gsal la mi rtog ba yin te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i blo ni gsal la mi rtog ba yin te /
translated: Such a mind is clear and non-conceptual.

original: gang la 'bras bu de yod pa //
analyzed: gang la 'bras bu de yod pa //
translated: That which has that result

original: zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: is the connection of the words. This is the conclusion.

original: gang gi phyir yang dag pa ma yin yang bsgoms pa'i stobs las gsal bar snang zhing mi rtog par 'gyur ba de bas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dag pa ma yin yang bsgoms pa'i stobs las gsal bar snang zhing mi rtog par 'gyur ba de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de la bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'i shes pa de dag la /
analyzed: de la bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'i shes pa de dag la /
translated: among those consciousnesses that are the results of meditation,

original: mi slu ba ni gang yin te /
analyzed: mi slu ba ni gang yin te /
translated: which are non-deceptive?

original: sgom 'byung mngon sum tshad mang 'dod //
analyzed: sgom 'byung mngon sum tshad mang 'dod //
translated: The result of meditation is asserted to be a valid perception.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: sngar dpyad dngos po bzhin /
analyzed: sngar dpyad dngos po bzhin /
translated: Like the previously analyzed entities.

original: sngar bden pa dpyad pa'i skabs su tshad ma'i dngos po yang dag par bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar bden pa dpyad pa'i skabs su tshad ma'i dngos po yang dag par bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the previously taught entities of valid cognition in the context of analyzing the truths.

original: lhag ma nye bar bslad pa yin //
analyzed: lhag ma nye bar bslad pa yin //
translated: The remainder are contaminated.

original: dper na zad par sa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na zad par sa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like the totalities of earth and so on.

original: rang rig la yang rtog mi 'dod //
analyzed: rang rig la yang rtog mi 'dod //
translated: Self-awareness is also not asserted to be conceptual.

original: don la rnam par rtog phyir ro //
analyzed: don la rnam par rtog phyir ro //
translated: Because it is conceptual with respect to its object.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is explained by the lines beginning

original: shes gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: shes gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe consciousness that apprehends the object‚Äôs name‚Äù and so on.

original: shes pa gang yul gang la sgra don 'dzin /
analyzed: shes pa gang yul gang la sgra don 'dzin /
translated: The consciousness that apprehends the object‚Äôs name

original: brda 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa /
analyzed: brda 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa /
translated: Is the consciousness that apprehends the symbol.

original: de ni de la sgra'i sgo nas 'dzin pa'i phyir rtog pa yin /
analyzed: de ni de la sgra'i sgo nas 'dzin pa'i phyir rtog pa yin /
translated: It is conceptual because it apprehends its object through the medium of sound.

original: rtog pa dang bcas par brjod do //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas par brjod do //
translated: It is said to be associated with conceptualization.

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi //
translated: The nature of all consciousnesses

original: rang gi ngo bo'ang sgra don min //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'ang sgra don min //
translated: is not the meaning of a word.

original: brdar bya ba mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir rgyu de phyir de la sgra dang don gyi rang bzhin rtogs bar bya ba la shes pa kun rtog pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brdar bya ba mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir rgyu de phyir de la sgra dang don gyi rang bzhin rtogs bar bya ba la shes pa kun rtog pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For that reason, the cognition of the nature of consciousness is not conceptual, because it is not possible to make an agreement about that.

original: mngon sum nyid yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is direct perception.

original: mngon sum ltar @212a * //
analyzed: mngon sum ltar @212a * //
translated: It is like direct perception.

original: snang zhes bya ba la sogs pas mngon sum ltar snang ba 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: snang zhes bya ba la sogs pas mngon sum ltar snang ba 'chad par byed do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike direct perception‚Äù explains what is like direct perception.

original: mngon sum ltar snang rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang rnam pa bzhi //
translated: There are four kinds of what is like direct perception.

original: dper na rtog pa'i shes pa rnam gsum yin //üîΩrten bslad pa las byung ba can //
analyzed: dper na rtog pa'i shes pa rnam gsum yin // rten bslad pa las byung ba can //
translated: For example, there are three kinds of conceptual consciousnesses.

original: rtog pa med pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa gcig yin no //
translated: One is like direct perception.üîΩOne is like direct perception because it arises from a contaminated basis.üîΩOne is like direct perception because it arises from a non-contaminated basis.

original: rab rib la sogs pas gnod pa'i dbang po la sogs pa las gcig yin no //
analyzed: rab rib la sogs pas gnod pa'i dbang po la sogs pa las gcig yin no //
translated: One is like direct perception because it arises from a sense faculty that is impaired by cataracts, and so on.

original: rtog pa'i shes pa rnam pa gsum yang brda'i rten can dang sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas 'jug ste /
analyzed: rtog pa'i shes pa rnam pa gsum yang brda'i rten can dang sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas 'jug ste /
translated: The three kinds of conceptual cognitions operate on the basis of signs and through the superimposition of conceptual elaborations.

original: dper na bum pa dang / grangs dang / 'degs pa dang / yod pa dang / bum pa nyid la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang / grangs dang / 'degs pa dang / yod pa dang / bum pa nyid la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a pot, a number, a support, an existence, a potness, and so on.

original: re zhig bum pa las gzugs la sogs pa chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa 'bras bu gcig sgrub par byed pa'i sgo nas de las gzhan pa'i de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa nyid tha dad pa med pa yin no
analyzed: re zhig bum pa las gzugs la sogs pa chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa 'bras bu gcig sgrub par byed pa'i sgo nas de las gzhan pa'i de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa nyid tha dad pa med pa yin no
translated: First, form and so on are different from a pot in that they do not have the same effect, such as holding water and so on.

original: // de la 'jig rten sgra 'god pa gang yin pa de ni cig car gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa rang gi 'bras bu la sbyor ba'i don to //
analyzed: // de la 'jig rten sgra 'god pa gang yin pa de ni cig car gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa rang gi 'bras bu la sbyor ba'i don to //
translated: The term pot is applied to a collection of form and so on simultaneously in the sense of connecting it to its effect.

original: brda de la brten nas /
analyzed: brda de la brten nas /
translated: Based on that sign,

original: phyis don dam pa gzhan la tha dad pa dag la yang bum pa la sogs pa gcig tu sgro btags nas /
analyzed: phyis don dam pa gzhan la tha dad pa dag la yang bum pa la sogs pa gcig tu sgro btags nas /
translated: later, even though different from that effect, it is still superimposed as one pot on other things.

original: bum pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: the conceptual thought called ‚Äúpot‚Äù occurs.

original: de bzhin du mad po rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can la brten nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du mad po rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can la brten nas /
translated: In the same way, in dependence on the effect of the exclusion of non-pot,

original: gcig tu mngon par zhen pa can dang / de bzhin du lag pa la sogs pa steng du 'phen par byed pa'i chos can dag la /
analyzed: gcig tu mngon par zhen pa can dang / de bzhin du lag pa la sogs pa steng du 'phen par byed pa'i chos can dag la /
translated: the conceptual thought called ‚Äúone‚Äù occurs in regard to a collection of many things, and in regard to the hand and so on, which have the property of raising,üîΩthe conceptual thought called ‚Äúlifting‚Äù occurs in dependence on the exclusion of that which is not such.

original: de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa la brdar byas pa la brtan nas 'degs par sgro 'dogs pa can dang / dngos po med pas bzlog pa don gyi bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa la brdar byas pa la brtan nas 'degs par sgro 'dogs pa can dang / dngos po med pas bzlog pa don gyi bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the nature of the activity of the object is the opposite of non-entity,

original: brdar byas pa la brten nas dngos po don gyur pa bzhin du yod ba nyid ston par byed par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brdar byas pa la brten nas dngos po don gyur pa bzhin du yod ba nyid ston par byed par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: in dependence on the convention, he engages in showing that the entity exists as the object of the activity, as if it were the cause.

original: tshogs pa'i mang po 'bras bu gcig byed pa can dag las de las gzhan pa'i tshogs pa rnam par gcod pa ston bar byed pa'i rten brda la brten nas /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i mang po 'bras bu gcig byed pa can dag las de las gzhan pa'i tshogs pa rnam par gcod pa ston bar byed pa'i rten brda la brten nas /
translated: In regard to a collection of many things that have a single effect, in dependence on the convention that shows the exclusion of a collection that is other than that,

original: bum pa nyid la sogs pa gzhan gcig bum pa'i rdzas thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs par sgro 'dogs par byed pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa nyid la sogs pa gzhan gcig bum pa'i rdzas thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs par sgro 'dogs par byed pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: and that the pot itself and so on is one thing, and that the substance of the pot is another, and that the pot is included in the substance of the pot.

original: de nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob tu yod pa dag la don gzhan la sgro btags nas de'i ngo bo rnam par rtog pa 'jug ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gsungs @212b so ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob tu yod pa dag la don gzhan la sgro btags nas de'i ngo bo rnam par rtog pa 'jug ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gsungs @212b so ;
translated: Therefore, it is said that in the case of things that exist superficially, the conceptualization of their nature is due to the superimposition of one thing on another.

original: / de ltar rab tu phye bas brda'i rten can rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gcig po'i sgra'i rtog pa nyid yin no //üîΩsmig rgyu la sogs pa'i rtog pa gang yin pa de ni chu ma yin pa rnam par bcad nas /
analyzed: / de ltar rab tu phye bas brda'i rten can rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gcig po'i sgra'i rtog pa nyid yin no // smig rgyu la sogs pa'i rtog pa gang yin pa de ni chu ma yin pa rnam par bcad nas /
translated: Thus, the conceptualizing cognition that has as its basis a conventional symbol is a conceptualizing cognition that has as its basis a word.

original: chu la brdar byas pa la brten nas 'jug pa ma yin na /
analyzed: chu la brdar byas pa la brten nas 'jug pa ma yin na /
translated: The conceptualization of a mirage and so on does not occur by the exclusion of nonwater and the superimposition of water, on the basis of a conventional symbol.üîΩHow then could it be included among conceptualizations that have as their basis a conventional symbol?

original: gang gis na brdal brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid kyi nang du 'jug pa'i phyir 'di tha dad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na brdal brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid kyi nang du 'jug pa'i phyir 'di tha dad par mi 'gyur /
translated: If it were, it would not be different from them.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chu'i brda la brten nas 'byung ba 'dus pa de la don gzhan nyid la sgro 'dogs bar byed pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chu'i brda la brten nas 'byung ba 'dus pa de la don gzhan nyid la sgro 'dogs bar byed pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The second kind of false imagination is the one that superimposes another object on the basis of the sign of water that is not real.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chu la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chu la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: For this reason, it is said that because the conceptualization of water, etc. is engaged.

original: de ni don gzhan la sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni don gzhan la sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis pa yin no //
translated: This is the second kind of consciousness that superimposes another object.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag pa las byung ba la sogs pa dag la lkog tu gyur pa'i don sngar mthong ba la rtogs par byed pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag pa las byung ba la sogs pa dag la lkog tu gyur pa'i don sngar mthong ba la rtogs par byed pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of inference, the effect of inference, etc., the cognition that realizes the hidden object arises from the previous perception of the object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa dang de'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i shes pa snga ma nyams su myong ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa dang de'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i shes pa snga ma nyams su myong ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: For this reason, it is said that the conceptualization that experiences the previous cognition of inference, its effect, etc.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don la rtog pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba 'di ni lkog tu 'gyur ba'i don la rtog pa gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don la rtog pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba 'di ni lkog tu 'gyur ba'i don la rtog pa gsum pa yin no //
translated: This is called the cognition that conceives a hidden object, and it is the third kind of conception that conceives a hidden object.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: rtog pa'i shes pa rnam gsum yin //üîΩdbang po la gnod pa byas pa las skyes pa'i shes pa rtog pa med pa ni mngon sum ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rtog pa'i shes pa rnam gsum yin // dbang po la gnod pa byas pa las skyes pa'i shes pa rtog pa med pa ni mngon sum ma yin gyi /
translated: conceptual cognition is threefold.

original: mngon sum ltar snang ba yin no //üîΩde la / dbang skyes min pa bsgrub don du //
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang ba yin no // de la / dbang skyes min pa bsgrub don du //
translated: A non-conceptual cognition that arises from a damaged sense faculty is not a direct perception, but it is a semblance of a direct perception.üîΩIn order to establish that it is not produced by a sense faculty,

original: gnyis bshad rtog pa'i shes pa rnam pa gnyis po gang yin pa de dag ni dbang po las skyes pa ma yin no zhes bshad par bya ba'i don du bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis bshad rtog pa'i shes pa rnam pa gnyis po gang yin pa de dag ni dbang po las skyes pa ma yin no zhes bshad par bya ba'i don du bshad do //
translated: the two types of conceptual cognition are explained as being of two types.

original: 'di la yang the tshom ci yod na gang gis na /üîΩdbang skyes min pa bsgrub don du //
analyzed: 'di la yang the tshom ci yod na gang gis na / dbang skyes min pa bsgrub don du //
translated: What is the doubt here, that it is said,

original: zhes bya ba smos she na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos she na /
translated: in order to establish that it is not produced by a sense faculty?

original: 'khrul pa bstan phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa bstan phyir ro //
translated: Because error is taught.

original: phyi rol pa 'di la 'khrul pa snang ste /
analyzed: phyi rol pa 'di la 'khrul pa snang ste /
translated: Error appears to the non-Buddhists.

original: smig rgyu la sogs pa dang kun rdzob tu yod pa dag la shes pa dbang po las skyes pa nyid yin par 'dod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu la sogs pa dang kun rdzob tu yod pa dag la shes pa dbang po las skyes pa nyid yin par 'dod pa lta bu'o //
translated: They assert that a cognition that has a mirage, etc., as its object and that exists conventionally is produced by a sense faculty.

original: de ltar na de nyid rnam par gcad pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par 'khrul pa med pa can zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar na de nyid rnam par gcad pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par 'khrul pa med pa can zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, in order to exclude that, the qualification ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù is added to the definition of perception.

original: dbang po la gnod pa byas pa'i shes pa bzlog pa'i don du zhes bya ba yang brdzun yin te /üîΩdon dang phrad nas 'dzin pa nyid kyis don @213a * //
analyzed: dbang po la gnod pa byas pa'i shes pa bzlog pa'i don du zhes bya ba yang brdzun yin te / don dang phrad nas 'dzin pa nyid kyis don @213a * //
translated: The statement ‚Äúin order to exclude the cognition that is impaired by an impairment of the sense faculty‚Äù is also false.

original: ma yin pa las 'byung ba zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin pa las 'byung ba zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the apprehension of an object by direct perception is itself the exclusion of the cognition of a nonobject, such as the cognition of two moons.

original: de lta ma yin na dbang po las skyes pa zhes bya ba nyid brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dbang po las skyes pa zhes bya ba nyid brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be necessary to say ‚Äúarisen from the sense faculty.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa yang de yin la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa yang de yin la /
translated: Inference and so on are also valid cognitions.

original: grub pa yin pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: grub pa yin pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩrjes dpag rjes su dpag las byung //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / rjes dpag rjes su dpag las byung //
translated: For example:üîΩInference is arisen from inference.

original: dran byung brjod las byung ba yi //
analyzed: dran byung brjod las byung ba yi //
translated: Arisen from memory, arisen from testimony.

original: shes pa sngon nyams su myong ba brda dran pa'i stobs kyis 'grub par 'gyur ba nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: shes pa sngon nyams su myong ba brda dran pa'i stobs kyis 'grub par 'gyur ba nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is established by the power of the memory of the sign of the prior experience of consciousness.

original: de de ltar na rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa rtog pa'i rang bzhin nyid du grub na yang /
analyzed: de de ltar na rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa rtog pa'i rang bzhin nyid du grub na yang /
translated: Thus, although inference and so on are established as having the nature of conception,

original: 'dir rtog pa'i shes pa'i skabs su brjod pa gang yin pa de snga ma gnyis nyid de rtog pa'i shes pa mngon sum nyid ma yin par bsgrub phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir rtog pa'i shes pa'i skabs su brjod pa gang yin pa de snga ma gnyis nyid de rtog pa'i shes pa mngon sum nyid ma yin par bsgrub phyir ro //
translated: here, whatever is stated in the context of conceptual consciousness is the former two, because they are established as not being direct perception.

original: nyid ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyid ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is applied in a different order.

original: 'di ltar sngon nyams su myong ba brda dran pa ya brten nas 'byung ba'i dang tshul can gang yin pa de ni mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon nyams su myong ba brda dran pa ya brten nas 'byung ba'i dang tshul can gang yin pa de ni mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: Thus, that which has the mode of arising in dependence on the memory of the sign of prior experience is not direct perception,

original: dper na rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like inference and so on.

original: brda rten can zhes bya ba la sogs pa de nyid 'chad bar byed do //
analyzed: brda rten can zhes bya ba la sogs pa de nyid 'chad bar byed do //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthat which is based on a sign‚Äù and so on explains that.

original: ci'i phyir rtog pa snga ma gnyis dag la mngon sum nyid du the tshom za ba yin zhing /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtog pa snga ma gnyis dag la mngon sum nyid du the tshom za ba yin zhing /
translated: Why is there doubt that the former two conceptions are direct perception?

original: gang gis na de gsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gang gis na de gsal ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is the cause of the manifestation of that.üîΩ

original: rjes dpag la sogs grub ce na //
analyzed: rjes dpag la sogs grub ce na //
translated: How can inference, etc. be established, since they are not manifest?üîΩThey are not manifest, but they do exist.

original: the tshom yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: the tshom yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: If they did not exist, then there would be no doubt.üîΩThus, those conceptual thoughts that are based on signs and those conceptual thoughts that superimpose other objects are conceptual thoughts that are based on signs and that superimpose other objects.üîΩThey are not direct perception.üîΩThey are not direct perception because they are not engaged in the object in a manner that is similar to the way that direct perception is engaged in its object.

original: de ltar na brda rten can gyi rtog pa gang yin pa dang / don gzhan la sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam rtog dag gang yin pa de dang de dag ni brda rten can dang don gzhan la /üîΩsgro 'dogs pa'i rnam rtog dag go //
analyzed: de ltar na brda rten can gyi rtog pa gang yin pa dang / don gzhan la sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam rtog dag gang yin pa de dang de dag ni brda rten can dang don gzhan la / sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam rtog dag go //
translated: They are not direct perception because they are not engaged in the object in a manner that is similar to the way that direct perception is engaged in its object.

original: mngon sum dang nye bar 'jug pa can du 'gyur ba de dag ni /
analyzed: mngon sum dang nye bar 'jug pa can du 'gyur ba de dag ni /
translated: They are not direct perception because they are not engaged in the object in a manner that is similar to the way that direct perception is engaged in its object.üîΩThey are not direct perception because they are not engaged in the object in a manner that is similar to the way that direct perception is engaged in its object.üîΩThey are not direct perception because they are not engaged in the object in a manner that is similar to the way that direct perception is engaged in its object.üîΩThey are not direct perception because they are not engaged in the object in a manner that is similar to the way that direct perception is engaged in its object.

original: 'ga' tshe shes pa phra mo skye ba'i dus kyis rnam par dbye ba ma rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir nye bar mtshon pa med pa de dag mngon sum nyid yin no zhes 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ro //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'ga' tshe shes pa phra mo skye ba'i dus kyis rnam par dbye ba ma rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir nye bar mtshon pa med pa de dag mngon sum nyid yin no zhes 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ro // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: They are not direct perception because they are not engaged in the object in a manner that is similar to the way that direct perception is engaged in its object.üîΩThey are not direct perception because they are not engaged in the object in a manner that is similar to the way that direct perception is engaged in its object.üîΩThey are not direct perception because they are not engaged in the object in a manner that is similar to the way that direct perception is engaged in its object.üîΩThey are not direct perception because they are not engaged in the object in a manner that is similar to the way that direct perception is engaged in its object.üîΩThey are not direct perception because they are not engaged in the object in a manner that is similar to the way that direct perception is engaged in its object.üîΩThey are not direct perception because they are not engaged in the object in a manner that is similar to the way that direct perception is engaged in its object.üîΩThey are not direct perception because they are not engaged in the object in a manner that is similar to the way that direct perception is engaged in its object.

original: mngon sum nyer 'jug can nyid phyir //üîΩmngon sum gyi shes pa las de dag nye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum nyer 'jug can nyid phyir //üîΩmngon sum gyi shes pa las de dag nye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: They are not direct perception because they are not engaged in the object

original: de bas na 'khrul pa srid pas na gdon mi tha bar mngon sum las tha dad pa nyid du shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'khrul pa srid pas na gdon mi tha bar mngon sum las tha dad pa nyid du shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because error is possible, it must be understood that it is definitely different from perception.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag mngon sum nyid ma yin par rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag mngon sum nyid ma yin par rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that very reason, in order to establish that it is not perception,üîΩThe next verse

original: rtog pa phyi ma ni /
analyzed: rtog pa phyi ma ni /
translated: is stated.

original: ji ltar lkog tu gyur don can //
analyzed: ji ltar lkog tu gyur don can //
translated: How can it apprehend an object that is hidden?

original: yul can dran pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo rtog pa 'di rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i rang @213b bzhin yin te /
analyzed: yul can dran pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo rtog pa 'di rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i rang @213b bzhin yin te /
translated: This conceptual cognition, which has the nature of memory, etc., is of the nature of inference, etc.,

original: brda la ltos pa'i ngang tshul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda la ltos pa'i ngang tshul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the mode of being dependent on a sign.

original: de'i phyir don la 'dzin mi byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir don la 'dzin mi byed /
translated: Therefore, it does not apprehend an object.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig la 'dzin par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig la 'dzin par mi byed ce na /
translated: What kind of object does it not apprehend?

original: mngon sum ste de bas na mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ste de bas na mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: It does not apprehend a manifest object, and therefore it is not a valid cognition of perception.

original: de ltar nyams myong dran med par //
analyzed: de ltar nyams myong dran med par //
translated: Thus, without the memory of experience,

original: sngon nyams su myong ba'i brda dran pa med par bum pa la sogs dag la yang /
analyzed: sngon nyams su myong ba'i brda dran pa med par bum pa la sogs dag la yang /
translated: without the memory of the sign of a previously experienced object, it does not apprehend a pot, etc.

original: shes pa med pa sngon nyams su myong ba'i dran pa med par bum pa dang grangs dang 'degs pa dang / yod pa nyid dang / bum pa nyid dang / mig la sogs pa la skyes bu'i bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa med pa sngon nyams su myong ba'i dran pa med par bum pa dang grangs dang 'degs pa dang / yod pa nyid dang / bum pa nyid dang / mig la sogs pa la skyes bu'i bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The memory of a prior experience of a non-existent consciousness does not exist, and the consciousness of a pot, number, lifting, existence, potness, and the eye, etc., of a person does not exist in a pot, etc.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rtog pa rnam pa gnyis po yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rtog pa rnam pa gnyis po yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the two kinds of conceptualization explained above do not exist.

original: rtogs pa po 'dis kyang brda dran pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan yin par shes na des shes shing /
analyzed: rtogs pa po 'dis kyang brda dran pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan yin par shes na des shes shing /
translated: And this cognizer, when he knows that the memory of a sign is the reason for the consciousness of a pot, etc.,

original: rtogs na brda dran pa /
analyzed: rtogs na brda dran pa /
translated: he knows and understands the memory of a sign.

original: de yang ni bum pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de yang ni bum pa la sogs pa la /
translated: And that is in a pot, etc.

original: mngon sum las ni yongs nyams 'gyur //üîΩmngon sum gyi shes pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba can du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum las ni yongs nyams 'gyur // mngon sum gyi shes pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba can du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: He would completely lose his direct perception.üîΩIt is not reasonable that he would possess a direct perception,

original: shes pa'i rnam pa de lta bu ni mngon sum nyid ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa de lta bu ni mngon sum nyid ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because such a form of consciousness is not direct perception.

original: sbyor ba yang gang zhig nyams su myong ba'i dran pa'i stobs las byung ba de ni mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang zhig nyams su myong ba'i dran pa'i stobs las byung ba de ni mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: The application is that which arises from the power of memory of an experience, and is not direct perception.

original: dper na dran pa las byung ba dang / rjes su dpag pa las byung ba dang / brjod pa las byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dran pa las byung ba dang / rjes su dpag pa las byung ba dang / brjod pa las byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like that which arises from memory, that which arises from inference, and that which arises from verbal testimony.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i shes pa dang / chu la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i shes pa yang sngon nyams su myong ba'i dran pa'i stobs las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i shes pa dang / chu la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i shes pa yang sngon nyams su myong ba'i dran pa'i stobs las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa'o //
translated: The conceptual cognition of a pot, etc., and the conceptual cognition of water, etc., arise from the power of memory of a previous experience. This is the observation of a pervasion by contradiction.

original: de de ltar na rtog pa'i shes pa rnam pa gsum po de dag ni /
analyzed: de de ltar na rtog pa'i shes pa rnam pa gsum po de dag ni /
translated: Thus, those three kinds of conceptual cognition

original: mtshan nyid kyi tshig gis don gsal bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi tshig gis don gsal bar rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as clearly elucidated by the words of the definition.

original: 'dir bzhi pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir bzhi pa ni /
translated: Here, the fourth is

original: mngon sum ltar snang ba rnam pa bzhi po 'di la mngon sum ltar snang ba bzhi pa /
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang ba rnam pa bzhi po 'di la mngon sum ltar snang ba bzhi pa /
translated: among these four kinds of apparent direct perception, the fourth kind of apparent direct perception

original: mngon sum ltar snang rab rib bcas //
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang rab rib bcas //
translated: is the apparent direct perception with an eye disease.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa gang yin pa de dmigs kyis dgar ba yin par rig par bya ba'am mtshan nyid lhag ma yin par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa gang yin pa de dmigs kyis dgar ba yin par rig par bya ba'am mtshan nyid lhag ma yin par rig par bya'i /
translated: This is a specific case, or it is a remainder of the definition.

original: mtshan nyid kyi tshig las don gyi gsal ba'i dpe ni ma yin no //üîΩde ltar na ji ltar chu la sogs pa'i rtog pa las 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi tshig las don gyi gsal ba'i dpe ni ma yin no // de ltar na ji ltar chu la sogs pa'i rtog pa las 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
translated: But it is not an example that clarifies the meaning of the definition.üîΩThus, just as the reason why the conceptual consciousnesses of water, etc.üîΩare conceptual is explained in the passage, ‚Äúbecause they engage their objects through the medium of a concept,‚Äù etc.,

original: smig rgyu'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa nyid yin pa'i rgyu bstan pa de ltar 'di @214a * //
analyzed: smig rgyu'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa nyid yin pa'i rgyu bstan pa de ltar 'di @214a * //
translated: so the reason why the conceptual consciousnesses of a double moon, etc.

original: yang bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: are conceptual is also explained.

original: 'di ltar rtog pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas 'di'i rtog ba nyid kyi rgyu ma bshad par /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtog pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas 'di'i rtog ba nyid kyi rgyu ma bshad par /
translated: Thus, after completing the discussion of conceptual consciousnesses, without explaining the reason why these are conceptual,

original: rab rib bcas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rab rib bcas zhes gsungs so //
translated: the root text says, ‚Äúwith cataracts.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni rtog pa dang bral ba'i mngon sum ltar snang ba bstan pa yin no zhes shes bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni rtog pa dang bral ba'i mngon sum ltar snang ba bstan pa yin no zhes shes bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that this passage teaches a false direct perception that is free from conceptuality.

original: de lta ma yin na ;
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ;
translated: If that were not so,

original: / mtshan nyid 'khrul pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / mtshan nyid 'khrul pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: the definition would be erroneous.

original: de bas na dmigs kyis dgar ba'i tshig / des bshad nye gnod pa las skyes //
analyzed: de bas na dmigs kyis dgar ba'i tshig / des bshad nye gnod pa las skyes //
translated: indicate that which arises from impairment.

original: phyi dang nang gis gnod ba byed pa'i rkyen gyi dbang po la gnod pa byed pa las skyes pa'i shes pa thams cad rtog pa dang bral ba nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gis gnod ba byed pa'i rkyen gyi dbang po la gnod pa byed pa las skyes pa'i shes pa thams cad rtog pa dang bral ba nyid yin na yang /
translated: All cognitions that arise from impairment of the sense faculties due to conditions that impair the internal and external elements are free from conceptualization.

original: mngon sum ltar snang ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang ba zhes brjod do //
translated: However, they are called ‚Äúseeming direct perception.‚Äù

original: de la rab rib 'ba' zhig ni //
analyzed: de la rab rib 'ba' zhig ni //
translated: Among them, the mere cataract

original: nyer gnod mtshon par byed pa yin //
analyzed: nyer gnod mtshon par byed pa yin //
translated: is what illustrates the impairment.

original: de la rab rib dang bcas pa'i tshig gi rab rib ni dbang po la gnod pa byed pa'i rkyen thams cad kyis nye bar mtshon pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la rab rib dang bcas pa'i tshig gi rab rib ni dbang po la gnod pa byed pa'i rkyen thams cad kyis nye bar mtshon pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Among them, the cataract of the words should be regarded as illustrated by all conditions that impair the sense faculties.

original: de yang yid kyis shes kha cig / zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa yang dbang po las skyes pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang yid kyis shes kha cig / zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa yang dbang po las skyes pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Some say that the cognition of two moons and so on is not born from the sense faculties.

original: 'on kyang yid kho na yin zhes kha cig smra'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang yid kho na yin zhes kha cig smra'o //
translated: Rather, it is only mental.

original: de skad du smra ba sngo dang zla gnyis la sogs blo yin /
analyzed: de skad du smra ba sngo dang zla gnyis la sogs blo yin /
translated: Some say that the cognition of two moons and so on is mental.

original: dbang po rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i //
analyzed: dbang po rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe sense faculty is the cause,‚Äù

original: gzhung 'di dang ni de dag 'gal /
analyzed: gzhung 'di dang ni de dag 'gal /
translated: contradicts that.

original: slob dpon gyis rtsod pa sgrub par bshad par mngon sum du dpyad ba la dmigs pa'i don dpyad pa na /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis rtsod pa sgrub par bshad par mngon sum du dpyad ba la dmigs pa'i don dpyad pa na /
translated: The Acarya has explained that the debate is settled by direct perception, and when the object of the perception is analyzed,

original: 'di ltar ji ltar snang ba gang las shes pa skye ba de ltar dmigs pa zhes brjod dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar snang ba gang las shes pa skye ba de ltar dmigs pa zhes brjod dam /
translated: it is said that the object of perception is that from which consciousness arises, in whatever way it appears.

original: 'on te ji ltar yod ba dag gzhan du snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur zhes bya ba skabs su mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar yod ba dag gzhan du snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur zhes bya ba skabs su mdzad nas /
translated: Or is it that the object of perception is that which exists in a certain way, but appears in another way, and is the cause of the consciousness?üîΩHaving set forth the debate in this way, he explains that it follows that the eye and so on are also the object of perception, because they are the cause of the consciousness that perceives them, and they exist in a certain way, but appear in another way, just like the appearance of two moons and the appearance of blue and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa'i bar yang dmigs pa nyid du thal ba de dag kyang don dam par rnam pa gzhan du yod pa dag ni zla ba gnyis par snang ba dang / sngon po la sogs pa'i snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa'i gzhung yin pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i bar yang dmigs pa nyid du thal ba de dag kyang don dam par rnam pa gzhan du yod pa dag ni zla ba gnyis par snang ba dang / sngon po la sogs pa'i snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa'i gzhung yin pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: This is in contradiction to the passage that explains that the eye and so on are not the object of perception.

original: de ltar na gal te de dbang po la brten ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gal te de dbang po la brten ba ma yin no //
translated: If the object of perception is not dependent on the sense faculty,

original: ji ltar na de skad du bshad par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na de skad du bshad par 'gyur /
translated: how can it be explained in that way?

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: gal te brgyud pas rgyu yin na //
analyzed: gal te brgyud pas rgyu yin na //
translated: if the sense faculty is the cause of the mental faculty indirectly,

original: 'dir dbang po dngos su rgyur ma bshad na /
analyzed: 'dir dbang po dngos su rgyur ma bshad na /
translated: then the sense faculty is not directly the cause of the mental faculty.

original: gang gis na dbang po la brten ba brjod pas 'gal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na dbang po la brten ba brjod pas 'gal bar 'gyur /
translated: What is the contradiction in saying that the mental faculty is supported by the sense faculty?

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the contradiction?

original: dbang po yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin par brgyud nas bshad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin par brgyud nas bshad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The sense faculty is the cause of the mental faculty indirectly.

original: dbang po'i spyod yul shes ba dag / dpyod @214b par byed pa na /
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul shes ba dag / dpyod @214b par byed pa na /
translated: When the object of the sense faculty is analyzed,

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul dpyod bar byad na'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul dpyod bar byad na'o //
translated: when the object of the sense faculty is investigated.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i spyod yul dpyad pa'i skabs las yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i skabs kyis ci zhig bya ste ci yang ma yin na /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i spyod yul dpyad pa'i skabs las yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i skabs kyis ci zhig bya ste ci yang ma yin na /
translated: What is the point of investigating the object of the sense faculty when the object of the mental faculty is being investigated?

original: gang gis na slob dpon gyis yid skabs su mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gis na slob dpon gyis yid skabs su mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: The master Vasubandhu, having made the mental faculty the topic, said that.

original: dbang bo'i shes pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni ma yin pa de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dbang bo'i shes pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni ma yin pa de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: He did not say that the sense faculty is not the cause of the mental faculty.

original: dbang rten ci yin /
analyzed: dbang rten ci yin /
translated: What is the basis of the sense faculty?

original: dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod pa ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod pa ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of a consciousness produced from a sense faculty?üîΩSince it lacks that characteristic, the convention of being based on a sense faculty does not apply to the consciousness of a double moon, etc.

original: mtshan nyid gang med pas zla ba gnyis ba la sogs pa'i shes pa la dbang po la brten pa'i tha snyad byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di la pha rol 'dod pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid yodüîΩpar dgongs nas 'dri bar mdzad pa'o //üîΩgal te gang dbang po yod med rjes 'brel can /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang med pas zla ba gnyis ba la sogs pa'i shes pa la dbang po la brten pa'i tha snyad byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di la pha rol 'dod pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid yod par dgongs nas 'dri bar mdzad pa'o // gal te gang dbang po yod med rjes 'brel can /
translated: This is the question, thinking that the consciousness of a double moon, etc. has the characteristic of a consciousness asserted by the opponent.

original: gal te dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i rnam par shes ba gang yin ba de dbang po la brten par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i rnam par shes ba gang yin ba de dbang po la brten par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you assert that a consciousness is based on a sense faculty if it is concomitant with the presence or absence of a sense faculty,

original: de mtshungs zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yang /
analyzed: de mtshungs zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yang /
translated: then the consciousness of a double moon, etc.

original: dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed par mtshungs pas na /
analyzed: dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed par mtshungs pas na /
translated: is similar to that in being concomitant with the presence or absence of a sense faculty.

original: de ci'i phyir dbang po la brten pa ma yin /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir dbang po la brten pa ma yin /
translated: Why is it not based on a sense faculty?

original: bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference.

original: gal te 'gyur bzhin na ci ste yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa 'di bor nas /
analyzed: gal te 'gyur bzhin na ci ste yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa 'di bor nas /
translated: If it is changing, then why does it follow after existence and nonexistence?

original: dbang po 'gyur ba na 'gyur ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa de dbang po la brten par 'dod pa de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: dbang po 'gyur ba na 'gyur ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa de dbang po la brten par 'dod pa de'i tshe yang /
translated: When the sense faculty changes, if you assert that that which possesses change is dependent on the sense faculty,

original: mig la sogs pa 'gyur ba na //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'gyur ba na //
translated: then when the eye and so on change,

original: dbang po'i shes pa 'gyur ba gzhan ci zhig 'gyur ba can du 'dod na /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa 'gyur ba gzhan ci zhig 'gyur ba can du 'dod na /
translated: what other changing consciousness of the sense faculty do you assert to be changing?

original: gang gis na zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa mi 'gyur /
translated: By what means is the consciousness of a double moon and so on not changing?

original: de 'dir 'gyur ba yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de 'dir 'gyur ba yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If it is changing,

original: gang las dbang po rten nyid du rtog pa ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: gang las dbang po rten nyid du rtog pa ci'i phyir na /
translated: then why imagine that it is the basis of the sense faculty?

original: 'gog / zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i blo dbang po la brten pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'gog / zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i blo dbang po la brten pa nyid do //
translated: The cognition of a double moon and so on is dependent on the sense faculty.

original: 'dir yang sbrul sogs 'khrul pa bzhin //
analyzed: 'dir yang sbrul sogs 'khrul pa bzhin //
translated: Here too it is like the confusion of a snake and so on.

original: dbang po'i 'gyur ba yod na yang //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'gyur ba yod na yang //
translated: Even if there is a change in the sense faculty,üîΩif the confusion of a double moon and so on is a mental confusion,

original: ldog 'gyur gal te zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa gang yin pa yid kyi 'khrul par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: ldog 'gyur gal te zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa gang yin pa yid kyi 'khrul par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: then the sense faculty is not the basis of the cognition of a double moon and so on.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' mi gsal ba na /üîΩsbrul gnas pa'i yul can du thag pa 'khyil pa'i dbyibs kyi spyi la brten nas khyad par mi rtog pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' mi gsal ba na / sbrul gnas pa'i yul can du thag pa 'khyil pa'i dbyibs kyi spyi la brten nas khyad par mi rtog pa de'i tshe /
translated: Just as when space is not clear,

original: sbrul gyi khyad @215a * //
analyzed: sbrul gyi khyad @215a * //
translated: one does not conceive the difference of the shape of a coiled rope in dependence on the generality of the shape of a coiled rope, the object in the domain of a snake.üîΩAt that time, the mind that superimposes the difference of a snake on the rope, the error of a snake, and the error of water, etc., in dependence on the conditions of a mirage, etc.,üîΩwill be nonexistent through analysis, etc.

original: par du sgro btags pa'i yid sbrul du 'khrul pa dang / smig rgyu la sogs pa'i rkyen ji ltar ba bzhin du chu la sogs par 'khrul pa rnam bar dpyad pa la sogs pas med par 'gyur ba de ltar dbang po'i 'gyur ba la ltos pa med pa can zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i 'khrul ba 'di yang
analyzed: par du sgro btags pa'i yid sbrul du 'khrul pa dang / smig rgyu la sogs pa'i rkyen ji ltar ba bzhin du chu la sogs par 'khrul pa rnam bar dpyad pa la sogs pas med par 'gyur ba de ltar dbang po'i 'gyur ba la ltos pa med pa can zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i 'khrul ba 'di yang
translated: In that way, this error of a second moon, etc., which does not depend on a change in the sense organ,

original: ldog par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ldog par 'gyur la /
translated: will be eliminated.

original: 'on kyang dbang po'i bslad pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang dbang po'i bslad pa ni /
translated: However, the corruption of the sense organ

original: ldog na yang ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ldog na yang ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: will not be eliminated even if eliminated.

original: zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa yang yid kyi 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin yin na yang /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa yang yid kyi 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin yin na yang /
translated: Although the error of a second moon, etc., is also of the nature of mental error,

original: mig sman la sogs pas mig gi 'gyur ba ldog pa na bdag la sogs par lta ba 'khrul ba bzhin du ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig sman la sogs pas mig gi 'gyur ba ldog pa na bdag la sogs par lta ba 'khrul ba bzhin du ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When the eye‚Äôs transformation is reversed by means of eye medicine, etc., the error of seeing a self, etc., is not reversed.

original: de ni gang gi phyir 'di ltar mig gi 'gyur ba gnas pa ni mi ldog cing /
analyzed: de ni gang gi phyir 'di ltar mig gi 'gyur ba gnas pa ni mi ldog cing /
translated: Because the eye‚Äôs transformation is not reversed when it is present,

original: mig gi 'gyur ba ldog pa na ldog pa de'i phyir dbang po las skyes pa yin no zhes khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi 'gyur ba ldog pa na ldog pa de'i phyir dbang po las skyes pa yin no zhes khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it is reversed when the eye‚Äôs transformation is reversed. Therefore, it is understood that it arises from the sense faculty.

original: gal te 'di yid kyi 'khrul par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te 'di yid kyi 'khrul par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If this is a mental error,

original: 'di ltar thag pa la sogs pa la 'khrul pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar thag pa la sogs pa la 'khrul pa /
translated: then just as the error of a rope, etc.,üîΩis in the mind of a person who is near the rope, etc.,

original: rang bzhin gzhan gyi rgyud la ni yul dang dus nye ba can gyi skyes bu'i sems la yang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan gyi rgyud la ni yul dang dus nye ba can gyi skyes bu'i sems la yang /
translated: and in the mind of another person who is not near,üîΩit is established that the error of a double moon, etc., is in the mind of one person, and the error of a snake, etc., is in the mind of another person.

original: brjod pa dag gis 'gal tshe 'jog / ji ltar sbrul sbrul zhes bya ba'i sgras 'khrul pa'i rgyu tshogs pa na /
analyzed: brjod pa dag gis 'gal tshe 'jog / ji ltar sbrul sbrul zhes bya ba'i sgras 'khrul pa'i rgyu tshogs pa na /
translated: When the collection of causes of error is present, the word ‚Äúsnake,‚Äù etc.,

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe sbrul du 'khrul pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe sbrul du 'khrul pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: sometimes the error of a snake arises.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang rab rib la sogs pas bslad pa'i mig can gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang rab rib la sogs pas bslad pa'i mig can gyi /
translated: In the same way, here also, the error of a double moon, etc., arises in the mind of one person, and the error of a hair, etc., arises in the mind of another person who has an eye affected by disease, etc.

original: ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i sgra yul dang dus nye ba can /
analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i sgra yul dang dus nye ba can /
translated: It is the sound of the object and time of the experience.üîΩ

original: dbang po bslad pa can de'i zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa skyed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dbang po bslad pa can de'i zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa skyed par 'gyur na /
translated: If the object of sound that is experienced and the time are close to the sense faculty that is impaired, then the error of a second moon and so on would arise.

original: de ltar yang ma yin pa de bas na yid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin pa de bas na yid ma yin no //
translated: But since that is not the case, it is not mental.

original: gzhan yang / mthong ba dran la ltos 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: gzhan yang / mthong ba dran la ltos 'gyur zhing //
translated: Moreover, seeing would rely on memory.

original: gla te 'di yid kyi 'khrul par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gla te 'di yid kyi 'khrul par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: When this is a mental error,

original: ji ltar smig rgyu la sogs pa dag la chu'i rnam par 'khrul pa sngar mthong ba'i chu'i dran pa dang chu dang chos mthun pa la ltos par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar smig rgyu la sogs pa dag la chu'i rnam par 'khrul pa sngar mthong ba'i chu'i dran pa dang chu dang chos mthun pa la ltos par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: just as the error of water and so on in relation to a mirage relies on the memory of previously seeing water and on the similarity of water,

original: zla ba gnyis pa la sogs par 'khrul pa 'di yang 'gyur na ;
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa la sogs par 'khrul pa 'di yang 'gyur na ;
translated: in the same way this error of a second moon and so on would also be like that.

original: /'di ltar mig bslad pa can ni sngon mthong ba'i dran pa la ltos pa med par mig rnam par phye ma thag tu zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa mthong bar 'gyur pa de ltar na /
analyzed: /'di ltar mig bslad pa can ni sngon mthong ba'i dran pa la ltos pa med par mig rnam par phye ma thag tu zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa mthong bar 'gyur pa de ltar na /
translated: But when the sense faculty is impaired, the second moon and so on are seen as soon as the eye is opened without relying on the memory of what was previously seen.

original: 'di dbang po las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dbang po las skyes pa yin no //
translated: It arises from the sense faculty.

original: gzhan yang / yongs su gsal bar snang ba min //
analyzed: gzhan yang / yongs su gsal bar snang ba min //
translated: Moreover, it is not a clear appearance.

original: yid kyi 'khrul pa'i ngo @215b bo nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: yid kyi 'khrul pa'i ngo @215b bo nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it is the nature of mental error,

original: de rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes ba yin bar 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes ba yin bar 'dod par bya'o //
translated: then it should be asserted to be the conceptual mental consciousness.

original: de lta ma yin na 'dir bzhi ba ni dmigs kyis dgar zhes bya ba 'di la log par rtogs pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'dir bzhi ba ni dmigs kyis dgar zhes bya ba 'di la log par rtogs pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it would be illogical to specify in this context that the fourth is excluded.

original: de ltar na zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa mthong ba bzhin du gsal bar snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa mthong ba bzhin du gsal bar snang ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, like the cognition of two moons and so on, it is not a clear appearance.

original: de ltar ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni /
translated: As such,

original: rnam par rtog par rjes 'brel ni //
analyzed: rnam par rtog par rjes 'brel ni //
translated: it is not associated with conceptualization

original: don gsal snang ba can ma yin //
analyzed: don gsal snang ba can ma yin //
translated: and does not have a clear appearance of the object.

original: zhes bya bas gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas gong du bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained above.

original: ci ste de ltar snang ba'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yang rtog pa med bar 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste de ltar snang ba'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yang rtog pa med bar 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if you assert that mental consciousness that appears in that way is nonconceptual,

original: de bzlog pa'i don du /
analyzed: de bzlog pa'i don du /
translated: then in order to refute that,

original: 'dir bzhi ba ni dmigs kyis dgar ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gsal bar byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir bzhi ba ni dmigs kyis dgar ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gsal bar byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Here, the fourth is the clarifying term ‚Äúspecifically.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gnyid log pa'am sad pa na yang skyes bu'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyid log pa'am sad pa na yang skyes bu'i /
translated: Therefore, whether one is asleep or awake,

original: gsal bar snang ba can blo gang //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba can blo gang //
translated: the cognition that appearsüîΩclearly to a person

original: de ni rtog med /
analyzed: de ni rtog med /
translated: is nonconceptual.

original: gang yang rnam pa gnyi ga yang //
analyzed: gang yang rnam pa gnyi ga yang //
translated: And also, both aspects

original: nyid log pa'am ma log pa yang ngo //
analyzed: nyid log pa'am ma log pa yang ngo //
translated: are either reversed or not reversed.

original: de lta min na mi gsal ba snang ba can nyid du 'gyur ba'i blo de thams cad ni rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta min na mi gsal ba snang ba can nyid du 'gyur ba'i blo de thams cad ni rtog pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, all cognitions that appear unclearly would be conceptual.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar shes pa rtog pa med pa yin na yang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar shes pa rtog pa med pa yin na yang /
translated: Because in that case, even though the cognition is nonconceptual,üîΩit is still distorted. Therefore, since the cognition of a double moon is possible,

original: bslad pa yin pa de bas na zla ba gnyis pa'i shes pa yod par srid pa de phyir zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa de rtog med na yang /
