analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo bdag nyid nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin du skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is produced as the essence of experience, the nature of self-experience. That is the meaning.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi dngos po la sogs pa nyams su myong bar bya ba yod pa ma yin na /üîΩji ltar sngon po'i nyams su myong ba la /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi dngos po la sogs pa nyams su myong bar bya ba yod pa ma yin na / ji ltar sngon po'i nyams su myong ba la /
translated: If the object of experience, such as external things, does not exist,üîΩthen how is it that the experience of blue is called ‚Äúblue‚Äù?

original: sngon po zhes brjod pa de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa nyams su myong bar bya ba yod pa yin no zhes bya ba yang brdzun yin no //
analyzed: sngon po zhes brjod pa de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa nyams su myong bar bya ba yod pa yin no zhes bya ba yang brdzun yin no //
translated: Therefore, the experience of blue, etc. does exist.

original: de ltar na shes pa de'i sngo sogs ngo bo'i rang bzhin de nyams myong ba la'ang /
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa de'i sngo sogs ngo bo'i rang bzhin de nyams myong ba la'ang /
translated: Thus, the nature of the consciousness that is the experience of blue, etc.

original: de ltar na rang gi myong gyur yang /
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi myong gyur yang /
translated: is also the experience of that.

original: sngo sogs myong bar gsal ba yin //
analyzed: sngo sogs myong bar gsal ba yin //
translated: The experience of blue, etc. is clear.

original: nang na gnas pa'i nus pa so sor nges pas sad pa las dngos po la reg pa med par sngon po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du skyes par gyur pa na yang de ltar grags pa yin no //
analyzed: nang na gnas pa'i nus pa so sor nges pas sad pa las dngos po la reg pa med par sngon po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du skyes par gyur pa na yang de ltar grags pa yin no //
translated: Even though it is produced from the awakening of the individual, specific potentials that exist internally, without contacting an external thing, it is still known as ‚Äúblue,‚Äù etc.

original: don sngon po nyams su myong pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don sngon po nyams su myong pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the experience of the external object, blue.

original: gal te ji ltar na shes pa'i bdag nyid nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba gang gis rang gi ngo bo nyams su myong bar gyur pa na yang de skad du brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar na shes pa'i bdag nyid nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba gang gis rang gi ngo bo nyams su myong bar gyur pa na yang de skad du brjod ce na /
translated: If it is asked how the nature of consciousness is experienced, by what it experiences its own nature, then why is it said?

original: bdag nyid kho nas bdag nyid las dang po pa dang byed pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas don dam par @221b gsal bar byed pa'i phyir bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin no //üîΩ'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: bdag nyid kho nas bdag nyid las dang po pa dang byed pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas don dam par @221b gsal bar byed pa'i phyir bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa ni ma yin no // 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: It is not that it is self-illuminating because it illuminates itself in the manner of an agent and action, etc., from the perspective of the ultimate.

original: ji ltar rab tu gsal mngon 'dod //üîΩji ltar gsal byed rang ngo bo //üîΩgsal ba yin pa'i bdag nyid phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu gsal mngon 'dod // ji ltar gsal byed rang ngo bo // gsal ba yin pa'i bdag nyid phyir //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWell then, what is it?‚ÄùüîΩIt is asserted that it is self-illuminating

original: gsal bar byed pa nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa nyid du 'dod //
translated: because it is the nature of clarity.

original: de ltar blo bdag rig can yin //
analyzed: de ltar blo bdag rig can yin //
translated: Thus the mind is self-aware.

original: sgron ma yang bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa la sgron ma gzhan la ltos pa med cing bdag la don dam par gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgron ma yang bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa la sgron ma gzhan la ltos pa med cing bdag la don dam par gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Also, a lamp does not depend on another lamp to illuminate itself, and it does not ultimately illuminate itself.

original: 'on kyang gsal bar byed pa'i bdag nyid du skyes par gyur pa na bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa zhes brjod de de bzhin du mngon sum gyi myong bar rang bzhin gyis gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir blo bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gsal bar byed pa'i bdag nyid du skyes par gyur pa na bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa zhes brjod de de bzhin du mngon sum gyi myong bar rang bzhin gyis gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir blo bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: But when it is produced in the nature of a manifestor, it is called a manifestor. In the same way, since the experience of direct perception is naturally manifest, the mind is a manifestor.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar blo des ni don gzhan rig na yang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar blo des ni don gzhan rig na yang /
translated: And so, even though the mind cognizes an object that is different from itself,

original: sngon po la sogs pa khas len na /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa khas len na /
translated: if one accepts that it cognizes blue, etc.,

original: tshor bya tshor ba po mi 'thad //
analyzed: tshor bya tshor ba po mi 'thad //
translated: then the object of experience and the experiencer are untenable.

original: rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: There are two ways to explain this.

original: de'i phyir blo 'dis ni tshor bya tshor byed can rnams med /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo 'dis ni tshor bya tshor byed can rnams med /
translated: Therefore, this mind does not have objects of experience and experiencers.

original: tshor bar bya ba dang tshor ba ngo ni tshor bar bya ba dang tshor ba dngos po'o //
analyzed: tshor bar bya ba dang tshor ba ngo ni tshor bar bya ba dang tshor ba dngos po'o //
translated: The object of experience and the experiencer are the entity of the object of experience and the experiencer.

original: de dag gi rnam pa'am /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa'am /
translated: Their aspect or

original: rnam pa de nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa de nyid do //
translated: that very aspect.üîΩThe mind that does not have that is called that.

original: blo gang la de med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: blo gang la de med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is said:

original: de ni / ji ltar 'khrul pas mthong 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de ni / ji ltar 'khrul pas mthong 'gyur ba //
translated: How is it that one sees through error?

original: zhes bya ba des ni rnam pa gzhan 'dzin pa'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba des ni rnam pa gzhan 'dzin pa'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: This shows the cause of apprehending a different aspect.

original: mthong ba ni 'dra ba ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: mthong ba ni 'dra ba ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is the similarity of the seeing?

original: rnam par phye ba'i bdag nyid can //üîΩgzung 'dzin rnam par bslad pa can //
analyzed: rnam par phye ba'i bdag nyid can // gzung 'dzin rnam par bslad pa can //
translated: It is like the nature of the different.üîΩIt is like the nature of the different.

original: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid can bzhin du gzung 'dzin rnam par bslad pa la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid can bzhin du gzung 'dzin rnam par bslad pa la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that the error of subject and object exists in the error of subject and object, as if it were the nature of the different.

original: de ltar rnam gzhag byas pa 'di //
analyzed: de ltar rnam gzhag byas pa 'di //
translated: This is the way it is set forth.

original: tshor bar bya ba dang tshor ba po'i rnam pa can yin pa'i blo yang ji ltar 'khrul pas tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can bzhin du snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor bar bya ba dang tshor ba po'i rnam pa can yin pa'i blo yang ji ltar 'khrul pas tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can bzhin du snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind, which has the aspect of the feeler and the feeling, appears as if it had the aspect of the different nature of subject and object, because of error.

original: de bzhin du 'di ltar 'di ni gzung ba yin pa 'di ni 'dzin pa yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa 'di byas pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ltar 'di ni gzung ba yin pa 'di ni 'dzin pa yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa 'di byas pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, this is the way it is set forth: ‚ÄúThis is the object, this is the subject,‚Äù but not ultimately.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: skra sogs shes pa tha dad bzhin //
analyzed: skra sogs shes pa tha dad bzhin //
translated: It is like the different consciousnesses of hair and so on.

original: ji ltar mig 'khrul can skra shad la sogs pa brdzun pa snang ba dag la skra la sogs pa 'di mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal bas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i 'jog pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mig 'khrul can skra shad la sogs pa brdzun pa snang ba dag la skra la sogs pa 'di mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal bas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i 'jog pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as the person with the eye disease, with regard to the false appearance of hairs, etc., has the conceit ‚ÄúI see hairs, etc.,‚Äù and posits the apprehended object and the apprehending subject, just so.

original: gal te khyod kyi gzhung gis kyang blo de'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi gzhung gis kyang blo de'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the characteristic of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject in that cognition?‚Äù

original: de la @222a * //
analyzed: de la @222a * //
translated: we reply:

original: 'dir nga la klan ka btsal bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir nga la klan ka btsal bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Here we are not to be faulted.

original: de ltar ni don dam par blo'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid gsal ba nyid yin te mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni don dam par blo'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid gsal ba nyid yin te mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, in the ultimate sense, the characteristic of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject in that cognition is not tenable.

original: 'on kyang mthong ba'i dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa yin no //üîΩgang tshe de tshe gzung 'dzin gyi //
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong ba'i dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa yin no // gang tshe de tshe gzung 'dzin gyi //
translated: Nevertheless, they are posited by the power of seeing.üîΩWhen that is so, one should not dispute

original: mtshan nyid can la brtsad mi bya //
analyzed: mtshan nyid can la brtsad mi bya //
translated: the characteristic of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: blo gang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rtag pa yod pa ma yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: blo gang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rtag pa yod pa ma yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is permanent in the sense of being an apprehended object or an apprehending subject does not exist‚Äù should be applied to each of the three types of cognition.

original: gang gi tshe 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don mi 'thad pa de'i tshe gzhan 'ga' zhig phyi rol la gnas pa don /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don mi 'thad pa de'i tshe gzhan 'ga' zhig phyi rol la gnas pa don /
translated: When external objects are untenable in this way, then nothing else remains as an external object.

original: don rig med phyir rang rig pa nyid lhag mar gyur pa de ltar na /
analyzed: don rig med phyir rang rig pa nyid lhag mar gyur pa de ltar na /
translated: Since there is no awareness of an object, reflexive awareness alone remains.

original: rang rig de nyid 'bras bu yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: rang rig de nyid 'bras bu yin par 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, we assert that reflexive awareness is the effect of cognition.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i ngo bo phyi rol gyi don blos myong 'gyur na nyes pa ci yod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i ngo bo phyi rol gyi don blos myong 'gyur na nyes pa ci yod par gyur na /
translated: If the nature of an external object that is different from consciousness were to be experienced by the mind, what would be the problem with that?

original: gang gis bdag nyid rig pa 'bras bur brjod ces gzhan dag 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: gang gis bdag nyid rig pa 'bras bur brjod ces gzhan dag 'dri bar byed do //
translated: Others ask, ‚ÄúWhy do you say that reflexive awareness is the effect of cognition?‚Äù

original: kho bo cag la gnod pa ni cung zad med mod kyi 'on kyang dngos po'i gnas skabs ni de ltar ma yin no snyam du bsams nas skyon ci yang med ston par byed do //
analyzed: kho bo cag la gnod pa ni cung zad med mod kyi 'on kyang dngos po'i gnas skabs ni de ltar ma yin no snyam du bsams nas skyon ci yang med ston par byed do //
translated: We respond, ‚ÄúWe are not harmed in the least by that question. However, we think that the state of affairs of things is not like that. Therefore, we have no fault at all.‚Äù

original: gal te yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If it were to exist,

original: skyon yin na yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skyon yin na yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: If it is a fault, it does not exist.

original: med pa nyid ston par bzhed nas /
analyzed: med pa nyid ston par bzhed nas /
translated: Desiring to show that it does not exist,üîΩhe says:

original: phyi rol don de myong 'gyur ba //
analyzed: phyi rol don de myong 'gyur ba //
translated: ‚ÄúThe external object is experienced.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'i tha snyad gsog nyid du gzigs pas gzhan la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha snyad gsog nyid du gzigs pas gzhan la /
translated: Seeing that this is a mere convention, he says to the other:

original: phyi rol don de myong 'gyur ba //
analyzed: phyi rol don de myong 'gyur ba //
translated: ‚ÄúThe external object is experienced.‚Äù

original: brjod pa 'di nyid kyis cir 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya bas 'dri bar mdzad do //üîΩgang gi tshe blo rnam pa med pa yin zhing /
analyzed: brjod pa 'di nyid kyis cir 'gyur // zhes bya bas 'dri bar mdzad do // gang gi tshe blo rnam pa med pa yin zhing /
translated: What is the point of this statement?

original: yul don gzhan du gyur pa de'i tshe 'brel pa'i khyad par ma grub pa'i phyir 'di ni blo 'dis nyams su myong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'di'i don 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: yul don gzhan du gyur pa de'i tshe 'brel pa'i khyad par ma grub pa'i phyir 'di ni blo 'dis nyams su myong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'di'i don 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: When the cognition is without aspect and the object is different from it, then, since the difference of the connection is not established, there is no meaning at all for this convention, ‚ÄúThis is experienced by this cognition.‚Äù

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is what he intends.

original: khyod kyis kyang blos rang gi bdag nyams su myong ba zhes bshad pa de la nyams su myong ba'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: khyod kyis kyang blos rang gi bdag nyams su myong ba zhes bshad pa de la nyams su myong ba'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: But you also say that cognition experiences itself. What is the meaning of ‚Äúexperience‚Äù in this case?

original: nyams su myong ba'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of ‚Äúexperience‚Äù in this case?

original: nyams su myong pa'i bdag nyid du skyes pa yin gyi zhes bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: nyams su myong pa'i bdag nyid du skyes pa yin gyi zhes bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is born in the nature of experience.‚Äù

original: don nyams su myong ba dang de de ltar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don nyams su myong ba dang de de ltar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not logical that the object is experienced in that way.

original: phyi rol du gyur pa myong ba ni mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol du gyur pa myong ba ni mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible for the object to be experienced externally.

original: nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa 'di yang blo la yod pa yin gyi don la yod pa ma yin no zhes grub po //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa 'di yang blo la yod pa yin gyi don la yod pa ma yin no zhes grub po //
translated: And it is established that this aspect of experience exists in the mind, not in the object.

original: ci ste blo'i rnam pa tha dad pa ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: ci ste blo'i rnam pa tha dad pa ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: But if the aspect of the mind is different, and it is not dependent on the object,

original: rang nyid nyams su myong ba ni de la ltos pa med @222b pa nyid yin na de la mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rang nyid nyams su myong ba ni de la ltos pa med @222b pa nyid yin na de la mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not dependent on the object, and that is not possible.

original: don yang rnam pa tha dad pa'i dbang gis nyams su myong ba grub ba yin no //
analyzed: don yang rnam pa tha dad pa'i dbang gis nyams su myong ba grub ba yin no //
translated: And the object is established as experienced by the power of the different aspects.

original: de'i phyir de'i rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i don gyis 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i don gyis 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the object that determines it is the cause.

original: gal te blo ni de rnam can //
analyzed: gal te blo ni de rnam can //
translated: If the mind has that aspect,

original: don gyi rnam pa don nyams su myong ba rnam par gzhag pa'i rten yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe rnam pa'i khyad par can /
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa don nyams su myong ba rnam par gzhag pa'i rten yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe rnam pa'i khyad par can /
translated: When it is asserted that the aspect of the object is the basis for the experience of the object, then it is the special feature of the aspect.üîΩ

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa de yod /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa de yod /
translated: If you assert that the aspect of the object is the experience of the object, then at that time the cognition that possesses the aspect of blue and so on exists.

original: re zhig blo de bsnyon par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig blo de bsnyon par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: For now, that cognition cannot be refuted.

original: 'on kyang ji ltar rnam pa'i khyad par can gyi blo de ni ci'i phyir 'am ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar rnam pa'i khyad par can gyi blo de ni ci'i phyir 'am ste /
translated: However, why is that cognition that possesses the aspect of blue and so on

original: don las de dang 'dra bar 'byung ba yin nam /
analyzed: don las de dang 'dra bar 'byung ba yin nam /
translated: arisen in that way from an object?

original: 'on te gzhan las shes /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan las shes /
translated: Or is it from another?

original: nang na gnas pa'i bag chags kyi khyad par sad pa las yin zhe na /
analyzed: nang na gnas pa'i bag chags kyi khyad par sad pa las yin zhe na /
translated: Or is it from the activation of the specific latent potentialities that exist within?

original: 'di ni dpyad par rigs pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ni dpyad par rigs pa yin //
translated: This is the proper analysis.

original: dpyod par bzhed pa'i dgongs pa ni //
analyzed: dpyod par bzhed pa'i dgongs pa ni //
translated: The intention of the one who wishes to analyzeüîΩis as follows.

original: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo 'dod pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo 'dod pa na /
translated: When you assert a cognition that possesses the aspect of blue and so on,

original: 'dis sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba na bdag nyid gyur pa nyams su myong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba na bdag nyid gyur pa nyams su myong ba yin no //
translated: when it experiences the aspect of blue and so on, it experiences the transformation of itself.

original: de ltar ma yin na rnam pa dang ldan pa des rnam pa dang ldan pa nyid ma yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na rnam pa dang ldan pa des rnam pa dang ldan pa nyid ma yin pas na /
translated: If it were not so, then it would not be endowed with the aspect by virtue of being endowed with the aspect.

original: snga ma bzhin du nyams su myong ba'i 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du nyams su myong ba'i 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, as before, the relation of experience is not established.

original: ji ltar myong bar bya ba'i rnam pa las bzlog pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par sgyur bar byed pa /
analyzed: ji ltar myong bar bya ba'i rnam pa las bzlog pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par sgyur bar byed pa /
translated: The aspect that is to be experienced is turned back from the aspect of blue, etc.

original: gzhan phyi rol du 'gyur ba dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan phyi rol du 'gyur ba dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The external object is not perceived as different.

original: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can gyis de ma mthong bar nang nyid dam phyi rol rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro snyam pa de bas na /
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can gyis de ma mthong bar nang nyid dam phyi rol rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro snyam pa de bas na /
translated: One who is inclined to think that it is not seen, either internally or externally, as a cause,

original: the tshom du 'gyur ba ni dpyod pa'i rten yin la rnam par dpyod pa las kyang phyi rol gyi don grub pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: the tshom du 'gyur ba ni dpyod pa'i rten yin la rnam par dpyod pa las kyang phyi rol gyi don grub pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di yin no //
translated: has doubt as the basis of investigation. And from investigation, the establishment of an external object does not exist.üîΩThis is what it is.

original: ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa de ni mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa de ni mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
translated: How is it that it does not exist? He shows this with ‚Äúseeing, etc.‚Äù

original: blo'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid du yin te /
analyzed: blo'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid du yin te /
translated: The aspect of blue and so on is the nature of the mind.üîΩ

original: don dam par don gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par don gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The aspect of the cognition, such as the aspect of blue, is not a different object, ultimately.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩmthong ba'i khyad par dang bral ba mi 'dzin /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / mthong ba'i khyad par dang bral ba mi 'dzin /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause it is not apprehended without a difference in appearance.

original: phyir sngon por dmigs par gzung bar ma gyur pa ni sngon po'i rnam pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir sngon por dmigs par gzung bar ma gyur pa ni sngon po'i rnam pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the cognition of blue does not occur, the aspect of blue is not apprehended.

original: de 'dzin na 'dzin phyir /
analyzed: de 'dzin na 'dzin phyir /
translated: If it is apprehended, it is apprehended as blue.

original: sngon por dmigs par gyur pa nyid ni sngon por yang dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon por dmigs par gyur pa nyid ni sngon por yang dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: If the cognition of blue occurs, the object of that cognition is also apprehended as blue.

original: de bzhin du sngon po yang dmigs par gyur pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon po yang dmigs par gyur pa na /
translated: In the same way, if blue is apprehended,

original: de dmigs pa yang dmigs par 'gyur ro //üîΩtha dad par med par dmigs @223a * //
analyzed: de dmigs pa yang dmigs par 'gyur ro // tha dad par med par dmigs @223a * //
translated: the cognition of blue is also apprehended.

original: pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because they are not apprehended as different.

original: don dam par du ma nyid yin na nges pa gcig dmigs pa las te las gzhan pa dmigs par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par du ma nyid yin na nges pa gcig dmigs pa las te las gzhan pa dmigs par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If they were different ultimately, it would not be reasonable for one to be apprehended and the other not to be apprehended.

original: de'i phyir tha dad par snang ba nyid yin na yang gcig tu dmigs pa'i phyir gcig nyid du yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad par snang ba nyid yin na yang gcig tu dmigs pa'i phyir gcig nyid du yin te /
translated: Therefore, although they appear to be different, they are observed as one, and so they are one.

original: zla ba gnyis pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the appearance of two moons.

original: sngon por snang ba mthong ba yin //
analyzed: sngon por snang ba mthong ba yin //
translated: The appearance of blue is seen.

original: phyi rol yan gar don yod min /
analyzed: phyi rol yan gar don yod min /
translated: External objects alone do not exist.

original: rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa la bzlog pa'i dmigs pas 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa la bzlog pa'i dmigs pas 'dzin pa ni /
translated: The apprehension of the object of consciousness is the apprehension of the object of negation.

original: gang la blo'i rang bzhin gyi khongs su 'dus pa med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: gang la blo'i rang bzhin gyi khongs su 'dus pa med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: That which is not included in the category of the nature of mind does not exist. This is the conclusion.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is how it is.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med par shes pa 'di skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med par shes pa 'di skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If this consciousness arises without depending on an external object,

original: de las gzhan pa'i snang ba la sogs pa'i rkyen thag nye ba na yod na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i snang ba la sogs pa'i rkyen thag nye ba na yod na /
translated: then when the conditions for the appearance of something else are nearby,

original: dkar por snang ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa stong pa'i yul du 'jug pa na 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: dkar por snang ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa stong pa'i yul du 'jug pa na 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: the consciousness that has the mode of appearance of white will not engage an empty object.

original: dkar por snang ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa 'bras bur 'gyur ba de tsam gyis mi 'gyur bas rgyu don yang yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dkar por snang ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa 'bras bur 'gyur ba de tsam gyis mi 'gyur bas rgyu don yang yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not so, because consciousness that has the mode of appearance of white does not arise from that. Therefore the object that is the cause does exist.

original: 'bras bu ldog pa las rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin gyi phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ldog pa las rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin gyi phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The effect is different from the cause, but it is not that it depends on an external object.

original: de ltar na 'dir 'ga' zhig gi tshe sngon po la sogs pa mthong ba'i 'ga' zhig rnam par shes pa ni nang gi bag chags rab tu sad par byed pa yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir 'ga' zhig gi tshe sngon po la sogs pa mthong ba'i 'ga' zhig rnam par shes pa ni nang gi bag chags rab tu sad par byed pa yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, at some times, the consciousness that sees blue and so on is activated by internal latent propensities, but not always.

original: des na shes pa gang gis skad cig ma re re la nus pa'i rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa nye bar 'phro ba ni shes pa rab tu sad par byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'i dbang gis
analyzed: des na shes pa gang gis skad cig ma re re la nus pa'i rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa nye bar 'phro ba ni shes pa rab tu sad par byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'i dbang gis
translated: Therefore, in any consciousness, at every moment, the transformation of consciousness into another with a different nature is the capacity that is activated by consciousness.

original: de dang da skyed par 'gyur ba thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang da skyed par 'gyur ba thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that everything is produced by that.

original: de ltar na rab tu sad par byed pa /üîΩde phyir blo ni rnam nges kyis //
analyzed: de ltar na rab tu sad par byed pa / de phyir blo ni rnam nges kyis //
translated: Thus, it is a complete awakening.

original: phyi rol don ltos ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol don ltos ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mind is not dependent on external objects.

original: 'bras bu ldog pa las kyang don grub pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu ldog pa las kyang don grub pa yin na ni /
translated: If the existence of external objects were established by the cessation of the effect,

original: don rtog tu rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: don rtog tu rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then the existence of external objects would be inferred.

original: 'ga' zhig tshe yang mngon sum ma yin pa de ltar na rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tshe yang mngon sum ma yin pa de ltar na rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case. Therefore, that is not a valid reason.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar phyi rol gyi don yan gar ba med pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar phyi rol gyi don yan gar ba med pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since there are no external objects existing separately,

original: shes pa gcig la ma rig pas bslad pa'i phyir tshul gnyis yod pa yul dang rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo dag tu bshad par 'gyur ba @223b yod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gcig la ma rig pas bslad pa'i phyir tshul gnyis yod pa yul dang rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo dag tu bshad par 'gyur ba @223b yod pa yin no //
translated: two aspects are explained in one consciousness, the aspect of the object and the aspect of consciousness, because of the contamination of ignorance.üîΩWhen one remembers the object as it was experienced,

original: gang zhig de ltar nyams myong dang // ji ltar snang ba bzhin du dran pa'i dus na yang mthong ba bzhin du snang ba nyid dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar nyams myong dang // ji ltar snang ba bzhin du dran pa'i dus na yang mthong ba bzhin du snang ba nyid dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: the memory of the appearance as it was seen arises.

original: de de ltar na gzhan myong ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de de ltar na gzhan myong ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no experience of anything else,

original: 'di'i rnam pa gnyis /
analyzed: 'di'i rnam pa gnyis /
translated: the two aspectsüîΩare not different.

original: rnam par shes pa'i myong nyid de //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i myong nyid de //
translated: The experience of consciousness is itself the result.

original: rang rig pa gang yin pa de nyid ni 'bras bu yin /üîΩdes ni gnyis su snang ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rang rig pa gang yin pa de nyid ni 'bras bu yin / des ni gnyis su snang ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: That which is self-experience is itself the result.

original: rang rig pa de ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i bar de rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa de ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i bar de rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Beginning from the statement that ‚Äúthe cognition of the appearance of duality arises,‚Äù up to the statement that ‚Äúself-experience is the result,‚Äù all of this has been explained.

original: de de ltar gzung ba'i rnam pa ni gzhal bya yin zhing /
analyzed: de de ltar gzung ba'i rnam pa ni gzhal bya yin zhing /
translated: In this way, the aspect of the object is the object of cognition,

original: bdag nyid nyams su myong ba 'bras bu yin la /üîΩ'dzin pa'i rnam ba ni grub par byed pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: bdag nyid nyams su myong ba 'bras bu yin la / 'dzin pa'i rnam ba ni grub par byed pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: and self-experience is the result.üîΩThe aspect of the subject is the cause of the result.

original: don med pa la 'bras bu'i rtog pa 'di ni gcig yin no //
analyzed: don med pa la 'bras bu'i rtog pa 'di ni gcig yin no //
translated: Thus, this conception of a result that is devoid of an object is one.

original: gang tshe grub pa de dngos /
analyzed: gang tshe grub pa de dngos /
translated: When the result is established,

original: grub pa ni 'dod pa dang ni /
analyzed: grub pa ni 'dod pa dang ni /
translated: the result is established as desired

original: mi 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: and as not desired, etc.

original: gang zhe na gzhan te phyi rol gyi don 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa rnam rig rgyu'i yul dag go //
analyzed: gang zhe na gzhan te phyi rol gyi don 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa rnam rig rgyu'i yul dag go //
translated: What is it? It is other, the object that is desired or not desired, the object that is the cause of the cognition.

original: rnam par rig pa /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa /
translated: The cognition

original: de yi de ltar myong ba yin //
analyzed: de yi de ltar myong ba yin //
translated: is the experience of that.

original: 'dod pa ni 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i sgo nas yul nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i sgo nas yul nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The result is the experience of the object in the aspect of the object of desire.

original: de ni don dang 'dra ba ni tshad ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ni don dang 'dra ba ni tshad ma yin zhing /
translated: The valid cognition is the likeness to the object.

original: don myong pa ni 'bras bu yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: don myong pa ni 'bras bu yin pa de ltar na /
translated: The result is the experience of the object.

original: phyi rol gyi don yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the second conception of the existence of external objects is explained.

original: rang gi yul bcas shes pa'i /
analyzed: rang gi yul bcas shes pa'i /
translated: The cognition is said to have an object

original: yul dang bcas par 'jug pa yin pas yul bcas te /
analyzed: yul dang bcas par 'jug pa yin pas yul bcas te /
translated: because it engages with an object.

original: yul snang ba don gyis stong pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yul snang ba don gyis stong pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It has an object because the appearance of the object is empty of an object.

original: ci'i phyir yang de ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang de ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: shes cha la ni don rnam gzhag / gzung ba'i rnam pa don du tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde tshe bdag nyid nyams myong gang //
analyzed: shes cha la ni don rnam gzhag / gzung ba'i rnam pa don du tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro // de tshe bdag nyid nyams myong gang //
translated: The object is posited as an aspect of cognition because the aspect of the object is conventionally designated as the object.

original: blo'i de nyid du rnam par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: blo'i de nyid du rnam par nges pa yin no //
translated: The experience of that is ascertained as the reality of cognition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: 'di ltar gal te blo 'di bdag 'dod pa'i rnam pa'am rnam pa gzhan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te blo 'di bdag 'dod pa'i rnam pa'am rnam pa gzhan te /
translated: Because if this cognition is the aspect of the object of desire or another aspect,

original: mi 'dod pa'i rnam par skyes bus myong 'gyur na /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i rnam par skyes bus myong 'gyur na /
translated: If it arises in an undesirable form, then at that time, whether it is desirable or undesirable, it is the experience of the object.

original: de'i tshe 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa des kyang don rig pa ni 'gyur ba yin zhes bya bas ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi 'bras bu'i rtog pa 'di bshad do //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa des kyang don rig pa ni 'gyur ba yin zhes bya bas ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi 'bras bu'i rtog pa 'di bshad do //
translated: Thus, this is the explanation of the consequence of mere representation.

original: phyi rol don dag yod na yang //
analyzed: phyi rol don dag yod na yang //
translated: Even if external objects exist,

original: ji ltar nyams su myong nyid de //
analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong nyid de //
translated: how is there experience?

original: ji ltar rang rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar rang rig pa nyid do //
translated: How is there self-awareness?

original: yul de nges bdag gcig yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yul de nges bdag gcig yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The object and the self would be identical.

original: rang gi ngo bor ma yin te /üîΩdon ji lta ba bzhin du don nyams su @224a * //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor ma yin te / don ji lta ba bzhin du don nyams su @224a * //
translated: But they are not identical in nature.üîΩIt is not the case that the object is experienced just as it is.

original: myong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: myong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: du ma'i bdag nyid skyon phyir te /
analyzed: du ma'i bdag nyid skyon phyir te /
translated: Because of the fault of having multiple natures.

original: dngos po gcig cig la rjes su phan 'dogs par byed kyi gzhan la ma yin pa de ltar na gcig la rnam pa du ma can gyis 'gyur ba na don yang rnam pa du ma can thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po gcig cig la rjes su phan 'dogs par byed kyi gzhan la ma yin pa de ltar na gcig la rnam pa du ma can gyis 'gyur ba na don yang rnam pa du ma can thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If a single entity assists one and not another, then when it is multiple in one, the object would also be obtained as multiple.

original: don gyi dbang gis nyams su myong bar rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don gyi dbang gis nyams su myong bar rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is posited as an experience due to the power of the object.

original: khas blangs na yang /
analyzed: khas blangs na yang /
translated: Even if you accept that,

original: gang gi tshe bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can don rnam pa du ma can khas blangs ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can don rnam pa du ma can khas blangs ba de'i tshe /
translated: when you accept that the object has many aspects, such as the nature of pleasure,

original: yang gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: yang gnyis kyis te /
translated: then there are two more faults.

original: skyes bu skyon la sogs pa mtshungs pa dang ldan pa cig car mthong bdag gis gcig 'dod pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu skyon la sogs pa mtshungs pa dang ldan pa cig car mthong bdag gis gcig 'dod pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba yin la /
translated: When a person simultaneously sees a single object, such as a vase, that has many aspects, such as being produced, impermanent, and so on, he experiences the aspect of one,

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa gzhan yin no zhes de ltar /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa gzhan yin no zhes de ltar /
translated: but the aspect of another is different.üîΩIn that case,

original: tha dad nyams myong mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad nyams myong mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the experience of the different aspects would not be different.

original: yul 'dres pa la 'dres pa kho nar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul 'dres pa la 'dres pa kho nar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the object is mixed, it would be cognized as mixed.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: That may be so,

original: gal te ma mthong bsgribs gyur na //
analyzed: gal te ma mthong bsgribs gyur na //
translated: but if it is obscured because it is not seen,

original: don 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa la sogs pa rnam pa du ma can yang cig car mthong ba dag la gcig gi 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i ngo bo ma mthong ba gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nyams su myong ba grub par byed pa'i las kyis chod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: don 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa la sogs pa rnam pa du ma can yang cig car mthong ba dag la gcig gi 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i ngo bo ma mthong ba gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nyams su myong ba grub par byed pa'i las kyis chod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: The nature of a single object is not seen because the function of the object that produces the experience of desirable and undesirable is obstructed.

original: gang gi tshe ji ltar goms pa'i don rtogs pa de'i tshe don gyi dbang gis rtogs mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji ltar goms pa'i don rtogs pa de'i tshe don gyi dbang gis rtogs mi 'gyur /
translated: When one understands an object in accordance with one‚Äôs habit, one does not understand it due to the power of the object.

original: 'on kyang don gyi dbang gis rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang don gyi dbang gis rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: But one does not understand it due to the power of the object.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du don rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du don rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means that one does not understand the object as it is.

original: de dang ni du ma'i rnam pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ni du ma'i rnam pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has many aspects.

original: gzhan yang du ma'i bdag nyid dngos po de la /
analyzed: gzhan yang du ma'i bdag nyid dngos po de la /
translated: Moreover, that object which has many natures

original: 'dod pa dang ni mi 'dod pa dag la sogs pa'i ngo bo gcig gi bdag nyid du ngo bo gcig la /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ni mi 'dod pa dag la sogs pa'i ngo bo gcig gi bdag nyid du ngo bo gcig la /
translated: is not the nature of a single object, such as desirable and undesirable.

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa rnam par nges par mthong ba ma mthong ba de las zhes bya ba ji ltar na /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa rnam par nges par mthong ba ma mthong ba de las zhes bya ba ji ltar na /
translated: How can the seeing of the determination of the desirable and the undesirable be the seeing of the object?

original: don mthong byed pa dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: don mthong byed pa dag tu 'gyur //
translated: How can the seeing of the object be the seeing of the determination of the desirable and the undesirable?

original: mi 'gyur ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It cannot be.

original: de de ltar na gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du 'dzin par 'gyur na des don de ston par byed par 'gyur gyi 'dres pa'i ngo bo ma 'dres pa'i ngo bor ston par byed pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du 'dzin par 'gyur na des don de ston par byed par 'gyur gyi 'dres pa'i ngo bo ma 'dres pa'i ngo bor ston par byed pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: If it were to apprehend the object as it is, then it would reveal that object. But it does not reveal the object as it is, since it reveals the object as a mixture of the desirable and the undesirable.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: If that is so, then:

original: gal te 'dod dang mi 'dod par //
analyzed: gal te 'dod dang mi 'dod par //
translated: The desirable and the undesirable

original: snang ba rtog min dbang blo min //
analyzed: snang ba rtog min dbang blo min //
translated: are not the appearances of the nonconceptual sense faculties.

original: yul gcig la 'dod pa dang mi 'dod par snang ba can gyi blo gang yin @224b pa de ni dbang po'i blo ma yin no //
analyzed: yul gcig la 'dod pa dang mi 'dod par snang ba can gyi blo gang yin @224b pa de ni dbang po'i blo ma yin no //
translated: The cognition that has the appearance of the desirable and the undesirable with regard to a single object is not the sense cognition.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: don nye ba la ltos pa med pa'i rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: don nye ba la ltos pa med pa'i rtog pa yin no //
translated: It is a conceptual cognition that does not depend on the presence of an object.

original: dbang po'i blo yang don ji lta ba bzhin yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i blo yang don ji lta ba bzhin yin te /
translated: The sense cognition is also as it is.

original: de nyid kyis yang tshad ma'i 'bras bu dpyod pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis yang tshad ma'i 'bras bu dpyod pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the occasion for examining the result of valid knowledge.

original: de'i don 'brel pa med pa brjod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i don 'brel pa med pa brjod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the meaning of that is stated without connection,

original: 'di ni lan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni lan nyid ma yin te /
translated: that is not an answer.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / 'chi ltas la sogs mtshams sbyor med //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'chi ltas la sogs mtshams sbyor med //
translated: The signs of death, etc., are not connected.

original: rnam pa gzhan nyid du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan nyid du'o //
translated: In another way.

original: de la'ang dbang po la brten pa nyid la yang sems te /
analyzed: de la'ang dbang po la brten pa nyid la yang sems te /
translated: And there is mind in dependence on the sense faculties.

original: shes pas mthong ba yin /
analyzed: shes pas mthong ba yin /
translated: Consciousness sees.

original: sogs pas ni mig ser la sogs pa dang srog chags kyi khyad par gyi dbang po rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pas ni mig ser la sogs pa dang srog chags kyi khyad par gyi dbang po rnams gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes jaundice, etc., and the sense faculties of different kinds of living beings.

original: gal te de ni dbang po la gnod pa byas pa las yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ni dbang po la gnod pa byas pa las yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that is due to impairment of the sense faculties,

original: de na de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de na de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not so, because

original: 'di ltar mi shes pas ro'i rdzas kyi bye brag mi shes pa can gyi phyugs la sogs pa 'ba' zhig gi khar bcug pa'i de ma thag tu kha'i 'gyur ba dang skyugs ldang la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir dbang po la brten pa nyid du sdug bsngal ba
analyzed: 'di ltar mi shes pas ro'i rdzas kyi bye brag mi shes pa can gyi phyugs la sogs pa 'ba' zhig gi khar bcug pa'i de ma thag tu kha'i 'gyur ba dang skyugs ldang la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir dbang po la brten pa nyid du sdug bsngal ba
translated: Because when the meat is placed in the mouths of animals such as cows, who do not know how to distinguish the various types of meat, they immediately make a face, spit it out, and so on.

original: dang / de las gzhan pa dag la rdzas de nyid la dga' ba dang bcas par za ba mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dang / de las gzhan pa dag la rdzas de nyid la dga' ba dang bcas par za ba mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: And when it is placed in the mouths of others, they eat it with relish.

original: dbang po la brten pa nyid bde bar mthong ba nyid yin pa de ltar na de las bsnyon par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po la brten pa nyid bde bar mthong ba nyid yin pa de ltar na de las bsnyon par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is seen that the experience of pleasure is dependent on the sense faculty, it cannot be denied.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar don ji lta ba bzhin du nyams su myong ba ma yin pa /üîΩde phyir phyi rol gzhal bya la'ang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar don ji lta ba bzhin du nyams su myong ba ma yin pa / de phyir phyi rol gzhal bya la'ang /
translated: Since it is not experienced as it is,

original: don khas len par byed na yang /üîΩrang nyid nyams myong 'bras yin rigs //
analyzed: don khas len par byed na yang / rang nyid nyams myong 'bras yin rigs //
translated: even if one accepts external objects,üîΩthe result of experienceüîΩmust be self-experience.

original: rang nyid myong ba kho na 'bras bu yin par rigs so //
analyzed: rang nyid myong ba kho na 'bras bu yin par rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable that the result of experience is self-experience.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir ji ltar nyams su myong ba 'di'i 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de ltar don ni rnam par nges /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji ltar nyams su myong ba 'di'i 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de ltar don ni rnam par nges /
translated: Because the nature of what is experienced is just as it is desired or not desired, the object is ascertained in that way.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar nyams su myong ba nyid yul gyi rnam par nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar nyams su myong ba nyid yul gyi rnam par nges pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, just as it is experienced, the object is ascertained in the aspect of the object,

original: rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: but not in its own nature.

original: gang gi tshe 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don la rang rig pa 'bras bur brjod pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don la rang rig pa 'bras bur brjod pa /
translated: When external objects are described as the effect of reflexive awareness,

original: de tshe don snang yul du snang ba'i shes pa /
analyzed: de tshe don snang yul du snang ba'i shes pa /
translated: then this consciousness that appears as the appearance of an object

original: 'di nyid ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni /
translated: is itselfüîΩthe valid cognition.

original: tshad yin yod du zin na yang //
analyzed: tshad yin yod du zin na yang //
translated: Even if it exists,

original: 'dzin bdag shes pa'i ste /
analyzed: 'dzin bdag shes pa'i ste /
translated: it is the consciousness that apprehends the self.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi phyogs bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi phyogs bzhin no //
translated: It is like the position of Vij√±aptimƒÅtra.

original: phyi rol don gzhal bya nyid du 'dod pa dag la /
analyzed: phyi rol don gzhal bya nyid du 'dod pa dag la /
translated: For those who assert that external objects are the object of comprehension,

original: tshad ma nyid ltos med yin te /üîΩphyi min don can nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ltos med yin te / phyi min don can nyid phyir ro //
translated: valid cognition is independent.üîΩBecause it is not external, it has an object.

original: bdag nyid kyi yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has an object of itself.üîΩSimilarity is the proof.

original: 'dra ba nyid ni sgrub par byed pa yin te /üîΩgang gi @225a * //
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid ni sgrub par byed pa yin te /üîΩgang gi @225a * //
translated: What is the similarity?

original: phyir ji ltar gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa nyid kyis don bdag nyid don gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: phyir ji ltar gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa nyid kyis don bdag nyid don gyi rnam pa'o //
translated: How is it that the object is the form of the object?

original: shes la gnas pa ste so sor snang bar 'gyur ba de ltar gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba nyid la sogs pa nyid kyis don de nges par 'gyur /
analyzed: shes la gnas pa ste so sor snang bar 'gyur ba de ltar gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba nyid la sogs pa nyid kyis don de nges par 'gyur /
translated: The object is ascertained in that way, i.e., as pure, impure, etc., in accordance with the appearance of the object in consciousness.

original: rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i phyir don ni gzhal byar bya ba yin no //üîΩde ltar na shes bde la gnas pa /
analyzed: rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro // de'i phyir don ni gzhal byar bya ba yin no // de ltar na shes bde la gnas pa /
translated: It is inferred.üîΩTherefore, the object is the object of valid knowledge.

original: don gyi rnam pa de'i de ltar zhe na /
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa de'i de ltar zhe na /
translated: Thus, the object is the form of the object that appears in consciousness.

original: gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa nyid kyis yin gyi /
analyzed: gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa nyid kyis yin gyi /
translated: The object is ascertained in that way, i.e., as pure, impure, etc.,

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig las ni ma yin te /
translated: not from anything else.

original: 'on kyang bdag nyid rig pa las yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag nyid rig pa las yin te /
translated: But rather, it is from self-awareness.

original: 'di ltar don ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa la gnas pa myong bar 'gyur ba de ltar gzhal bar bya ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar don ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa la gnas pa myong bar 'gyur ba de ltar gzhal bar bya ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that the object is not the object of valid knowledge in the way that it appears in consciousness, in accordance with the object.

original: don gyi rnam pa de yang shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa de'i phyir de nyid /
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa de yang shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa de'i phyir de nyid /
translated: And the aspect of the object becomes the nature of consciousness.

original: de ltar don myong nyid yin 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar don myong nyid yin 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, it is asserted that the object is the experience itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang phyir shes pa'i cha gzung ba nyid du snang ba ma gtogs pa gzhan /
analyzed: gang phyir shes pa'i cha gzung ba nyid du snang ba ma gtogs pa gzhan /
translated: Because, apart from the aspect of consciousness appearing as the apprehended,üîΩthe object itself does not appear.

original: don bdag mi snang ba de ni myong ba der gnas pa blo can ni /
analyzed: don bdag mi snang ba de ni myong ba der gnas pa blo can ni /
translated: The mind that abides in that experience

original: don dang 'dra ba sgrub byed yin no //
analyzed: don dang 'dra ba sgrub byed yin no //
translated: establishes the object as similar to itself.

original: gal te de'i rnam par 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'dra ba'i bdag nyid myong bar 'gyur ba de bas na /
analyzed: gal te de'i rnam par 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'dra ba'i bdag nyid myong bar 'gyur ba de bas na /
translated: If it arises in the aspect of that object, at that time it would experience itself as having the nature of similarity.

original: de'i dbang gis yul gnas par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis yul gnas par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by the power of that, the object would also abide.

original: blo la gnas pa'i don de rang rig pa de bya ba yin no //üîΩde ltar na ji ltar 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nyid la sogs par blo la /
analyzed: blo la gnas pa'i don de rang rig pa de bya ba yin no // de ltar na ji ltar 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nyid la sogs par blo la /
translated: The object that abides in the mind is the action of reflexive awareness.üîΩIn that case, how is it that the object that abides in the mind

original: gnas pa'i don de ni gang las de ni de ltar ston /
analyzed: gnas pa'i don de ni gang las de ni de ltar ston /
translated: is taught as being desirable or undesirable, and so on?

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo rang rig pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo rang rig pa ston par byed do //
translated: It reveals the essence of the experience of what is desired and not desired.

original: ji lta ji ltar ston pa de lta de ltar don gyi gnas skabs rtogs pa de'i phyir don gyi gnas skabs rtogs pa'i ngo bo ni /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar ston pa de lta de ltar don gyi gnas skabs rtogs pa de'i phyir don gyi gnas skabs rtogs pa'i ngo bo ni /
translated: And just as it reveals, so it realizes the state of affairs. Therefore, the essence of the realization of the state of affairs

original: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: is self-awareness.

original: de ltar shes pa 'dod pa'i rnam pa can dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam pa can gyi myong ba la yul 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nges par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar shes pa 'dod pa'i rnam pa can dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam pa can gyi myong ba la yul 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nges par byed do //
translated: Thus, the experience of the form of what is desired and the form of what is not desired ascertains the object that is desired and not desired.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: don gnas de yi bdag nyid phyir //
analyzed: don gnas de yi bdag nyid phyir //
translated: because it is the nature of the state of affairs,üîΩit is the ultimate.

original: don dam par 'dir rang rigs yin na yang /
analyzed: don dam par 'dir rang rigs yin na yang /
translated: Although it is self-awareness,

original: 'on kyang cha 'di tsam gyis nye bar btags nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang cha 'di tsam gyis nye bar btags nas /
translated: nevertheless, it is designated as such in terms of this aspect.

original: don rig 'dod /
analyzed: don rig 'dod /
translated: It is asserted that it is the awareness of the object.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar gang kho na la phyi rol la sgrub par byed pa de nyid kho na la bya ba yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar gang kho na la phyi rol la sgrub par byed pa de nyid kho na la bya ba yin /
translated: Because it is the establishment of the external, it is the activity.

original: de'i phyir yul tha dad med kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul tha dad med kyang /
translated: Therefore, although the object is not different,

original: tshad ma dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu dag yin no zhes 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshad ma dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu dag yin no zhes 'dod par bya'o //
translated: One should accept that they are valid knowledge and the effect of valid knowledge.

original: gal te 'di ltar @225b ci'i phyir rang rig pa las 'bras bu brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar @225b ci'i phyir rang rig pa las 'bras bu brjod ce na /
translated: If it is like this, why is the effect of reflexive awareness stated?

original: bshad pa bden te 'on kyang phyi rol gyi don gzhal bar bya ba la yang rang rig 'bras bu yin par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: bshad pa bden te 'on kyang phyi rol gyi don gzhal bar bya ba la yang rang rig 'bras bu yin par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: It is true that it is so, but still, in the case of the evaluation of external objects, whatever is explained as the effect of reflexive awareness,

original: rang gi ngo bo dpyod pa na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dpyod pa na /
translated: when the nature of that is analyzed,

original: skabs su ste dngos po'i rang bzhin dpyod pa na don myong ba rang myong ba'i rang bzhin bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: skabs su ste dngos po'i rang bzhin dpyod pa na don myong ba rang myong ba'i rang bzhin bshad pa yin no //
translated: in the context of the analysis of the nature of things, it is explained that the experience of objects is of the nature of self-experience.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don myong de bdag med phyir ro //
analyzed: don myong de bdag med phyir ro //
translated: Because the experience of objects is selfless.

original: rang rig ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the nature of reflexive awareness is the cause.

original: 'di thams cad kyis ni gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don gzhal bya yin pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa'i 'bras bu'i rtog pa gsum pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyis ni gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don gzhal bya yin pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa'i 'bras bu'i rtog pa gsum pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: All of this explains the third conception of the effect, which was stated in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúWhen external objects are the object of evaluation‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du nyams su myong ba med pa de'i tshe /üîΩde la ltos pa med par rang gi bag chags sad pa las 'byung ba'i shes pa'i phyi rol gyi don yod do zhes bya ba de nyid gang las yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du nyams su myong ba med pa de'i tshe / de la ltos pa med par rang gi bag chags sad pa las 'byung ba'i shes pa'i phyi rol gyi don yod do zhes bya ba de nyid gang las yin zhe na /
translated: If there is no experience of objects as they are,

original: shes pa de ltar snang gyur pa'i //
analyzed: shes pa de ltar snang gyur pa'i //
translated: then, in the absence of any dependence on them, what is the basis for the claim that external objects exist, on the grounds that cognition arises due to the activation of one‚Äôs own habitual tendencies?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to this is stated in the lines:üîΩThe cognition that appears in such a way

original: de ltar snang gyur pa ste don la ltos pa med par ro //
analyzed: de ltar snang gyur pa ste don la ltos pa med par ro //
translated: The cognition that appears in such a way, without any dependence on objects,

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa ci 'dra ba snang bar 'gyur ba de 'dra ba'i don 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa ci 'dra ba snang bar 'gyur ba de 'dra ba'i don 'gyur ba'am /
translated: is the cause of the appearance of objects that are either desirable or undesirable, and so on.

original: mi 'dra ba'i 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dpyod pa bor nas ji ltar de las gzhan pa'i rkyen nye ba yang de med na yang shes pa med pa'i phyir dbang po la sogs pa shes pa'i rgyu yin pa de ltar /üîΩre zhig don yang rgyu yin no //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dpyod pa bor nas ji ltar de las gzhan pa'i rkyen nye ba yang de med na yang shes pa med pa'i phyir dbang po la sogs pa shes pa'i rgyu yin pa de ltar / re zhig don yang rgyu yin no //
translated: In other words, without any analysis of whether the object is similar or dissimilar to the cognition, just as the sense faculties and so on are the causes of cognition because they are the conditions that are close to the cognition, in the absence of which there is no cognition,

original: shes pa zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: in the same way, objects are also the causes of cognition.üîΩThe response is stated in the lines:

original: don ni gzhal bya nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: don ni gzhal bya nyid du 'dod //
translated: The meaning is that it is the object of perception.

original: de yang gzhan mi 'dod mod kyi dgag par bzhed nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang gzhan mi 'dod mod kyi dgag par bzhed nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: Although others do not accept this, it is taught in order to refute them.

original: 'dir de lta bur gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rten du gyur pa 'gog pa ma yin na yang gang gis na de ltar lan du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir de lta bur gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rten du gyur pa 'gog pa ma yin na yang gang gis na de ltar lan du 'gyur /
translated: Here, although the basis for the arising of such consciousness is not refuted, how could it be a response?

original: 'on kyang 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: However, it is like this:

original: ji ltar rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar //
translated: Just as some forms,

original: 'dod pa mi 'dod pa la sogs pa don dngos te dngos rang bzhin med par don snang can /
analyzed: 'dod pa mi 'dod pa la sogs pa don dngos te dngos rang bzhin med par don snang can /
translated: such as desirable and undesirable objects, are not real things, the consciousness that appears as objects does not apprehend objects.

original: shes pa de ji ltar don 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa de ji ltar don 'dzin zhe na /
translated: How does it apprehend objects?

original: ji ltar yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa yin te /
translated: How does it exist?

original: sred pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sred pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not craving. This is the meaning.

original: bden te ngas kyang mi shes te /
analyzed: bden te ngas kyang mi shes te /
translated: It is true, I do not know.

original: de skad du brjod pa ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang ngas kyang de ji ltar snang ba bzhin du med pa nyid kyi phyir mi rig go //
analyzed: de skad du brjod pa ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang ngas kyang de ji ltar snang ba bzhin du med pa nyid kyi phyir mi rig go //
translated: Although it is said in this way, it is true, but I also do not understand how it appears, because it does not exist as it appears.

original: 'dis ni 'dod pa grub pa bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dod pa grub pa bshad do //
translated: This explains the establishment of the thesis.

original: phyi rol gyi don med pa yang blo gnyis su snang ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang rig pa 'bras bu yin @226a * //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med pa yang blo gnyis su snang ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang rig pa 'bras bu yin @226a * //
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúEven without external objects, two cognitions appear‚Äù analyzes reflexive awareness as the effect.

original: par dpyod pa na ji ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa tshad ma nyid yin par 'dod pa 'chad par 'gyur ba de ltar na phyi rol gyi don gzhal bya la yang rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'bras bu 'dod na 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid tshad ma yin
analyzed: par dpyod pa na ji ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa tshad ma nyid yin par 'dod pa 'chad par 'gyur ba de ltar na phyi rol gyi don gzhal bya la yang rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'bras bu 'dod na 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid tshad ma yin
translated: When it explains how the aspect of the apprehender is asserted to be valid knowledge, it says that if the object of comprehension, the external object, is asserted to be the effect of reflexive awareness, then the aspect of the apprehender itself is valid knowledge.

original: no zhes dogs par 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: no zhes dogs par 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: In that case,

original: de dag gsal ba'i phyir zhar la 'ongs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gsal ba'i phyir zhar la 'ongs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: in order to clarify that, this ancillary topic is presented.üîΩ  The passage beginning ‚ÄúWhen the object of comprehension is external objects‚Äù is completed, and then the passage beginning ‚ÄúWhatever appears is the object of comprehension‚Äù is applied.

original: gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don ni gzhal bya nyid yin pa de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas snang ba can gang de gzhal bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs dang sbyor bar byed pa de yang de'i yang blo'i bdag
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don ni gzhal bya nyid yin pa de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas snang ba can gang de gzhal bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs dang sbyor bar byed pa de yang de'i yang blo'i bdag
translated: That is also the self-illumination of the mind.

original: nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe self-illumination of cognition‚Äù and so on explains this.

original: phyi rol gyi don med pa la tshad ma la sogs ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yin zhes 'dri ba la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med pa la tshad ma la sogs ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yin zhes 'dri ba la /
translated: The question is raised: ‚ÄúIf external objects do not exist, how can valid cognitions and so on be established?‚Äù

original: bshad pa 'di la yang don dam pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di la yang don dam pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúIn this explanation, the ultimate establishment does not exist.‚Äù

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: ji ltar snang ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba bzhin du'o //
translated: It is just as it appears.

original: de'i phyir 'di la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, in this [world], there is no aspect of object apprehended and subject apprehender,

original: blo'i bdag nyid du gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩ'on kyang 'di ltar blo'i bdag nyid cha med par phyin ci log tu mthong ba yis /
analyzed: blo'i bdag nyid du gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro // 'on kyang 'di ltar blo'i bdag nyid cha med par phyin ci log tu mthong ba yis /
translated: because it is a single entity of cognition.üîΩHowever, in this way, the person who is deluded by the error of ignorance,

original: ma rig pa'i 'khrul pa'i skyes bu dag gis /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'khrul pa'i skyes bu dag gis /
translated: who sees the partless nature of cognition as mistaken,üîΩexperiences the difference between object apprehended and subject apprehender,

original: gzung ba'am 'dzin pa'i myong ba dag / tha dad pa rnams kyi tha dad pa bzhin du mtshon par 'gyur gyi don dam par de lta bur gyur pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba'am 'dzin pa'i myong ba dag / tha dad pa rnams kyi tha dad pa bzhin du mtshon par 'gyur gyi don dam par de lta bur gyur pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and it is indicated as different, but ultimately it is not like that.

original: gal te cha med pa'i ngo bo yin na /
analyzed: gal te cha med pa'i ngo bo yin na /
translated: If it is a partless entity,

original: ji ltar rnam pa gzhan du snang bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa gzhan du snang bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: How can it appear in another aspect?

original: skyon 'di yod pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / ji ltar sngags sogs kyis 'khrugs pas //
analyzed: skyon 'di yod pa ma yin te / 'di ltar / ji ltar sngags sogs kyis 'khrugs pas //
translated: This fault does not exist.üîΩThus:üîΩBy the power of spells, etc.,

original: dbang po rnams la 'jim dum sogs //
analyzed: dbang po rnams la 'jim dum sogs //
translated: the senses perceive lumps of clay, etc.,

original: de yi gzugs dang bral na yang//
analyzed: de yi gzugs dang bral na yang//
translated: even though they are devoid of that form.

original: ji ltar snang ba de de'i bdag nyid du med na yang /
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba de de'i bdag nyid du med na yang /
translated: Even though the appearance is not of that nature,

original: rnam pa gzhan du glang po che la sogs pa'i bdag tu snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du glang po che la sogs pa'i bdag tu snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it appears in another aspect as an elephant, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas rnal 'byor dang sbyor ba'i nus pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas rnal 'byor dang sbyor ba'i nus pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the power of yoga and application, etc.

original: gal te sngags la sogs pa'i nus pas de'i bdag nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sngags la sogs pa'i nus pas de'i bdag nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúBy the power of spells, etc., it arises in that nature,‚Äù

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / de ltar ma 'khrul mig can gyis //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de ltar ma 'khrul mig can gyis //
translated: Those with unconfused eyes

original: mig 'phrul la sogs pa dag gi mig gi nus pa mngon par 'dus ma byas pa can gyi skyes bu dag gis yul dang dus de dang nye ba yin du zin kyang 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa de dag la glang po che la sogs @226b pa'i
analyzed: mig 'phrul la sogs pa dag gi mig gi nus pa mngon par 'dus ma byas pa can gyi skyes bu dag gis yul dang dus de dang nye ba yin du zin kyang 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa de dag la glang po che la sogs @226b pa'i
translated: Even though the person who possesses the unfabricated potential of the eye, due to such things as magic, is near to that object and time, the clay fragment and so on do not appear as an elephant and so on.üîΩ

original: bdag nyid du mthong ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid du mthong ba med phyir ro //
translated: Even though the objects, such as the piece of wood, are near to the person whose eye faculty is not affected by such things as magic, they are not seen as elephants, etc.

original: 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdper na thag ring mya ngan na //
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro // dper na thag ring mya ngan na //
translated: because they are not apprehended as such.üîΩFor example,

original: chung du chen por snang ba bzhin //
analyzed: chung du chen por snang ba bzhin //
translated: in the distance, a small object appears large.

original: dper na mya ngan dag na yul dang dus der gnas pa'i dbyibs la sogs pa'i bye brag gis thag ring po na gnas pa'i don chung du yang chen bor snang ba bzhin no ;
analyzed: dper na mya ngan dag na yul dang dus der gnas pa'i dbyibs la sogs pa'i bye brag gis thag ring po na gnas pa'i don chung du yang chen bor snang ba bzhin no ;
translated: For example, in the distance, a small object appears large due to the particular shape, etc., of the object and the place where it is situated.

original: / gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir don dam par gang 'di /
analyzed: / gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir don dam par gang 'di /
translated: Since this is so, therefore, ultimately,

original: dpag bya dpog pa'i 'bras gnas pa //
analyzed: dpag bya dpog pa'i 'bras gnas pa //
translated: the result of the object of inferenceüîΩdoes not exist, but is apprehended

original: yod pa min yang gzung ba dang // 'dzin pa'i rigs la ji lta bur //
analyzed: yod pa min yang gzung ba dang // 'dzin pa'i rigs la ji lta bur //
translated: in the class of the object of apprehension and the apprehender.

original: gzung ba nyid snang ba gang yin pa de ni gzhal bya yin zhing 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid du snang ba ni tshad ma yin la bdag nyid myong ba ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa rjes su snang ba bzhin 'di bshad do //
analyzed: gzung ba nyid snang ba gang yin pa de ni gzhal bya yin zhing 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid du snang ba ni tshad ma yin la bdag nyid myong ba ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa rjes su snang ba bzhin 'di bshad do //
translated: The appearance of the object is the object of evaluation, the appearance of the aspect of the apprehender is the valid cognition, and the experience of the self is the result.üîΩThis is explained according to the appearance.

original: ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yin gyi don dam bar nim yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yin gyi don dam bar nim yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: As it appears, but not ultimately. This is the conclusion.

original: de ltar min na /
analyzed: de ltar min na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: tha dad pa 'di 'byung ba nyid kyi snang ba yin par 'dod na dngos gcig la /
analyzed: tha dad pa 'di 'byung ba nyid kyi snang ba yin par 'dod na dngos gcig la /
translated: if the appearance of the object were accepted as the appearance of the arising of the different aspects, then in one entity,

original: blo'i bdag nyid cha dang ldan pa ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: blo'i bdag nyid cha dang ldan pa ma yin pa la'o //
translated: in the mind that does not possess parts,

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: what would it be like?

original: sna tshogs kyi ngo bo snang ba can te /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi ngo bo snang ba can te /
translated: It would appear as a variety of natures.

original: sna tshogs kyi ngo bo yang de dag yin la snang ba yang de dag yin te /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi ngo bo yang de dag yin la snang ba yang de dag yin te /
translated: The variety of natures is that, and the appearance is that.

original: de gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which has that‚Äù is applied to that.

original: gcig po de la rnam pa dag ji ltar bden 'gyur te //
analyzed: gcig po de la rnam pa dag ji ltar bden 'gyur te //
translated: How could the aspects be true in that one?

original: de ltar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gcig pa nyid de nyams phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid de nyams phyir ro //
translated: Because the oneness of that would be destroyed.

original: blo'i bdag nyid gcig pa de'i gcig pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo'i bdag nyid gcig pa de'i gcig pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: The oneness of the nature of cognition would be destroyed.

original: de ltar na yang yod pa'i khyad par nye bar mtshon pa gang yin pa de ni sna tshogs yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang yod pa'i khyad par nye bar mtshon pa gang yin pa de ni sna tshogs yin te /
translated: And even so, the particular existence that is indicated is diverse.

original: dper na bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like pleasure, pain, etc.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa de dag yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa de dag yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so /
