translated: Therefore, those aspects do not exist. This is the intended meaning.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Cognition

original: bam bo sum cu rtsa gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam bo sum cu rtsa gnyis pa /
translated: Chapter Thirty-Two

original: bde ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa /
translated: Pleasure, etc.

original: gzhan la gzhan nyid nyams phyir dang // rnam pa de dag yod pa yin pa bsam par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan nyid nyams phyir dang // rnam pa de dag yod pa yin pa bsam par mi bya'o //
translated: Because otherness to another would be destroyed, those aspects should not be thought to exist.

original: de ltar na yod pa'i khyad par gyi rnam pa la brten nam bde ba la sogs pa phan tshun sna tshogs pa nyid yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar na yod pa'i khyad par gyi rnam pa la brten nam bde ba la sogs pa phan tshun sna tshogs pa nyid yin par brjod do //
translated: Thus, based on the aspects of particular existence, pleasure, etc. are said to be mutually diverse.

original: gang gi tshe yod pa'i khyad par nye bar mtshon pa can yin na yang blo gcig nyid yin par khas len pa de'i tshe yod pa'i khyad par gyi rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyi rgyu ma yin na bde ba la sogs pa'i phan tshun sna tshogs @227aüîΩ* // par 'gyur te /üîΩmi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yod pa'i khyad par nye bar mtshon pa can yin na yang blo gcig nyid yin par khas len pa de'i tshe yod pa'i khyad par gyi rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyi rgyu ma yin na bde ba la sogs pa'i phan tshun sna tshogs @227a * // par 'gyur te / mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But when you accept that a single cognition is characterized by the presence of a variety, then the various aspects of the presence of a variety cannot be the cause of the variety of pleasure, etc.

original: gal te blo'i sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo dang gcig gi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te blo'i sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo dang gcig gi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the variety of the nature of cognition is the cause of the variety of pleasure, etc.,

original: de ni dngos mthong med phyir tha dad yin /
analyzed: de ni dngos mthong med phyir tha dad yin /
translated: that is not so, because the variety of the nature of cognition is not seen.

original: gcig pa de nyid yin par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig pa de nyid yin par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that they are identical,

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi ngo bo gcig mthong ba med pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi ngo bo gcig mthong ba med pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause of the perception of such an aspect is not seen.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bor mthong na ni tha dad pa med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bor mthong na ni tha dad pa med par 'gyur na /
translated: If you see them as having an undifferentiated nature, they would be undifferentiated.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: gang las blo ngo bo gcig pa can nye bar mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa gcig nyid yin /
analyzed: gang las blo ngo bo gcig pa can nye bar mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa gcig nyid yin /
translated: How could it be one, when it is not the object that is indicated by a single cognition?

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In that case,

original: blo dngos tha dad med mthong bas //
analyzed: blo dngos tha dad med mthong bas //
translated: The cognition would not see the difference,

original: tha dad mad par nges par 'gyur //
analyzed: tha dad mad par nges par 'gyur //
translated: And it would be ascertained as nondifferent.

original: gal te blo la lar tha dad pa med par mthong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe gcig nyid du nges par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te blo la lar tha dad pa med par mthong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe gcig nyid du nges par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the cognition were to see nondifference somewhere, then it would be ascertained as one.

original: de lta ma yin te ngo bo tha dad pa med pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te ngo bo tha dad pa med pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not like that, for it sees the difference in nature.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar gcig dang du ma'i mtshan nyid rnam pa ji ltar yang mi rung ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar gcig dang du ma'i mtshan nyid rnam pa ji ltar yang mi rung ba de'i phyir /
translated: Since in this way the characteristics of one and many are not suitable in any way,

original: rnam pa gang gis dngos po rnam dpyad na //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis dngos po rnam dpyad na //
translated: When one analyzes entities in any way,

original: de'i ngo bo don dam par de nyid du na dngos med do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo don dam par de nyid du na dngos med do //
translated: ultimately, their nature is not an entity.

original: gang gi phyir na de dag la //
analyzed: gang gi phyir na de dag la //
translated: Why is that?

original: gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo med //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo med //
translated: Because they do not have the nature of one or many.

original: dngos po rnams nye bar mtshon na gcig dang du ma nyid du 'gyur grang na gcig nyid dang du ma nyid de dag ni yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: dngos po rnams nye bar mtshon na gcig dang du ma nyid du 'gyur grang na gcig nyid dang du ma nyid de dag ni yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If things are indicated as being one or many, they are not one or many.

original: rnam pa gang gis de dag dpyod par 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis de dag dpyod par 'gyur /
translated: In what way are they investigated?

original: cha med du zin kyang cha dang ldan par 'khrul pas nye bar mtshon pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: cha med du zin kyang cha dang ldan par 'khrul pas nye bar mtshon pa ma yin nam /
translated: Even if they are partless, are they not indicated because of the error of having parts?

original: de yang 'jig rten pa dag gi 'khrul pa skye ba yin gyi rgyu med pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten pa dag gi 'khrul pa skye ba yin gyi rgyu med pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: That error arises in worldly people, but it is not causeless.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /üîΩchos mthun pa nyid mthong ba las de bdag nyid la de bdag tu zhen pa ste dper na smig rgyu la sogs pa chu'i ngo bo ma yin pa dag la chos mthun pa nyid las skyes bu 'khrul pa sgro btags pa'i chu'i don gyi rang gi ngo bo
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na / chos mthun pa nyid mthong ba las de bdag nyid la de bdag tu zhen pa ste dper na smig rgyu la sogs pa chu'i ngo bo ma yin pa dag la chos mthun pa nyid las skyes bu 'khrul pa sgro btags pa'i chu'i don gyi rang gi ngo bo
translated: What is it, then?

original: la zhen pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: la zhen pa lta bu'o //
translated: From seeing a similarity, one conceives of that as having that nature, just as a person, from a similarity, conceives of the nature of water in a mirage, which is not water.

original: 'khrul pa skyes ba'i rim pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa skyes ba'i rim pa yin no //
translated: That is the process of the arising of error.

original: de ltar na gal te 'di la yang blo yis tha dad pa 'ba' zhig gi chos mi mthun pa mthong ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gal te 'di la yang blo yis tha dad pa 'ba' zhig gi chos mi mthun pa mthong ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if a cognition of a different, discrete object arises,

original: de'i tshe 'khrul pa srid pa'i phyir tha dad par 'dzin par rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khrul pa srid pa'i phyir tha dad par 'dzin par rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, since error is possible, it is known that it apprehends a difference.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi gzhung 'di la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi gzhung 'di la /
translated: In this way, in this system of consciousness only,

original: chos mthun pa 'di mthong ba la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos mthun pa 'di mthong ba la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa yin no //
translated: there is no basis for error, such as seeing a commonality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig rten 'di la de bdag nyid //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di la de bdag nyid //
translated: Because in this world, that nature

original: don gcig kyang yang dag pa ma @227b yin pa'i don gyi rnam pa dang ldan pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: don gcig kyang yang dag pa ma @227b yin pa'i don gyi rnam pa dang ldan pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: is not seen to have a form of unreal meaning. This is the opponent‚Äôs view.

original: 'di yod kyang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: 'di yod kyang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gog par byed do //
translated: The refutation is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúEven if it exists. . . .‚Äù

original: bden mod kyi ji skad du bshad pa yid kyi 'khrul pa chos mthun pa la sogs pa 'byung ba can /
analyzed: bden mod kyi ji skad du bshad pa yid kyi 'khrul pa chos mthun pa la sogs pa 'byung ba can /
translated: It is true, but as explained, mental error arises with a commonality, etc.

original: 'di yod kyang de tsam ni thams cad kyi rgyu ma yin te 'on kyang nang gi 'khrul pa ma rig pa'i ling tog la sogs pa de las byung ba gang yin pa de ni nang ngo bo'i 'khrul pa las byung ba can gyis bslad pa gang yin pa
analyzed: 'di yod kyang de tsam ni thams cad kyi rgyu ma yin te 'on kyang nang gi 'khrul pa ma rig pa'i ling tog la sogs pa de las byung ba gang yin pa de ni nang ngo bo'i 'khrul pa las byung ba can gyis bslad pa gang yin pa
translated: Although this exists, that alone is not the cause of everything. However, that which arises from the internal delusion of the cataract of ignorance and so on is that which is contaminated by arising from internal intrinsic delusion.

original: de skyon byung phyir na /
analyzed: de skyon byung phyir na /
translated: Because that arises from a fault,üîΩit is a cause that arises from faults such as ignorance.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa las byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir rang bzhin gyis phyin ci log tu snang ba can /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa las byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir rang bzhin gyis phyin ci log tu snang ba can /
translated: That which intrinsically appears in a distorted way

original: de ni mthong sogs chos mthun can nyid la /üîΩltos med ni 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mthong sogs chos mthun can nyid la / ltos med ni 'khrul pa'o //
translated: is the one that is similar to the phenomena of seeing and so on.üîΩThe one that is similar to the phenomena of seeing and so on

original: chos mthun pa nyid mthong ba ni chos mthun pa nyid mthong ba ste /
analyzed: chos mthun pa nyid mthong ba ni chos mthun pa nyid mthong ba ste /
translated: is the one that is similar to the phenomena of seeing and so on.

original: 'di la de dang po byas pa yod pa de ltar na /
analyzed: 'di la de dang po byas pa yod pa de ltar na /
translated: Since this has that as its original cause,

original: mthong sogs chos mthun can nyid la //
analyzed: mthong sogs chos mthun can nyid la //
translated: the one that is similar to the phenomena of seeing and so on

original: 'khrul pa gang yin pa ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa gang yin pa ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: is the one that is called ‚Äúthe one that is without reliance,‚Äù which is a mistaken one.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni khyad par du sgro 'dogs pa dang der zhen pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni khyad par du sgro 'dogs pa dang der zhen pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù is meant to include the superimposition of distinctions and the clinging to them.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: In what way?

original: rab rib la sogs bzhin /
analyzed: rab rib la sogs bzhin /
translated: Like the appearance of floaters and so on.

original: dper na rab rib can la sogs pa'i shes pa chos mthun pa nyid la ltos nas 'byung ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang dbang po'i nus pa dkrugs pa las yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na rab rib can la sogs pa'i shes pa chos mthun pa nyid la ltos nas 'byung ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang dbang po'i nus pa dkrugs pa las yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, the consciousness of someone with an eye disease does not arise in dependence upon a real object that is similar to the object that appears to it. Rather, it arises due to a disturbance in the potential of the sense faculty.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la tshad ma la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la tshad ma la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that‚Äù and so on shows how the presentation of valid knowledge and so on is applicable to consciousness only.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam de la blo ni yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam de la blo ni yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: In that consciousness only, cognition is the determination.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is asserted to be the form of apprehension.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa de ni de bdag nyid phyir yongs su gcod pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag rig yin te nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid de gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa de ni de bdag nyid phyir yongs su gcod pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag rig yin te nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid de gsal ba yin no //
translated: That form of apprehension is reflexive awareness because it is the nature of determination. It is self-illuminating, the nature of experience.

original: des ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa de rang rig par rnam par gzhag pa'i rten yin pa de ltar na yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid gsal bar bdag nyid myong bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des ni 'dzin pa'i rnam pa de rang rig par rnam par gzhag pa'i rten yin pa de ltar na yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid gsal bar bdag nyid myong bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, the aspect of the apprehender is posited as the basis of self-awareness. In that case, the nature of the object of comprehension is clearly experienced by itself.üîΩFor that reason, the aspect of the apprehender is posited as the proof of that self-awareness.

original: rgyu de'i phyir 'dzin pa'i rnam pa de ni rang rig pa de'i sgrub byed yin par rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro //üîΩde bdag yul can 'jog byed la //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir 'dzin pa'i rnam pa de ni rang rig pa de'i sgrub byed yin par rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro // de bdag yul can 'jog byed la //
translated: That is the basis for positing the subject that has the object of self.

original: bdag nyid kyi yul gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //üîΩbdag gi yul can dpog pa @228a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi yul gang la yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro // bdag gi yul can dpog pa @228a * //
translated: The phrase that which has the object of self should be connected.

original: yang gang zhe na /üîΩdper na 'dod chags tshogs tshor bzhin //
analyzed: yang gang zhe na / dper na 'dod chags tshogs tshor bzhin //
translated: How is the subject that has the object of self inferred?üîΩFor example, like the feeling of desire.

original: dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa nyams su myong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa nyams su myong ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the experience of desire and so on.

original: des na 'dir rang gi bdag nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dir rang gi bdag nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, here the subject is valid cognition by itself.

original: de la 'dir rnam par rig pa tsam gyi gzhung de ma thag tu brjod pa /
analyzed: de la 'dir rnam par rig pa tsam gyi gzhung de ma thag tu brjod pa /
translated: In that regard, here in the treatise of Vij√±aptimƒÅtra, it is said immediately after:

original: gzhal bya gzhal byed 'bras gnas pa //
analyzed: gzhal bya gzhal byed 'bras gnas pa //
translated: The object of comprehension, the means of comprehension, and the result of comprehension,

original: zhes bya ba gang yin pa bdag gi yul can gyi tshad ma kun la 'di ni sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang yin pa bdag gi yul can gyi tshad ma kun la 'di ni sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This is to be applied to all valid cognitions that have a self as their object.

original: de la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: And in that, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul can gyi dpog pa de la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis rang bdag myong bar rung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul can gyi dpog pa de la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis rang bdag myong bar rung ngo //
translated: In that valid cognition that has desire, etc. as its object, those desire, etc. are suitable to be experienced by the self that grasps them in the aspect of their own nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid phyir //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid phyir //
translated: Because of the nature of experience.

original: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag ni /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag ni /
translated: Because of the nature of experience, those desire, etc.

original: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du rab tu gsal ba na /üîΩbdag nyid nyams su myong ba yin no zhes bdag nyams su myong bar bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du rab tu gsal ba na / bdag nyid nyams su myong ba yin no zhes bdag nyams su myong bar bstan par bya'o //
translated: are clearly manifest in the nature of experience.üîΩThus, the self is taught to be experienced.

original: de bas na nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid de las bdag nyams su myong ba la rung ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid de las bdag nyams su myong ba la rung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the self is suitable to be experienced from that which has the nature of experience.

original: de ltar yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi rung nyid de dpog / tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi rung nyid de dpog / tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: That is the valid knowledge.

original: de dag gi nyams su myong bar bya ba /
analyzed: de dag gi nyams su myong bar bya ba /
translated: The experience of those

original: bdag dpag rang rig 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: bdag dpag rang rig 'bras bu yin //
translated: is the result of reflexive awareness.

original: rtogs pa 'bras bu yin no zhes rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa 'bras bu yin no zhes rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The result is the realization.

original: ci ste rnam par rig pa tsam nyid gzhan myong ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste rnam par rig pa tsam nyid gzhan myong ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is argued that since there is only awareness and no experience of something else,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir de dag so sor 'god par bya ba nyid ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir de dag so sor 'god par bya ba nyid ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: because of being the same as consciousness that has the nature of observing attachment and so on, they are not to be posited separately,

original: skyon 'di yod pa ma yin te /üîΩphyi rol gyi don la rnam par gzhag pa 'di nyid blta bar bya'o zhes nye bar dgod par bstan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon 'di yod pa ma yin te / phyi rol gyi don la rnam par gzhag pa 'di nyid blta bar bya'o zhes nye bar dgod par bstan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: this error does not exist.üîΩThis is taught to be a mere presentation for those who assert external objects.

original: slob dpon gyis bde ba la sogs pa rang rig pa'i tshad mar bshad pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis bde ba la sogs pa rang rig pa'i tshad mar bshad pa /
translated: The master explains that pleasure and so on are valid knowledge that is reflexive awareness.

original: de yang 'khrul par byas pa'i ngo bo 'dzin pas yang 'dir 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid dpog pa yin no zhes bshad pa thos nas 'ga' zhig tu 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'gal ba yin no snyam du sems pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang 'khrul par byas pa'i ngo bo 'dzin pas yang 'dir 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid dpog pa yin no zhes bshad pa thos nas 'ga' zhig tu 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'gal ba yin no snyam du sems pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'i phyir /
translated: Having heard this explanation, some may think that there is a contradiction at some point. In order to anticipate this,

original: bdag la 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas dgongs pa gcig nyid yin par ston to //
analyzed: bdag la 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas dgongs pa gcig nyid yin par ston to //
translated: he shows that there is only one intention with the words grasping of the self, and so on.

original: rang rig pa zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang 'bras bu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang rig pa zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang 'bras bu ma yin gyi /
translated: That which is explained as self-awareness is not the result.

original: 'on @228b kyang bdag la ste shes par bya ba la 'dzin pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i ming can gyi byed pa /
analyzed: 'on @228b kyang bdag la ste shes par bya ba la 'dzin pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i ming can gyi byed pa /
translated: However, the activity called the aspect of grasping the object to be known,

original: byed pa por byas nas yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid de rig pa'i sgras bshad do //
analyzed: byed pa por byas nas yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid de rig pa'i sgras bshad do //
translated: having been made the agent, is explained by the word awareness as having the nature of determination.

original: yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid de nyid ni /
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid de nyid ni /
translated: That very nature of determination

original: rung nyid ces bya ba'i phyir tshad ma dang / rang rig ces ni rab tu bshad //
analyzed: rung nyid ces bya ba'i phyir tshad ma dang / rang rig ces ni rab tu bshad //
translated: is explained as valid cognition and self-awareness, because of being suitable.

original: ming gzhan gyis don tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming gzhan gyis don tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not become a different meaning due to a different name.

original: blo tshul gnyis su rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo tshul gnyis su rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is well established that cognition is twofold.

original: yul shes de yi shes pa yis //
analyzed: yul shes de yi shes pa yis //
translated: The cognition of the object and the cognition of that cognition

original: bye brag las ni tshul gnyis nyid //
analyzed: bye brag las ni tshul gnyis nyid //
translated: are different in kind, because of the difference in the objects.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa nye bar bkod pa'i gzhung 'chad par bzhed pas rnam par shes pa thams cad nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa nye bar bkod pa'i gzhung 'chad par bzhed pas rnam par shes pa thams cad nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to explain the passage beginning with the words, ‚ÄúAll cognitions are of two kinds,‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúAll cognitions are of two kinds, because of the difference in the objects.‚Äù

original: rnam par shis pa thams cad nyid //üîΩbdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin gyi //
analyzed: rnam par shis pa thams cad nyid // bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin gyi //
translated: All cognitions are of two kinds,

original: yul rnams las ni byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: yul rnams las ni byung ba'i phyir //
translated: because of the arising of the objects,üîΩas they are.

original: de las gzhan pa /üîΩyul las gzhan pa dbang po la sogs pa'i rgyu yod na yang ngo //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa / yul las gzhan pa dbang po la sogs pa'i rgyu yod na yang ngo //
translated: From that,

original: rnam 'gas te dngos po'i chos nyid kyi yul gyis byas pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam 'gas te dngos po'i chos nyid kyi yul gyis byas pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: from the existence of the causes of the sense faculties, etc., which are different from the object.

original: ji ltar zhe na dper na zas dang dus la sogs bu skyes pa'i bu skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin yang bu de rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang pha de'i gzugs gcig 'dzin 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na dper na zas dang dus la sogs bu skyes pa'i bu skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin yang bu de rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang pha de'i gzugs gcig 'dzin 'gyur gyi /
translated: In what way? For example, food, time, etc., are the causes of the birth of a son, but the son is not in any way a percipient of the father‚Äôs form.

original: gal te yang pha dang ma bu'i rgyu yin pa de ltar na yang /
analyzed: gal te yang pha dang ma bu'i rgyu yin pa de ltar na yang /
translated: But even if the father and mother are the cause of the child,

original: de gnyi ga'i gzugs kyi rjes su byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i gzugs kyi rjes su byed pa ma yin no //
translated: the child does not resemble both of them.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What does it resemble?

original: pha ma dag las pha'am ma'i gzugs gcig pu 'dzin par 'gyur gyi /üîΩgzhan 'ga'i ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pha ma dag las pha'am ma'i gzugs gcig pu 'dzin par 'gyur gyi / gzhan 'ga'i ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It resembles either the father or the mother, but not the other.

original: de las gzhan pa zas la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zas la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not resemble the other, such as food, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni de las gzhan pa ma mthong ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni de las gzhan pa ma mthong ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes what is not seen, etc.

original: de las gzhan dang dbang po la sogs pa dang yul dag ni /üîΩde'i rgyu nyid du rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid du mtshungs na yang de chos de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pas yul nyid yin 'dod de /
analyzed: de las gzhan dang dbang po la sogs pa dang yul dag ni / de'i rgyu nyid du rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid du mtshungs na yang de chos de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pas yul nyid yin 'dod de /
translated: The other, such as the sense faculties, etc., and the object,

original: khas len to //
analyzed: khas len to //
translated: are similar in being the cause of consciousness, but the object is accepted as the object because the consciousness resembles the form of the object.

original: don med pa na /
analyzed: don med pa na /
translated: If there is no object,

original: yul gyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa na yul nyid dbang po la sogs pa bzhin du yul du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa na yul nyid dbang po la sogs pa bzhin du yul du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: when it resembles the form of the object, it is not the object, like the sense faculties, etc.

original: don dang ldan pa'i sems la yang //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa'i sems la yang //
translated: And the mind that is endowed with the meaning,üîΩ

original: don rnams med par dogs bar 'gyur //
analyzed: don rnams med par dogs bar 'gyur //
translated: And there is doubt that the object exists for the mind that has the object.

original: de de ltar na 'das ma thag pa'i rnam pas blo tshul gnyis nyid du grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na 'das ma thag pa'i rnam pas blo tshul gnyis nyid du grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind is established as having two modes by the immediately preceding condition.

original: de ltar yin na yang brjod par bya ste /üîΩyul dang bcas pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag las don gzhan du gyur pa don dam @229a * //
analyzed: de ltar yin na yang brjod par bya ste / yul dang bcas pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag las don gzhan du gyur pa don dam @229a * //
translated: But this must be stated:

original: pa'i don dang / kun du brtags pa'i don dang ldan pa'i shes pa de dag la yang don gyi rnam pa med par dogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa'i don dang / kun du brtags pa'i don dang ldan pa'i shes pa de dag la yang don gyi rnam pa med par dogs par 'gyur te /
translated: From those consciousnesses of eye, etc., together with their objects, there is doubt that the object exists for the consciousness that has an ultimate object or an imagined object, which is different from those objects.

original: dper na shes pa 'di don gyi rnam pa can yin nam 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shes pa 'di don gyi rnam pa can yin nam 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, is this consciousness with the aspect of an object or not?

original: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa 'das pa'i don la dmigs ba de'i tshe rnam par shes pa de'i yul snang ba'i rnam pa gcig dang nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa gzhan no zhes the tshom yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa 'das pa'i don la dmigs ba de'i tshe rnam par shes pa de'i yul snang ba'i rnam pa gcig dang nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa gzhan no zhes the tshom yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When the conceptual consciousness observes a past object, there is no doubt that the aspect of the object appearing to that consciousness is one thing and the aspect of the experience is another.

original: de'i tshe da ltar yul gyi rnam par snang ba de ni 'das pa nyid kyis med pa'i don gyi nang du bsdu bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe da ltar yul gyi rnam par snang ba de ni 'das pa nyid kyis med pa'i don gyi nang du bsdu bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: At that time, the appearance of the object in the present cannot be subsumed within the object that is past and nonexistent.

original: rnam ba de blo yin pa nyid kyi phyir de nyams su myong ba ma yin pa de ltar na bdag nyid shes pa de nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam ba de blo yin pa nyid kyi phyir de nyams su myong ba ma yin pa de ltar na bdag nyid shes pa de nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that aspect is the mind itself, it is not experienced. Thus, because that self-knowing mind is not experienced,

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid myong ba yang ma bkag pa nyid yin no //üîΩde ltar rnam par rtog pa'i blos //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid myong ba yang ma bkag pa nyid yin no // de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i blos //
translated: the experience of the nature of consciousness is not refuted.üîΩThus, when the past object is apprehended

original: 'das pa'i don ni 'dzin pa na //
analyzed: 'das pa'i don ni 'dzin pa na //
translated: by the conceptual mind,

original: blo'i tshul gnyis rang rig grub pa yin no //
analyzed: blo'i tshul gnyis rang rig grub pa yin no //
translated: the two modes of the mind are established as self-knowing.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is how it is.

original: 'das pa'i blo gang yin pa de 'dod pa'i tshe don 'dzin pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'das pa'i blo gang yin pa de 'dod pa'i tshe don 'dzin pa ma yin na /
translated: If the past mind does not apprehend the object at the time of desire,

original: gang gis na don gyis rnam pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir tshul gnyis grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na don gyis rnam pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir tshul gnyis grub par 'gyur /
translated: then how could the two modes be established because of possessing the aspect of the object?

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: gsang ba'i ngo bo zhig tu zin kyang rigs 'jig pa med pa can yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gsang ba'i ngo bo zhig tu zin kyang rigs 'jig pa med pa can yod pa yin te /
translated: Even though it is a hidden entity, the past mind exists because it is the cause of memory.

original: de la dmigs pa de de ltar na don dang ldan pa yin zhing shes pa la yang don gyi rnam pa'i dogs pa dang bral ba nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa de de ltar na don dang ldan pa yin zhing shes pa la yang don gyi rnam pa'i dogs pa dang bral ba nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is observed, it possesses an object, and consciousness is free from the doubt that the aspect is the object.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sngo sogs rnam pa tha dad phyir //
analyzed: sngo sogs rnam pa tha dad phyir //
translated: Because the aspect of blue and so on is different.

original: 'das pa 'dzin pa can gyi rnam par shes pa de ni sngon po la sogs pa rnam par skyes shing byung ba dang rjes su 'brel par snang ba'i sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi rigs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa 'dzin pa can gyi rnam par shes pa de ni sngon po la sogs pa rnam par skyes shing byung ba dang rjes su 'brel par snang ba'i sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi rigs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The consciousness that apprehends the past does not exist as the type that arises and occurs as the aspect of blue and so on and appears as related to that.

original: de ni de ldan min /
analyzed: de ni de ldan min /
translated: It does not possess that.

original: shes pa sngon po la sogs pa'i snang ba'i don ma yin rigs yul ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa sngon po la sogs pa'i snang ba'i don ma yin rigs yul ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of the appearance of consciousness as blue, etc. is not a universal, nor is it an object.

original: 'on kyang rigs de rtag pa'am mi rtag par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs de rtag pa'am mi rtag par 'gyur grang na /
translated: But is that universal permanent or impermanent?

original: de la gal te mi rtag pa yin pa de'i tshe tha dad pa ngo bo gzhan dang gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir gsal ba bzhin du rigs su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gal te mi rtag pa yin pa de'i tshe tha dad pa ngo bo gzhan dang gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir gsal ba bzhin du rigs su mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is impermanent, then it is a different nature, a different thing, and like the manifestation, it is not a universal,

original: rigs ni ngo bo gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs ni ngo bo gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a universal is a single nature.

original: ci ste rtag pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste rtag pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if it is permanent,

original: rtag na'ang skyed byed ji ltar rung //
analyzed: rtag na'ang skyed byed ji ltar rung //
translated: then how can a permanent thing be a producer?

original: rnam par shes pa nyid kyi rtag ba rnams ni byed pa po nyid ma yin pa sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩskyed par byed pa ma yin pa yang yul ma yin pa de ltar na gang @229b cir yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid kyi rtag ba rnams ni byed pa po nyid ma yin pa sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro // skyed par byed pa ma yin pa yang yul ma yin pa de ltar na gang @229b cir yang mi rung ste /
translated: Because it has already been demonstrated that permanent consciousnesses are not agents.

original: rigs yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs yul ma yin no //
translated: And a nonproducer is not an object. Thus, a universal is not an object in any way.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: mi ldan pa'i 'du byed ming ngam don nam mtshan ma'i don la de'i tshe dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba la yang bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi ldan pa'i 'du byed ming ngam don nam mtshan ma'i don la de'i tshe dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba la yang bden pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not true that at that time the mind is focused on the meaning of the name, the meaning of the sign, or the meaning of the non-associated compositional factor.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar ming sogs sngar ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar ming sogs sngar ni /
translated: Why is it not true?üîΩBecause it has already been refuted as follows:

original: ming sogs brjod pa yin na 'chad pa po //
analyzed: ming sogs brjod pa yin na 'chad pa po //
translated: If the name, etc., were expressed first,

original: nyan po brjod bya rjes 'brel can //
analyzed: nyan po brjod bya rjes 'brel can //
translated: then the listener would not be connected to the expressed meaning.

original: ming sogs 'brel pa med pa can //
analyzed: ming sogs 'brel pa med pa can //
translated: The name, etc., would not be connected to the meaning.

original: don la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag zin to //
analyzed: don la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag zin to //
translated: One would not engage with the meaning.

original: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa 'di ni 'bad rtsol gyis 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa 'di ni 'bad rtsol gyis 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: However, this conceptual consciousness engages through effort.

original: shes pa rnams kyi go rims 'di ni don ldan min /
analyzed: shes pa rnams kyi go rims 'di ni don ldan min /
translated: This order of consciousnesses is not meaningful.

original: de las gzhan pa dbang po'i nus pa la sogs pa'i rkyen yod na yang don nye ba na yod na yang de dag mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dbang po'i nus pa la sogs pa'i rkyen yod na yang don nye ba na yod na yang de dag mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even when the conditions such as the capacity of the sense faculties are present, they do not arise when the object is present.

original: de gal te rnam par rtog pa'i rnam bar shes pa 'di yang don dang ldan par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de gal te rnam par rtog pa'i rnam bar shes pa 'di yang don dang ldan par 'gyur na /
translated: If this conceptual consciousness were also connected to the object,

original: 'bad rtsol tsam gyis skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol tsam gyis skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not arise merely through effort.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa tsam dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid ni /üîΩ'dod tsam rjes 'brel can nyid phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa tsam dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid ni / 'dod tsam rjes 'brel can nyid phyir //
translated: For the nature of something that is related to mere desireüîΩis to follow after mere desire.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows after and conforms to the presence and absence of desire.

original: don gyi bya ba 'di la nus pa ste /
analyzed: don gyi bya ba 'di la nus pa ste /
translated: It is capable of the activity of an object.

original: don gyis nus pa 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: don gyis nus pa 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: But it is not established as capable of the activity of an object.

original: de ltar na don 'ga' zhig gang las yul yin /
analyzed: de ltar na don 'ga' zhig gang las yul yin /
translated: In that case, how can any object be the object of a cognition?

original: 'das pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa'i yul gyi rnam pa can yin pa bla ste /
analyzed: 'das pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa'i yul gyi rnam pa can yin pa bla ste /
translated: It is not tenable that the object of a cognition that perceives the past is the form of the object.

original: nyams su myong ba yul gyi rnam pa can yin no zhes bya ba de gang las yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba yul gyi rnam pa can yin no zhes bya ba de gang las yin zhe na /
translated: How do you know that the object of a cognition is the form of the object?

original: 'di ltar shes pa 'di 'dra dran yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa 'di 'dra dran yin na /
translated: If you say that this kind of cognition is memory,

original: 'das pa'i don du snang ba can //
analyzed: 'das pa'i don du snang ba can //
translated: then the object of memory is the past object.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de dran pa yin no //üîΩde yang myong ba bdag las byung //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de dran pa yin no // de yang myong ba bdag las byung //
translated: The mental cognition that is memory is the object of memory.üîΩAnd that memory arises from the experience of the object.

original: dran pa de yang shin tu gsal bar myong ba las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dran pa de yang shin tu gsal bar myong ba las byung ba yin no //
translated: That memory arises from a very clear experience of the object.

original: nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de yang don gyi rnam pas stong par 'dod na dran pa de dang de ldan te don gyi rnam pa can ji ltar yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de yang don gyi rnam pas stong par 'dod na dran pa de dang de ldan te don gyi rnam pa can ji ltar yin pa nyid do //
translated: If you maintain that the experience is empty of the aspect of the object, then how could that memory possess the aspect of the object?

original: de ltar na don gyi rnam pas stong pa'i myong ba gang yin pa de las don de'i rnam pa can gyi dran pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na don gyi rnam pas stong pa'i myong ba gang yin pa de las don de'i rnam pa can gyi dran pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the memory of that object would not arise from the experience that is empty of the aspect of the object.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig don gyi rnam pas stong pa gang yin pa de las byung ba'i chos can gyi dran pa yang don de'i rnam pa can du 'byung ba ma yin te /üîΩdper na bum pas stong pa'i snam bu nyams su myong ba las snam bu'i dran pa 'byung ba yang bum pa'i rnam pa can ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig don gyi rnam pas stong pa gang yin pa de las byung ba'i chos can gyi dran pa yang don de'i rnam pa can du 'byung ba ma yin te / dper na bum pas stong pa'i snam bu nyams su myong ba las snam bu'i dran pa 'byung ba yang bum pa'i rnam pa can ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: The application is this: that which is empty of the aspect of the object does not give rise to a memory that possesses the aspect of that object.üîΩFor example, the memory of a cloth does not arise from the experience of a pot that is empty of the aspect of cloth.

original: sngon po'i dran pa yang sngon po'i rnam @230a * //
analyzed: sngon po'i dran pa yang sngon po'i rnam @230a * //
translated: The memory of blue arises from the experience that is empty of the aspect of blue.

original: pas stong pa'i nyams su myong ba las yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: pas stong pa'i nyams su myong ba las yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradiction with a pervasion.

original: gal te nyams su myong ba las dran pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te nyams su myong ba las dran pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: If memory does not arise from experience,

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: then what does it arise from?

original: don las 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don las 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it arises from the object,

original: dran pa de ni don las byung ba min no //
analyzed: dran pa de ni don las byung ba min no //
translated: then memory does not arise from the object.

original: ci'i phyir dran pa'i dus na don zhig cing med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir dran pa'i dus na don zhig cing med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at the time of memory, the object is past and does not exist.

original: dran pa don las 'byung ba yin pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: dran pa don las 'byung ba yin pa ni bla ste /
translated: It is not tenable that memory arises from the object.

original: don gyi rnam pa gang las yin /
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa gang las yin /
translated: What is the aspect of the object from which it arises?

original: gal te yul las skyes pa'i phyir des byas la yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yul las skyes pa'i phyir des byas la yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is produced by the object because it arises from the object,

original: de ltar de myong ba las 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar de myong ba las 'gyur /
translated: then it would arise from experience.

original: gal te yul las skyes pa'i phyir dran pa yul gyi rnam pa can yin na yul yod pa las skye ba de yang yul nyams su myong ba dang mtshungs pa de ltar na yul nyams su myong ba yang yul gyi rnam pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yul las skyes pa'i phyir dran pa yul gyi rnam pa can yin na yul yod pa las skye ba de yang yul nyams su myong ba dang mtshungs pa de ltar na yul nyams su myong ba yang yul gyi rnam pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If memory has the aspect of the object because it arises from the object, then that which arises from an existent object is similar to the experience of the object. In that case, the experience of the object would also have the aspect of the object.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dran pa la so sor snang ba gang yin pa'i don gyi rnam pa de yang med /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dran pa la so sor snang ba gang yin pa'i don gyi rnam pa de yang med /
translated: The aspect of the object that appears in the memory of the aspect of blue, etc. does not exist.

original: rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not reasonable?

original: gsal ba'i rnam pas dpen phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rnam pas dpen phyir ro //
translated: Because it is devoid of the aspect of the object.

original: don gsal ba'i rnam pa mthong ba la snang ba de nyid gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'dzin na de ltar snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gsal ba'i rnam pa mthong ba la snang ba de nyid gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'dzin na de ltar snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the appearance that is seen in the aspect of the object were apprehended by mental consciousness, it would appear in that way.

original: de ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzung bar bya ba la gsal ba'i rnam pas dben pa nyid du snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzung bar bya ba la gsal ba'i rnam pas dben pa nyid du snang ba yin no //
translated: Thus, mental consciousness would appear to be devoid of the aspect of the object that is to be apprehended.

original: yang gi sgra ni rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù should be supplied in each case.

original: don med pa'i phyir yang don gyi rnam pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir yang don gyi rnam pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The aspect of the object does not exist because the object does not exist.üîΩIf it were apprehended by mental consciousness, the object would be different from it.

original: de gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba don tha dad par 'gyur ba de'i tshe ji ltar skyes bu 'ga' zhig dran par byed pas rnam pa de rtogs pa /
analyzed: de gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba don tha dad par 'gyur ba de'i tshe ji ltar skyes bu 'ga' zhig dran par byed pas rnam pa de rtogs pa /
translated: In that case, how could the aspect be understood by someone who is recollecting it?

original: de ltar rnam pa tha dad pa //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa tha dad pa //
translated: In that way, the aspect is different.

original: gzhan dag gis ni shes par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni shes par 'gyur //
translated: It is understood by others.

original: skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis rtogs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis rtogs pa'i dus na /
translated: When the aspect is understood by one person,

original: de la chod par byed pa med pa'i phyir de tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la chod par byed pa med pa'i phyir de tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: because there is no separation from it.

original: de ltar na 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: don nyid yin na yang ji ltar bdag nyid kyi lus kyi nang na gnas pa 'dzin par mi byed pa de ltar bdag la yid kyis gzung bar bya ba'i don gyi bdag nyid de 'brel pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: don nyid yin na yang ji ltar bdag nyid kyi lus kyi nang na gnas pa 'dzin par mi byed pa de ltar bdag la yid kyis gzung bar bya ba'i don gyi bdag nyid de 'brel pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: if the meaning is the self, then just as the self does not apprehend itself as existing within the body, in the same way, the self, which is the meaning that the mind apprehends, would not be related to the self.

original: bdag la rtag tu 'brel yin na //
analyzed: bdag la rtag tu 'brel yin na //
translated: Therefore, it is always related to the self.

original: gzhan gyis rtogs par mi 'gyur na //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs par mi 'gyur na //
translated: But if the other does not understand it,

original: brjod kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brjod kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then even if it is expressed, it will not be understood.

original: khyod ci zhig sems par byed ces 'dri bar byed pa na /
analyzed: khyod ci zhig sems par byed ces 'dri bar byed pa na /
translated: When you are asked, ‚ÄúWhat do you think?‚Äù

original: gang tshe gzhan la smra bar byed pa de'i tshe yang sgra las kyang ji ltar @230b bsam pa de gzhan gyis rtogs bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang tshe gzhan la smra bar byed pa de'i tshe yang sgra las kyang ji ltar @230b bsam pa de gzhan gyis rtogs bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: Even when you express it to another, the other will not understand the meaning that you intend from the sound.

original: rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir bdag dang 'brel pa las gzhan gyis mi 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir bdag dang 'brel pa las gzhan gyis mi 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: But since it is understood, it is not the case that it is not apprehended by the other because of its relation to the self.

original: gzhan yang re zhig gang zhig gzhan gyi lus la gnas pa can gyi dngos po mi 'dzin pa ni rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang re zhig gang zhig gzhan gyi lus la gnas pa can gyi dngos po mi 'dzin pa ni rigs pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is reasonable that the body faculty does not grasp objects that exist in another‚Äôs body.

original: lus kyi dbang po ni phrad pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po ni phrad pa'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the body faculty is a sense faculty that contacts its object.

original: mig kyang chod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig kyang chod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the eye sense faculty does not see what is obstructed.

original: de ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Mental consciousness is not like that.

original: phrad pa'i yul can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dang / chod pa las kyang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phrad pa'i yul can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dang / chod pa las kyang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a sense faculty that contacts its object and because it engages what is obstructed.

original: bdag dang 'brel ba'i phyir 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni la na nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang 'brel ba'i phyir 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni la na nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that it does not grasp objects because it is related to the self.üîΩBecause all beings are related to each mental consciousness through each object of mental consciousness. Therefore, the statement that the self is known by the person is not established.

original: skyes bu thams cad yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul re res rang gi rig pa dang 'brel pa de'i phyir bdag dang 'brel pa'i dkon sgras bstan bar bya ba skyes bus rig pa yin pa de ltar na gzhan gyi lus la gnas pa 'dzin par thal ba
analyzed: skyes bu thams cad yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul re res rang gi rig pa dang 'brel pa de'i phyir bdag dang 'brel pa'i dkon sgras bstan bar bya ba skyes bus rig pa yin pa de ltar na gzhan gyi lus la gnas pa 'dzin par thal ba
translated: It follows that mental consciousness would grasp objects that exist in another‚Äôs body.

original: med do // gal te de ltar yin pa de'i tshe re re dag gis 'brel na yang 'chad pa po nyan pa po'i sems dag gi mtshams sbyor pha ni mi rung ro //
analyzed: med do // gal te de ltar yin pa de'i tshe re re dag gis 'brel na yang 'chad pa po nyan pa po'i sems dag gi mtshams sbyor pha ni mi rung ro //
translated: If that is so, then even if there is a connection between each of the two minds, it is not tenable that the minds of the speaker and listener are connected.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of connection is it?

original: don gcig mngon zhe na bdag nyid can //
analyzed: don gcig mngon zhe na bdag nyid can //
translated: It is a connection that has the same object.

original: don gcig 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: don gcig 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: It is a connection that has the nature of apprehending the same object.

original: ji ltar gcig ci don 'ga' zhig la sems par byed pa des gzhan la khyod don ci zhig la sems par byed ces dris pa na des rang nyid sems pa'i yul gzhan la smra ba de'i tshe de la sems par byed pa de yang 'di snyam du 'di
analyzed: ji ltar gcig ci don 'ga' zhig la sems par byed pa des gzhan la khyod don ci zhig la sems par byed ces dris pa na des rang nyid sems pa'i yul gzhan la smra ba de'i tshe de la sems par byed pa de yang 'di snyam du 'di
translated: When one person is thinking about a certain object and another person asks, ‚ÄúWhat are you thinking about?‚Äù and the first person replies, ‚ÄúI am thinking about such and such an object,‚Äù then the mind of the second person who is thinking about that object is like the first person‚Äôs mind.

original: sems par byed pa'i don 'di nyid nga yang zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems par byed pa'i don 'di nyid nga yang zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The second person thinks, ‚ÄúI am thinking about the same object that he is thinking about.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du nyan pa po dang 'chad pa po'i sems dag gis don gcig la mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su mtshams sbyor ba gang yin pa de mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan pa po dang 'chad pa po'i sems dag gis don gcig la mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su mtshams sbyor ba gang yin pa de mi 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, the minds of the speaker and listener are connected by having the nature of apprehending the same object.

original: bdag nyid ji ltar 'brel pa la yid kyis shes par bya ba mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji ltar 'brel pa la yid kyis shes par bya ba mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind does not apprehend the object as related to itself.

original: 'gyur ba yang yin pa de'i phyir bdag dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa de ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang yin pa de'i phyir bdag dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa de ma yin no //
translated: And because it is changeable, it does not apprehend the object as related to itself.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is the case, but

original: gal te tha snyad gcig 'dra'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te tha snyad gcig 'dra'i phyir /
translated: if the speaker and the hearer are in agreement,

original: 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po sems 'di ltar don gcig la mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de dang rang dang 'brel pa'i don 'dzin pa yin na yang rang bzhin gyi rgyu dang 'brel pa'i yid kyi yul gyi don dag 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhe na
analyzed: 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po sems 'di ltar don gcig la mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de dang rang dang 'brel pa'i don 'dzin pa yin na yang rang bzhin gyi rgyu dang 'brel pa'i yid kyi yul gyi don dag 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhe na
translated: then the mind of the hearer, which is in agreement with the mind of the speaker, apprehends the object as related to itself, because the object of the mind, which is related to its cause by its intrinsic nature, is similar.

original: / de ni de ltar ma yin te //
analyzed: / de ni de ltar ma yin te //
translated: This is not the case,

original: gnyi ga'i mthong ba yod par chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir 'khrul @231a * //üîΩbar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i mthong ba yod par chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir 'khrul @231a * // bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because there is a similarity in the perception of both, and there is error because of the similarity of the object.

original: gzhan dang 'brel pa tshu rol mthong bas 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang gang las 'dra ba'i phyir gcig nyid du mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan dang 'brel pa tshu rol mthong bas 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang gang las 'dra ba'i phyir gcig nyid du mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: The object is not apprehended as related to another, because it is seen only as related to itself.

original: 'gyur ba yang bla ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang bla ste /
translated: It is better to change.

original: de ltar na yang 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po'i sems de dag ni ji ltar don de rang bzhin gyis tha dad pa de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po'i sems de dag ni ji ltar don de rang bzhin gyis tha dad pa de ltar ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the minds of the expounder and the listener are not different in nature from the object.

original: gang la de'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na gcig nyid du mngon par zhen pa snang ba yin te 'dra pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ltar na der snang ba can ni ma yin pa /
analyzed: gang la de'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na gcig nyid du mngon par zhen pa snang ba yin te 'dra pa'i phyir ro // de ltar na der snang ba can ni ma yin pa /
translated: When it does not have that nature, it appears as if it were one, because of similarity.

original: 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po'i shes pa de dag gis /
analyzed: 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po'i shes pa de dag gis /
translated: In this way, it is not the case that the expounder and the listener have a cognition that appears as the object.

original: ji ltar tha dad bdag nyid gzung //
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad bdag nyid gzung //
translated: How can they apprehend the object as having a different nature?

original: don sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid de gzung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid de gzung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not apprehend the object as having a nature that is various.

original: ji ltar don de yin pa de ltar shes pa la snang bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du de 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar don de yin pa de ltar shes pa la snang bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du de 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the object is, so it appears to the cognition; and in that way it is apprehended.

original: gang gi tshe don tha dad pa yang 'chad pa po'i shes pas tha dad par snang ba /
analyzed: gang gi tshe don tha dad pa yang 'chad pa po'i shes pas tha dad par snang ba /
translated: When the object is different, it appears as different to the expounder‚Äôs cognition.

original: de tshe blo don can med 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe blo don can med 'gyur //
translated: Then cognition would not have an object.

original: de'i tshe blo yul med pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe blo yul med pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be without an object of awareness.

original: shes pa'i rnam par smra ba dag la ni tha snyad 'di thams cad ni blo bslad pa can yin pa de ltar klan ka btsal du med do //
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam par smra ba dag la ni tha snyad 'di thams cad ni blo bslad pa can yin pa de ltar klan ka btsal du med do //
translated: For those who speak of the form of consciousness, all of this conventional usage is the corruption of awareness.

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin gyi rnam par shes pa tha dad pa med par rang rig pas 'dzin pa'i phyir de las gzhan gyis kyang rtog par thal ba med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin gyi rnam par shes pa tha dad pa med par rang rig pas 'dzin pa'i phyir de las gzhan gyis kyang rtog par thal ba med do //
translated: For those who speak of reflexive awareness, there is no such fault, because the different forms of consciousness are apprehended by reflexive awareness, just as they are.

original: de'i phyir blo tshul gnyis nyid du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo tshul gnyis nyid du grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the two modes of awareness are established.

original: nyams myong zhes bya ba la sogs pas yul shes pa de'i shes pa'i //üîΩbye brag las ni tshul gnyis nyid //
analyzed: nyams myong zhes bya ba la sogs pas yul shes pa de'i shes pa'i // bye brag las ni tshul gnyis nyid //
translated: The verse that begins ‚ÄúExperience‚Äù and so on explains the cognition of the object.üîΩThe verse that begins ‚ÄúFrom the distinction‚Äù and so on explains the cognition of that cognition.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad pa rtsom par mdzad do //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad pa rtsom par mdzad do //
translated: The verse that begins ‚ÄúThe two modes‚Äù and so on explains the establishment of the two modes.

original: yul shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa ste mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yul shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa ste mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition of the object is the apprehension of form and so on. It is the eye consciousness and so on.

original: yul shes pa de la de'i shes pa ni shes pa ste yul shes pa'o //
analyzed: yul shes pa de la de'i shes pa ni shes pa ste yul shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition of that cognition of the object is the cognition of the cognition of the object.

original: yul gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i shes pa ni rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i shes pa ni rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The cognition that has the aspect of the object is what is meant by ‚Äúrealization.‚Äù

original: de nyi di bye brag yin te yul gyi shes pa nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa'i khyad par las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyi di bye brag yin te yul gyi shes pa nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa'i khyad par las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The qualifier is ‚Äúfrom the special feature of the experience of the cognition of the object.‚Äù

original: de la 'dir blo ni nyams su myong ba'i rnam par bsgrub pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo grub pa nyid yin pa de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dir blo ni nyams su myong ba'i rnam par bsgrub pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo grub pa nyid yin pa de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Here, cognition is established as the nature of the experience of the object, so it is not to be established.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What then is to be established?

original: yul gyi rnam pa can gzhan gyis mi 'dod pa de ltar na des tshul dag gnyis su bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa can gzhan gyis mi 'dod pa de ltar na des tshul dag gnyis su bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: The cognition of the object that is not accepted by others. Thus, it is to be established in two ways.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi shes pa gang @231b yin pa de don du rang snang ba yin no zhes dam bca' gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi shes pa gang @231b yin pa de don du rang snang ba yin no zhes dam bca' gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement of the thesis is: ‚ÄúThe cognition of the object such as form is the appearance of the object itself.‚Äù
